title: Software Solutions Architect
description: Job Title: Enterprise Architect Location: Lansing, MI. Hybrid Duration: 12+ Months Job Description Enterprise Architect General Description: Research, design, document, build, and pilot prioritized topics for value focused delivery. Work closely with ***’s and Vendor Development, Infrastructure, and Service Delivery teams to understand their needs and ensure the best cross agency standard is implemented. Work closely with ***’s  and Vendor development teams to pilot and prove out new technical recommendations. Drive the identification, development, and implementation of key new standards in areas such as: Performance Testing, Security, Event Management, Web UI Framework, .NET Design Standards, Application to Application Communication, Caching, etc. Propose new standards/guidance based on business need, IT need and technology advances. Assist development teams to implement the standards into business applications. Investigate new technology and techniques that should be developed into an agency enterprise architecture standard. Operate as business savvy technical leader across the organization. Influence development teams to design high-quality technical solutions that fit the Enterprise Architecture and standards. Educate application development managers, developers, and business analyst on State Enterprise Architecture Standards. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standard (including Legacy, Core, and Emerging technologies), business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Participate in the development of RFPs. Assist in deployment and management of end-user reporting tools and platforms. Work with IT and business project teams to understand reporting and data warehousing requirements and propose solutions. Document and provide knowledge transfer to the rest of the Enterprise Reporting Team for all solutions. Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks.  Works under general supervision; typically reports to a project manager.  A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Additional preferred skills: Designs and builds relational databases. Develops strategies for data acquisitions, archive recovery, and implementation of a database. Must be able to design, develop and manipulate database management systems, data warehouses and multidimensional databases. Requires a depth and breadth of database knowledge that shall help with formal design of relational databases and provides insight into strategic data manipulation. Responsible for making sure an organization's strategic goals are optimized through the use of enterprise data standards. This frequently involves creating and maintaining a centralized registry of metadata. Capable of performing the role of a database administrator, if needed.
summary: Enterprise Architect responsible for research, design, and implementation of technical standards across the organization.  Collaborates with various teams to understand needs, pilot new solutions, and drive the adoption of new standards.  Focuses on areas like Performance Testing, Security, Event Management, Web UI Framework, .NET Design Standards, Application to Application Communication, Caching, and more.  Investigates new technologies, educates development teams, and influences them to design high-quality solutions aligned with Enterprise Architecture standards.  Experienced with business process reengineering and applying technology to solve business problems.  Participates in RFP development, reporting tool deployment, and data warehousing solutions.  Strong database knowledge, including design, development, and manipulation of relational databases, data warehouses, and multidimensional databases.  Possesses experience with metadata management and can perform database administration tasks if necessary.

title: Senior Manager, Data Engineering (Spark, AWS)
description: Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia Senior Manager, Data Engineering (Spark, AWS) Do you love building and pioneering in the technology space? Do you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, inclusive, and iterative delivery environment? At Capital One, you'll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We are seeking Data Engineers who are passionate about marrying data with emerging technologies. As a Capital One Senior Manager Data Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to be on the forefront of driving a major transformation within Capital One. Team Description: The Card Data Organization team works on the foundational capabilities of how data should be produced and consumed. The environment involves Batch Pipelines involving core technologies such as Scala, Python, Spark, EMR, Glue, Airflow, Step Functions, Delta, Uniform Catalog, Iceberg, DynamoDB amongst many others. The team tackles problems of massive scale, with a critical data footprint that has bottomline business impact, resiliency & availability requiring the best techniques within Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning, all while providing a superior analyst experience on our tools. This team is looking for a People Leader who loves to innovate, problem solve, can lead multiple teams with strong delivery focus, and can build an inclusive and fun culture. What You’ll Do: Collaborate with and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions in full-stack development tools and technologies Lead a team of developers with deep experience in machine learning, distributed microservices, and full stack systems Utilize programming languages like Java, Scala, Python and Open Source RDBMS and NoSQL databases and Cloud based data warehousing services such as Redshift and Snowflake Share your passion for staying on top of tech trends, experimenting with and learning new technologies, participating in internal & external technology communities, and mentoring other members of the engineering community Collaborate with digital product managers, and deliver robust cloud-based solutions that drive powerful experiences to help millions of Americans achieve financial empowerment Perform unit tests and conduct reviews with other team members to make sure our code is rigorously designed, elegantly coded, and effectively tuned for performance Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree At least 8 years of experience in application development (Internship experience does not apply) At least 2 years of experience in big data technologies At least 1 year experience with cloud computing (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) At least 4 years of people management experience Preferred Qualifications: Master's Degree 9+ years of experience in application development including Python, SQL, Scala, or Java 4+ years of experience with a public cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) 5+ years experience with Distributed data/computing tools (MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, EMR, Kafka, Spark, Gurobi, or MySQL) 4+ year experience working on real-time data and streaming applications 4+ years of experience with NoSQL implementation (Mongo, Cassandra) 4+ years of data warehousing experience (Redshift or Snowflake) 4+ years of experience with UNIX/Linux including basic commands and shell scripting 2+ years of experience with Agile engineering practices 6+ years of people management experience Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level. This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days. No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender reassignment, citizenship, immigration status, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under applicable federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site. Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).
summary: Capital One seeks a Senior Manager, Data Engineering to lead a team developing and supporting data-driven solutions using technologies like Spark, AWS, Scala, Python, EMR, Glue, Airflow, Step Functions, Delta, Uniform Catalog, Iceberg, DynamoDB, Redshift, and Snowflake.  This role requires strong leadership, experience in big data and cloud computing, and a passion for innovation.

title: Prior Authorization Nurse Analyst (RN) - REMOTE
description: Who We Are WPS Health Solutions is a leading not-for-profit health insurer and federal government contractor headquartered in Wisconsin. WPS offers health insurance plans for individuals, families, seniors, and group health plans for small to large businesses. We process claims and provide customer support for beneficiaries of the Medicare program and manage benefits for millions of active-duty and retired military personnel across the U.S. and abroad. WPS Health Solutions has been making health care easier for the people we serve for more than 75 years. Proud to be military and veteran ready. Culture Drives Our Success WPS’ Culture is where the great work and innovations of our people are seen, fueled, and rewarded. We accomplish this by creating an inclusive and empowering employee experience. We recognize the benefits of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion as an investment in our workforce—both current and future—to effectively seek, leverage, and include diverse perspectives that fuel agility and innovation on high-performing teams. This results in people bringing their authentic selves to work every day in an organization that successfully adapts to business changes and new opportunities. We are proud of the recognition we have received from local and national organization regarding our culture and workplace: WPS Newsroom - Awards and Recognition Role Snapshot Our Full-time Prior Authorization Nurse Analyst Is a Work From Home Position That Will Assist In Reviewing Medical Documentation For Prior Authorization Requests Submitted. Additional Details Perform review of submitted documentation to assure planned services are medically necessary based on Medicare guidelines. Provide written explanations for non-affirming prior authorization requests. How do I know this opportunity is right for me? If you: Are looking to move away from direct patient care and want to use your nursing knowledge in a new and different way Desire day hours with no on-call work and holidays off Possess strength in defending your decision making based on your clinical knowledge Are technically strong on computers Are self-motivated and work with a great degree of independence Have strong verbal and written communication skillsets What will I gain from this role? Collaborating with a team of both clinicians and non-clinicians Deepening your understanding of Medicare and how the program works Learning about our Hyland OnBase tool which is our content management system used for viewing electronic records Experience working in an environment that serves our Nation’s military, veterans, Guard and Reserves and Medicare beneficiaries Continuous performance feedback Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent post high school (associates) and/or related work experience Active RN license, applicable to state of practice Preferred Qualifications Prior authorization, utilization management, or medical/chart review experience Bachelor’s degree in Nursing 4 or more years of experience in clinical nursing Understanding of Medicare government insurance Remote Work Requirements Wired (ethernet cable) internet connection from your router to your computer High speed cable or fiber internet Minimum of 10 Mbps downstream and at least 1 Mbps upstream internet connection (can be checked at https://speedtest.net) Please review Remote Worker FAQs for additional information Salary Range $66,000 to $68,000 The base pay offered for this position may vary within the posted range based on your job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Work Hours This is a full-time salaried exempt position. Monday through Friday with some flexibility on the start and end time as long as your daily consecutive 8 hour day falls between 6:00 AM CST and 6:00 PM CST. Training is approximately one month and the new hire can chose training hours of Monday through Friday from 7:00 AM to 3:30 PM CST or 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM CST. Work Location We are a remote-first organization and offer remote work in the following approved states: Arizona, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, Nevada, New Jersey, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, Virginia, Wisconsin Benefits Remote work option available Performance bonus and/or merit increase opportunities 401(k) with dollar-per-dollar match up to 6% of salary (100% vested immediately) Competitive paid time off Health insurance, dental insurance, and telehealth services start DAY 1 Employee Resource Groups Professional and Leadership Development Programs Review additional benefits here Sign up for Job Alerts FOLLOW US! Instagram LinkedIn Facebook WPS Health Blog
summary: WPS Health Solutions, a leading not-for-profit health insurer, seeks a Full-time Prior Authorization Nurse Analyst to work remotely and review medical documentation for prior authorization requests. The role involves assessing medical necessity based on Medicare guidelines, providing written explanations for non-affirming requests, and utilizing Hyland OnBase for electronic record viewing.  Ideal candidates possess strong clinical knowledge, technical skills, and communication abilities. The position offers opportunities for collaboration, professional growth, and a competitive salary and benefits package.

title: Director of IT, Corporate Applications
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Bronson Healthcare Group, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today! Love Where You Work! Team Bronson is compassionate, resilient, and strong. We are driven by positivity, which inspires us to be our best and go above and beyond for our patients, one another, and our community. Ready for a rewarding career? Join Team Bronson and be part of the experience. Position Overview: The Director of IT for Corporate Applications is a key position within the technology team, reporting to the executive responsible for application delivery, data analytics, and operational management of supporting technologies. This role oversees a large team, including several direct reports and responsibilities for technical and business analyst functions. Qualifications: Bachelor s degree in computer science, business administration, or a STEM-related field required. Master s degree preferred. At least 10 years of progressive IT department leadership experience at a mid-senior level. High-level technical understanding of data applications, technologies, platforms, and data solution architecture. Experience with enterprise-level corporate and analytics applications/systems in a healthcare environment preferred. Certification in relevant areas such as Epic applications, ITIL, business process management, project management (PMP or similar) preferred. Expert knowledge of health information technology laws and regulations. Interact with all levels of management and important outsiders. Requires tact and communication skills to negotiate and influence others Key Responsibilities: Manage, integrate, design, implement, maintain, and support the corporate information systems portfolio for Bronson s operations. Lead Tier 1 critical applications such as HR systems (WorkDay), finance systems, facilities management, back office operations (M365), and similar services. Develop strategy and oversee day-to-day operations of the enterprise data warehouse, clinical and business intelligence operations, and enterprise analytics initiatives. Manage the portfolio of corporate digital applications and services for Bronson s workforce and community partners. Contribute to strategic plans and innovation ideas for exploring new technologies in corporate operations. Serve as the principal point of representation and liaison with third-party vendors and external affiliates on operational matters. Coordinate resources for planning, analysis, building, testing, training, policy/procedures, development, and issue resolution. Improve standards and accountability for application testing, deployment, maintenance, and evolution activities. Manage change control processes to enhance functions, security standards, user experience, and service level requirements. Analyze functionality and constraints of recommended solutions across systems/platforms/applications. Lead multiple simultaneous assignments to satisfactory conclusions with superior project management skills. Work with corporate and shared service providers to define metrics and KPIs for service delivery quality and performance. Ensure compatibility, interoperability, stability, and usability of solution architecture. Promote the interfacing and control of the organization's current technology and dissemination of technological information. Support the maintenance and operation of network information systems, data center operations, interfaces, security administration, disaster recovery, customer services, and IT planning. Oversee fiscal, operational, and human resources management for the areas of responsibility. Maintain knowledge of federal and state laws related to health information technology, privacy, insurance regulations, audit, billing, and security. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Develop and secure approval of coordinated budgets and guide subordinate managers in budget development. Approve policies and ensure procedures are in place to implement approved policies. Hire, evaluate, develop, and discipline managerial personnel as needed. Establish management control procedures to monitor work volume, efficiency, and service quality. Collaborate with medical and clinical staff to develop organizational goals and plans. Provide leadership in IT policy development and compliance. Ensure safe practices and fair treatment of patients, families, visitors, and customers. Make timely decisions related to compliance, accreditation, auditing, and regulatory requirements. Conduct audits and investigate regulatory compliance. Establish long-range goals and strategies for application ecosystem design and performance. Stay updated on IT trends and regulatory changes. Mentor IT team members and implement professional development plans. Perform special projects and other duties as assigned. Qualifying Statement: The above duties and responsibilities describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not exhaustive. Reasonable accommodations will be made for individuals qualified under the Americans with Disabilities Act. Agency Use Policy and Agency Submittal Disclaimer Bronson Healthcare Group and its affiliates ( Bronson ) strictly prohibit the acceptance of unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies ("Recruiters") in response to job postings or word of mouth. Unsolicited resumes sent to any employee of Bronson by Recruiters, without both a valid written agreement with Bronson and a direct written request from the Bronson Talent Acquisition Department for a specific job position, will be considered the property of Bronson. Furthermore, no fees will be owed or paid to Recruiters who submit resumes for unsolicited candidates, even if those candidates are hired. This policy applies regardless of whether the Recruiter has a pre-existing agreement with Bronson. Only candidates submitted through a specific written agreement with the Bronson Talent Acquisition Department for a named position are eligible for fee consideration. Director of IT, Corporate Applications
summary: The Director of IT for Corporate Applications is responsible for managing, integrating, designing, implementing, maintaining, and supporting the corporate information systems portfolio for Bronson Healthcare Group. This role leads Tier 1 critical applications like HR systems, finance systems, and back office operations. They also develop strategies and oversee the enterprise data warehouse, clinical and business intelligence operations, and enterprise analytics initiatives. The position requires strong technical understanding of data applications, technologies, platforms, and data solution architecture, as well as experience with enterprise-level corporate and analytics applications/systems in a healthcare environment.

title: Director, Global Marketing Capabilities & Operations
description: Position: Director, Global Marketing Capabilities & Operations Job Description: Arrow Electronics guides innovation forward thousands of leading technology manufacturers and service providers. A Fortune 133 company with 2023 sales of $33 billion, Arrow's broad portfolio helps customers design, make, and manage forward-thinking products and services that bring the benefits of technology to as many people as possible. We believe that data-enabled digital capabilities and customer experiences, data-driven decisions, and predictive commercial insights, are all essential to achieving customer value and business growth sustainably and at scale. The Digital organization drives this at Arrow by creating scalable, innovative, value-creating digital strategies, capabilities, and operations for the Global Components business. The Director of Global Marketing Capabilities & Operations will play a pivotal role as a member of the Digital Leadership Team equal parts change agent, master orchestrator, analyst, technologist and pragmatic optimist, with exceptional skills in communication and collaboration. To be effective, this leader must have proven success leading a marketing organization within a complex B2B company structure that demands a highly collaborative approach, be able to operate globally and lead a global organization, influence and spark change/progress, work well in matrixed organizations, and be ready to define and drive a strategic vision for the future of marketing capabilities and operations for Arrow Global Components. This position is fully remote but must be able to travel to an Arrow office location as requested by Arrow leadership What You Will Be Doing: Define, communicate, and lead the strategy for global marketing capabilities and operations aligned to our overall strategic digital and customer experience vision, north star and OKRs/business outcomes. Run global marketing operations for the Global Components business including defining cross-functional and global/local operating model, ways of working and an approach to collaboration. Lead multidisciplinary teams representing a broad set of marketing domains including performance marketing, email and marketing automation, SEO, content strategy and production, demand generation and lead process management. Incorporate regional voices and a deep understanding of domain-specific needs in marketing solution designs and delivery- including regional, vertical market, business and customer segment. Oversee all aspects of marketing operations, including budgeting, resource allocation and performance management. Identify, design and implement scalable process and systems to optimize marketing efficiency and effectiveness, Define and monitor key performance indicators to measure the success and impact of marketing initiatives and enablement. Continuously track, measure and analyze marketing capability performance, leveraging industry trends, best practices and insights as a key input to both continuous improvement and the future strategy and roadmap. Partner with IT to evaluate, select, implement and adopt marketing technology platforms and tools to enhance marketing capabilities and drive outcomes. Prioritize changes, features, requirements and experiments for all marketing capabilities - inclusive of process, tech and data based on the strategy, continuous discovery and customer/user listening, desired outcomes, and an evaluation of both tech and operational impacts, and business and customer value. Partner closely across the digital organization and beyond including global and regional business stakeholders brand and corporate marketing, customer experience and design, product management, engineering, operations and sales to promote and drive understanding and adoption of new/changed marketing capabilities including utilization of martech platforms, tools and processes. Set strategic direction for and lead, manage, coach and mentor a cohesive, collaborative, high performing team of marketing professionals. What we are looking for: 12+ years of experience of progressively increasing marketing leadership experience. Experience in large complex global B2B environment, B2B industrial preferred. eCommerce and online sales / demand generation and account-based capabilities experience strongly preferred. Proven track record of balancing global scale and local relevancy in marketing capabilities and operations, driving marketing transformation and improving operational efficiency. Strong understanding of marketing technology landscape and experience implementing marketing automation and sales enablement capabilities. Proven track record managing a team orientation that is customer-centric, learning based, focused on continuous improvement, and grounded in data-based decisions aligned to outcomes and OKRs. Strong reporting and analytics skills with ability to synthesize complex data points into simple business-focused recommendations. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities and collaborate across functions and teams. Effective communicator: A track record of presenting insights and related high priority topics to executives and peers. Comfortable with public speaking and facilitating large group sessions. Clear communicator with ability to simplify and effectively communicate complex concepts. Excellent collaboration skills working with internal and external stakeholders and across both business and technical teams. High degree of personal integrity; culturally sensitive & empathetic. What's In It For You At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That's why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package. Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance 401k, With Matching Contributions Short-Term/Long-Term Disability Insurance Health Savings Account (HSA)/Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) Options Paid Time Off Tuition Reimbursement Growth Opportunities Discounted RTD Passes, with convenient office location off RTD Light Rail (Dry Creek Exit) On-site Café with Catering Option for Busy Lifestyles 24/7/365 On-site Gym and Lockers, Free for Use to All Employees! Bike Racks And more! Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Arrow about our Employee Referral Process! Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate: $157,700.00 - $250,250.00 Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer. Location: US-CO-Denver, Colorado (Panorama Arrow Building) Remote work employees may be required to be present at the closest designated Arrow office for work-related purposes, at the Company's request and sole discretion. Time Type: Full time Job Category: Business Support EEO Statement: Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy) We anticipate this requisition will be open for a minimum of five days, though it may be open for a longer period of time. We encourage your prompt application.
summary: Arrow Electronics seeks a Director of Global Marketing Capabilities & Operations to lead their digital marketing strategy. This role involves defining and executing marketing operations, managing multidisciplinary teams, and driving marketing transformation. Ideal candidates have 12+ years of experience in B2B marketing, a proven track record of success in global marketing, and a strong understanding of marketing technology. This is a fully remote position with travel to an Arrow office location as needed.

title: Senior Network Support & Automation Analyst
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, V2Soft, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today! V2Soft ( ) is a global company, headquartered out of Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, with locations in Mexico, Italy, India, China and Germany. At V2Soft, our mission is to provide high performance technology solutions to solve real business problems. We become our customer's true partner, enabling both parties to enjoy success. We are committed to promoting diversity in the workplace, and believe it has a positive effect on our company and the customers we serve. Education And Skills Requirements Bachelor s degree, preferably in Computer Science, or a related discipline; Understanding of core IT concepts including networking and access control; Strong written and verbal communication skills Cisco CCNP (Routing and Switching or DataCenter) and proven experience with Cisco Networks WAN Technologies (MPLS), Routing Protocols (Deep knowledge of BGP and OSPF) and supporting technologies (eg BFD) Experience with information security management frameworks such as ISO 27001, ITIL, NIST 800-53, CIS Desired Qualifications Formal Education: Bachelor s degree or equivalent real life experience in Data Networking Cisco CCIE - Routing and Switching (Desired) / Arista ACE Palo Alto PCNSE / ZScaler ZCCA-IA / Fortinet NSE4 / Pulse PCS: Administration and Configuration 10+ years of experience designing and implementing enterprise network and security systems Experience with each of the following required: Network Automation & Simulation Experience (Ansible / Python / GNS3) Broad experience in full stack support environment, able to troubleshoot problems affecting a variety of operating systems both server and workstation 5+ years of experience implementing & managing enterprise firewalls with a specific focus on next-generation feature implementation End-user VPNs - SSL, ESP, host posture checking Proxies - Client, forward, reverse, tunnel/gateway Experience with any of the following preferred: Palo Alto, FortiNet, Cisco ASA & FirePower firewalls Arista & Cisco Ethernet Switches Cisco & Juniper Routers Infoblox IPAM & DHCP Demonstrable hands on knowledge of Cisco Networks, including Switches, Routers, Wireless, Client Hands on knowledge of F5 Networks, Load balancer (LTM, GTM, Vipron). Hands on knowledge of WAN Optimization & SDWAN. Hands on knowledge of Infoblox, including Domain Name Server/ DHCP/ IPAM. Linux experience Hands on knowledge of NetScout and Wireshark to capture and interpret TCP/IP packets to identify problems in the network environment. Basic Skills Root Cause Analysis & Problem Solving- creating options and solutions Continuous Improvement - perpetually looking for a better way Analytical Thinking- using logic and reason Persuasion / Motivation- moving others to action Customer Focus Technical Documentation ***Must Have Ability to Travel within USA, Canada, and Mexico*** V2Soft is an Equal Opportunity Employer ( EOE). - to view all of our open opportunities and to learn more about our benefits. Senior Network Support & Automation Analyst
summary: V2Soft is seeking a Senior Network Support & Automation Analyst with 10+ years of experience designing and implementing enterprise network and security systems. The ideal candidate will have strong Cisco networking expertise, including CCNP and CCIE certifications, and experience with WAN technologies, routing protocols, and information security frameworks. Experience with network automation and simulation tools like Ansible and Python is required, as well as experience with firewalls, VPNs, proxies, and various network hardware. This position requires travel within the USA, Canada, and Mexico.

It includes collaborating with various teams, investigating new technologies, influencing development, educating stakeholders, participating in RFPs, and driving the development of new standards.

title: D365 F&O Technical Architect
description: Job Summary JOB DESCRIPTION The Technical Solutions Architect exists to provide expertise for clients in performing technical business process management activities. The Technical Solutions Architect’s primary focus is to lead the client and to collaborate with the Technical Architecture team in determining best practices and efficient processes. The Technical Solutions Architect utilizes their knowledge of the applications and tools to guide the delivery team and the Functional Architecture team in order to configure and enhance the applications to implement the processes as designed. The Technical Solutions Architect is the lead conduit between business process owners and executives at the client and the technical and the functional teams to ensure the application meets the agreed requirements. Job Duties The Technical Solution Architect will participate in and lead the following job duties as directed: Diagnose: Works with the Functional Solutions Architect to understand the overall scope and approach for the project Oversees all environment management activities Understands the go forward set of applications and the integration methodologies that will be employed Understands initial expectations as it relates to Data Migration requirements Collects non-functional requirements for routine jobs and services that will be required as part of the overall solution Analyze: Coordinates with Functional Architecture team to ensure all enhancement requirements have been collected and to the appropriate level of detail Assists with the identification and documentation of data migration requirements Partners with the Functional Solutions Architect on Independent Software Vendor analysis and implementation Collaborates with the Functional Solutions Architect in reviewing “gap” requirements and their high-level design to ensure technical feasibility and approach Provides high-level estimates for proposed enhancements Recommends strategies for Business Intelligence and Reporting needs Understands key performance requirements Develop: Manages the technical task breakdown for all technical deliverables Provides guidance and support to Technical Consultants on technical tasks Oversees all code management and deployment processes Directs the unit testing process to ensure an acceptable level of quality is achieved before delivering to the client Helps develop the Go-Live strategy Validate: Supervises each wave of testing and code remediation until each deliverable has been satisfied Manages the strategy for performance tuning Deploy and Support: Executes the Go Live deployment plan Provides support for a period after Go-Live to ensure the new processes are functioning as expected and change management has occurred Fosters a positive demeanor, learning attitude and client service mentality with the team Travel – up to 25%, as needed Other duties as required Supervisory Responsibilities Owns and drives completion of key workstreams by team members directed by project leaders Manages project workstreams as directed Mentors and develops entry level consultants and senior consultants Education Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Bachelor’s degree AND six (6) or more years of technical D365 experience leading projects and technical teams, required; OR High School Diploma/GED AND seven (7) or more years of technical D365 experience leading projects and technical teams, required Experience Six (6) or more years of technical D365 experience leading projects and technical teams, required Three (3) or more years in one of the following, required: Enacting software as a business process improvement catalyst Implementing business process improvements Designing and delivering software enhancements Some client facing best practice consulting experience, preferred License/Certifications N/A Software Experience with four or more of the following development technologies, required: X++ .NET/C# SSRS RESTful API Web Services SQL JSON Any additional object-oriented language Experience with one or more of the following implementation technologies, required ADO/Visual Studio/LCS setup and configuration w/ F&O ADO Pipelines and Build Runs (Software Deployable Packages) D365 F&O functional application knowledge Language N/A Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Strong analytical, problem solving, facilitation, documentation, and communication skills Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills Business process analysis, design, and process flow skills Excels at operating in a fast-paced technical environment Keywords: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics Finance & Operations, Dynamics F&O, Microsoft Finance and Supply Chain Management, Microsoft F&SCM, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 CRM, Microsoft Customer Experience Platform, Business Analyst, BA, Requirements Gathering, User Experience, User Enablement, Data Visualization, Software, Custom Applications, Data Analytics, Cloud Strategy, D365 Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, and geography. We offer flexibility and opportunities for advancement. Our culture is centered around making meaningful connections, approaching interactions with curiosity, and being true to yourself, all while making a positive difference in the world. At BDO, our purpose of helping people thrive every day is at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are focused on delivering exceptional and sustainable outcomes and value for our people, our clients, and our communities. BDO is proud to be an ESOP company, reflecting a culture that puts people first, by sharing financially in our growth in value with our U.S. team. BDO professionals provide assurance, tax and advisory services for a diverse range of clients across the U.S. and in over 160 countries through our global organization. BDO is the first large accounting and advisory organization to implement an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). The ESOP stands as a compelling addition to our comprehensive compensation and Total Rewards benefits* offerings. title: Sr. Domain Architect
description: We are: Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and , Interactive, Technology, and Operations services, all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 738,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com. You Are: Most Product Managers, engineers, and designers get to build software systems. Very few get to say with a straight face: “I’m reinventing banking.” Or hospitality, or logistics, or insurance. We’re combining Product, technology, industry expertise, and entrepreneurial experience to massively disrupt our clients’ core businesses. We partner with our clients to propel them into the future and to help create better products and experiences for everyone. We’re doing this by working with leaders in the industry, across Accenture teams, and technology partnerships to help clients re-invent themselves and re-imagine their services as products. Our Product Model Realization team is made up of experienced professionals who bridge the divide between product and technology. We create space for our clients to collaborate, transform and grow while maintaining a focus on delivering business value through technology driven products. Our cross functional team is deeply hands-on, and we pride ourselves in being battle hardened with the ability to think at a strategic level to drive vision and be the first to help our clients embark on the difficult transformation journey with confidence. We lead-from-the-front utilizing our technology thought leaders in conjunction with industry experience to help our clients define a product vision and bring it to life. In this role as a Domain Architect, you will be at the nexus point between business vision, user experience, and technology delivery. Within this role you will follow Accenture playbooks for facilitating activities like strategic event storming, context mapping, and the definition of a product north star. Many times, this journey will come with few mile markers, depending on your experience and creativity to guide our clients to an achievable product portfolio. You will have the opportunity to peer with other Accenture team members in creating and leading teams to solve some of the hardest problems in product vision, definition, and implementation to transform & disrupt established industries Preferred Background in 1 of the following industries: Financial Services: We are in the midst of helping clients fundamentally rethink payments, commercial banking, retirement and other core systems which are 25+ years old. The industry is at a crossroads, and needs help from the outside in order to make most efficient use of capital, retain customers in the face of emerging competition, and compete as the market rapidly changes. This also means discarding existing constraints and preconceptions to develop a modern product-drive portfolio of services which comprehensively meet the businesses needs. We are looking for industry veterans who are tired of the status quo of being asked to retrofit their competitors products onto burning platforms and look-alike services. If you have a vision for next generation financial service offerings, we have a place for you. Specific Experience Minimum 3+ years working as a product owner in an industry leading banking, payments, or capital markets firm OR has been part of defining a product vision for a demonstrably successful fintech product company. Successful discovery and north star definition of financial industry products by domain, translated into successful agile system implementation and operation. OR Aerospace/Defense: Suppliers, manufacturers, and operators in a once-closed ecosystem area being challenged. This brings new partner possibilities & a market force for change to existing organizations. As the Aerospace & Defense industry looks to incorporate new technologies & processes into its physical space, there is more pressure to move from initiative-based mindset to the creation, operation, and decommissioning of product services. All while maintaining the same strict control and quality assurance required of this space. If you’re an industry veteran who wants to help bridge the gap from R&D/POA into product manufacturing without blinders of single project constraints, we have a place for you. Specific Experience: Minimum 3+ years working as a product owner in an industry leading designer, supplier, or manufacturer OR has been part of defining a product vision in a demonstrably successful startup. Military service & experience are a welcome plus. Successful discovery and north star definition of Aerospace/Defense industry products by domain, translated into successful agile system implementation and operation. OR Supply Chain/Logistics: In a world where Just-In-Time logistics is at odds with volatile global economics & disasters, our clients are desperate to build upon their existing expertise with a stronger ability to adapt real-time to changing situations. When the cost of redirecting cargo can fluctuate in minutes, management of supply chain and logistics must merge its short and long-term horizon. This means designing & offering a large portfolio of products & solutions which can often have their availability, cost, and margin change minute by minute. It also means the introduction of new products is a constant, while making sure that undesirable overlap is minimized. If you’re an industry veteran who wants to stop hiding new offerings in old wrappers with manual data fixes & overhead, we have a place for you. Specific Experience: Minimum 3+ years working as a product owner in an industry leading supplier chain manager, retail logistics, or cargo logistics organization. Successful discovery and north star definition of Supply Chain/Logistics products by domain, translated into successful agile system implementation and operation Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 25% to 100% depending on business need and client requirements. What You'll Need: Minimum 4+ years of hands-on experience in a professional setting within an agile team Minimum 4+ years of hands-on experience as a product owner / business analyst- decomposing epics to write user stories and managing a backlog to business value Minimum 2+ years of hands-on experience in desinging and facilitating small scale design workshops to drive outcomes (Domain Driven Design, Event Storming, Design Thinking) Experience with refining and incorporating an Enterprise Domain model, with products aligned to strategic objectives. Experience with guiding teams in translating the vision into actionable goals and features, serving as a bridge between stakeholders, designers, developers, and other team members. Experience in presenting and explaining product management, agile methodologies, and coaching techniques to stakeholders (if you are can explain the purpose of story points, t-shirt sizing, why this team is scrum vs. another team is agile, and what makes a successful team to a random person, you’ve got this) Experience across the entire product delivery lifecycle, taking the Enterprise Domain Model as input to alignment on domain boundaries & scopes to define how functions and processes are executed against the domain model. Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience) Bonus if you have: Experience with multiple agile and scrum frameworks (Agile, Scrum, SAFe) and software's (JIRA, Azure DevOps, Rally, Trello, etc.), certification preferred. Experience in innovative workshop design and facilitation Experience with developing product vision and roadmaps Experience with Domain Driven Design Familiarity with the stages and concepts of Software Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC) Experience designing modern architecture patterns including API and Event Driven Architectures Experience with Behavior Driven Development/Test Driven Development Experience with defining enterprise-level product strategies across 1 a single line of business. Experience defining multiple lines of business concurrently is a plus Familiarity with Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure; namely choosing platform components and assembling application and runtime architecture Alternative cloud provider experience is applicable Professional Skills: Strong Critical Thinking, Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills Strong Communication and Interpersonal Skills. You will be expected to regularly communicate business value for all technical solutions to technical and business program sponsors, including C-suite in some cases Strong visualization skills. You will be expected to create material from scratch or template to communicate methodology & outcomes. Initiative-taking is required. You will likely be given an objective, some constraints, and enough detail to get started. After that, we will expect you to create solutions without direct supervision. Demonstrated leadership, comraderies, and teamwork in a multi-cultural professional setting Curiosity and a desire to continuously learn Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Maryland, New York or Washington as set forth below. We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply. Information on benefits is here. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. summary: Accenture is seeking a Domain Architect to help clients reimagine their services as products. The ideal candidate will have experience in one of the following industries: Financial Services, Aerospace/Defense, or Supply Chain/Logistics. The role involves working with clients to define product vision and implement it, utilizing domain knowledge, agile methodologies, and design workshops. The role requires hands-on experience in product ownership, business analysis, and design workshops. Experience with agile frameworks, software development, and cloud platforms is preferred.

title: Principal Architect
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. What You Do Drive solution designs, deep architectural discussions with internal teams as well as with client and partner technical teams. Handle ambiguity in requirements and solutions. Drive commercially viable and winning solutions apt for the local market. Acts as Face of Technology with global clients and partners. Should be comfortable with Cloud, Application architecture, Agile principles, and Cost estimations. Acts as Face of technology for your projects with all teams across VUE (Operations, Marketing, Content Development, Legal, Program Management and Business Development) Reporting to Head of VUE Architecture, closely collaborate as needed with all VUE Enterprise Architects, product/platform Architects and Cybersecurity teams. Should be able to present to Technology executives and VUE SET (Senior Executive Team) for decisions. Closely working with Product Manager, Project Manager, Business System Analyst, and Quality Engineer, you’ll oversee and support the execution by partner teams. Provide architectural leadership to Enterprise UI Framework team May be required to travel occasionally as needed. What You Bring Experience in Cloud native solutions, full stack application architecture and development, Agile practices. Technical and Architectural leadership Great collaborative skills Great communication skills to be able to work with local clients and partners in Saudi, France, China, India etc Passion to learn and expand knowledge in application of technology for business benefits. Ability to handle ambiguity, find pragmatic path forward to drive solutions and execution. Strong in technology fundamentals and ability to learn any new technologies quickly as required. Mandatory Technical skills - Angular, Java/.NET, Azure/AWS/GCP, Cybersecurity tools, Observability, Microservices architecture, Docker, SQL and NoSQL, ability to navigate Monolith and ball of mud architectures. Preferred skills - React, Traditional MVC web architecture. You'll work alongside of high caliber enterprise architects and collaborate across the organization and clients/partners in this role. Compensation at Pearson is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific location. As required by the Colorado, California, Washington State, New York State and New York City laws, the pay range for this position is as follows: The minimum full-time salary range is between $120k - 130k This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program, and information on benefits offered is here. What To Expect From Pearson Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022? At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson. We value the power of an inclusive culture and also a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to building a workplace where talent can learn, grow and thrive. Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We want a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other group protected by law. We strive for a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities. To learn more about Pearson’s commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, navigate to: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Pearson. summary: Pearson is seeking an experienced Enterprise Architect to lead the design and execution of complex cloud-native solutions. This role will involve collaborating with internal teams, clients, and partners in Saudi Arabia, France, China, India, and other locations to develop commercially viable solutions. The ideal candidate will have experience in full-stack application architecture, Agile practices, and a strong understanding of cybersecurity. They will also have the ability to navigate complex technical challenges and work with diverse teams.  The position offers a competitive salary, benefits, and the opportunity to work with a global team on innovative projects.

summary: Accenture seeks a Domain Architect to help clients re-invent and re-imagine their services as products. The role involves working with clients across various industries like Financial Services, Aerospace/Defense, and Supply Chain/Logistics to define product vision, facilitate strategic events, and lead teams in product implementation. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience as a Product Owner in a relevant industry, a strong understanding of agile methodologies, and experience with Domain Driven Design, Event Storming, and Design Thinking.

title: Regional Finance Controller
description: Position Summary: The Regional Finance Manager is responsible for managing and directing the controlling, finance, and accounting tasks for the Signata USA LLC and acts as functional head of the finance organization of SIGNATA Mexico. This person will be responsible for issuing timely, accurate, and relevant financial statements as well as proactively advise senior management on financial and operating matters to satisfy reporting requirements and improve profitability for the Region (USA & Mexico). Position Responsibilities: Develop the annual business plan / budget for the region (USA & Mexico). Guiding the finance team in Mexico in their financial reporting and accounting analysis to obtain a harmonized picture for the North America region. Direct and review the preparation and development of all financial reporting and accounting analyses (P&L, Cash-Flow, Balance Sheet, Forecasts, etc.) in the region. Develop short and long range financial, accounting, and controlling plans that assist in meeting business unit goals and objectives within region. Establish and ensure appropriate internal controls (i.e., inventory, production, overhead, etc.). Evaluate and promote continuous improvement of operating results; provide Sr. management with deviation analysis on sales and cost side. Develop and manage personnel planning and assist Sr. Management with headcount analysis based on forecasted volume. Ensure the timely completion of monthly and year-end audit, financial, tax reporting. Ensure business unit complies with all financial-related legal and company rules and regulations (i.e. accounting standards, corporate policy, governmental, etc.); manage IFRS/US GAAP processes. Responsible for monitoring all capital and customer tooling spending for business unit approval in coordination with central operations. Analysis of all necessary investments regarding ROI including sustainable tracking to ensure compliance with the underlying business cases. Prepare information for annual insurance policy renewal; review and monitor insurance policies in effect, and coordinate with North America Insurance broker. Review and approve all documents requiring officer signatures (i.e., government forms, contracts, etc.) Provide risk management and financial forecast updates local and HQ executives. Responsible for treasury/cash management; manage local banking relationships and coordinate with central treasury operations, provide weekly cash projections to Headquarters. Responsible for accounts receivable and payable. Manage continuous improvement programs and provide support to team efforts. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, formal training, reviewing professional publications, establishing and expanding professional networks, and participating in professional societies. Ensure compliance with all TS16949 policies and procedures. Perform other duties as assigned. Essential Skills and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Accounting/Finance, or related discipline 5+ years of experience as a financial analyst, accountant, or comparable position/experience 5+ years of experience as a regional finance manager / head of finance Experience in a manufacturing environment, specifically in the automotive and/or electronic components industry Expert-level knowledge of controlling finance and accounting processes In-depth familiarity with plant controlling and accounting principles Proven ability in ad-hoc/critical financial analysis and the generation of monthly executive-level reports (P&L, BS, CF) Proven knowledge and ability in methods of communication, motivation, negotiation, and conflict management skills with a high-level of initiative/drive Expert-level knowledge in Microsoft Office and SAP (functional) Proven organizational and project management abilities Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with a high attention to detail Ability to interface with cross-functional teams and all levels of personnel and management English language competency – both oral and written Ability/willingness to travel both domestically and internationally (up to 25%) Preferred Skills and experience: 3+ year of experience in the durable goods manufacturing industry (corporate or plant environment) Master’s Degree (i.e., M.B.A.) or other professional certifications (i.e., C.M.A., C.P.A., C.F.A., etc.) Experience in the Automotive and/or Electronics industries Spanish language skills Experience with operating in a Maquiladora Setup
summary: The Regional Finance Manager is responsible for managing and directing the controlling, finance, and accounting tasks for Signata USA LLC and the finance organization of SIGNATA Mexico. This role requires experience in a manufacturing environment, particularly in the automotive and/or electronic components industry. The individual will develop and implement financial strategies, ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulations, and provide financial analysis and reporting to senior management.

title: Lansing, MI - IT - DTMB - Agency Services - MDOT - Software Test Analyst 3
description: Job Title: Software Test Analyst Location: Lansing, MI(Hybrid-2 days/week in office, other 3 are remote) Duration: 1 year with possible extension Local candidates ONLY. Detailed Job Duties The Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst is responsible for ensuring the developed solution meets the business requirements, is free of defects, and the quality of the product/application is achieved. The QA Analyst works independently to identify and defines the required tests as well as captures detailed testing progress, defects, and results during each testing cycle and evaluates the overall usability of the IT solution. The QA Analyst is a very hands-on role writing test cases and scripts, working with product owners for approval of test cases, sharing the test cases with development team, documenting test cases in the Azure DevOps tool, testing interface applications, and coordinating test results with the development and QA teams. Agile testing experience is a must for this position. Responsibilities Participates in the requirement meetings and functional design document review meetings to understand the requirements to better author the test cases for the Project. Works closely with business analyst and business to clarify requirements. Prepares the project test plan; and test closure according to standard templates and adheres to DTMB and MDOT policies, standards, and guidelines. Learns new tools identified for use on a Project. Prepares Test Scenarios (project based). Prepares test data and ensures the QA environment is ready for test case execution, including interfaces. Prepares and executes test cases and maintains user story traceability against the user stories/requirements. Responsible for defect management including identification of QAT defects and remediation tracking by maintaining the traceability to user story Prepares and ensures Sprint Sign off after each sprint or as required and obtains sign off from product owners. Works with UX/UI Designer of the Project to assist them adding defect(s) or raise defects in their absence. Works closely with QA Specialist on complex Projects and on unique deliverables for the Project(s) Adheres to all QA processes and procedures. Ensures all QA responsible SEM documents identified for the project are completed, reviewed, and approved in alignment with area processes. Skillsets Required: Experience performing quality assurance and software testing with a thorough understanding of testing concepts and methods in manual and automation. Required: 7 Years Testing experience in the implementation of Agile and Waterfall development projects. Required: 5 Years Experience writing and documenting test cases in DevOps or other Agile tools. Required: 5 Years Experience testing Java-based applications and Oracle database. Required: 7 years Experience developing Agile testing strategies and test plans for multiple related projects. Required: 7 years Experience with reviewing, understanding, and translating Agile User Stories to prepare test cases/scripts. Required: 5 years Experience working independently and in a team environment. Required: 7 years Experience writing test scripts with automation tools. Nice to have: 5 years Experience coordinating the Agile automated testing with the QA and development teams. Nice to have: 5 years Experience in coding with Java to write test automation scripts with Selenium. Nice to have: 2 years
summary: This is a 1-year contract position for a Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst with a focus on Agile software testing. The role involves creating test plans, writing test cases, executing tests, and managing defects within the Azure DevOps environment. The ideal candidate has strong experience with manual and automated testing, Agile methodologies, Java-based applications, and Oracle databases. They will work closely with business analysts, developers, and product owners to ensure the quality of the software solution.

title: Principal Architect
description: What You Do Drive solution designs, deep architectural discussions with internal teams as well as with client and partner technical teams. Handle ambiguity in requirements and solutions. Drive commercially viable and winning solutions apt for the local market. Acts as Face of Technology with global clients and partners. Should be comfortable with Cloud, Application architecture, Agile principles, and Cost estimations. Acts as Face of technology for your projects with all teams across VUE (Operations, Marketing, Content Development, Legal, Program Management and Business Development) Reporting to Head of VUE Architecture, closely collaborate as needed with all VUE Enterprise Architects, product/platform Architects and Cybersecurity teams. Should be able to present to Technology executives and VUE SET (Senior Executive Team) for decisions. Closely working with Product Manager, Project Manager, Business System Analyst, and Quality Engineer, you’ll oversee and support the execution by partner teams. Provide architectural leadership to Enterprise UI Framework team May be required to travel occasionally as needed. What You Bring Experience in Cloud native solutions, full stack application architecture and development, Agile practices. Technical and Architectural leadership Great collaborative skills Great communication skills to be able to work with local clients and partners in Saudi, France, China, India etc Passion to learn and expand knowledge in application of technology for business benefits. Ability to handle ambiguity, find pragmatic path forward to drive solutions and execution. Strong in technology fundamentals and ability to learn any new technologies quickly as required. Mandatory Technical skills - Angular, Java/.NET, Azure/AWS/GCP, Cybersecurity tools, Observability, Microservices architecture, Docker, SQL and NoSQL, ability to navigate Monolith and ball of mud architectures. Preferred skills - React, Traditional MVC web architecture. You'll work alongside of high caliber enterprise architects and collaborate across the organization and clients/partners in this role. title: Chief Financial Investment Officer
description: CFS has partnered with a growing organization that's looking to hire a Chief Financial Investment Officer. Our client is a faith-based nonprofit organization dedicated to alleviating poverty, addressing injustice, and responding to disasters around the world. Their mission is to empower communities to overcome adversity and foster sustainable development through a holistic approach. They are currently looking for a dynamic and visionary Chief Financial Investment Officer (CFIO) to lead their financial strategy and investment initiatives. The CFIO will play a critical role in managing their global financial resources, ensuring sustainable growth, and maximizing the impact of their programs. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional leadership skills, extensive nonprofit experience, and a robust background in global accounting and financial management. This organization offers great benefits, an excellent culture and this position can be fully remote! Chief Financial Investment Officer Responsibilities Strategic Financial Leadership: Develop and implement financial strategies to support the mission and long-term goals. Oversee financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes. Provide strategic recommendations to the Executive Leadership Team and Board of Directors. Investment Management: Manage and optimize their investment portfolio to ensure alignment with their values and financial objectives. Conduct thorough financial analysis and risk assessments to inform investment decisions. Develop and implement investment policies and procedures. Global Accounting and Financial Management: Oversee global accounting operations, including compliance with international accounting standards and regulations. Ensure accurate and timely financial reporting across all regions where they operate. Lead initiatives to enhance financial systems, processes, and controls. Leadership and Team Development: Provide strong leadership to the finance team, fostering a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Mentor and develop staff to build a high-performing finance team. Promote a shared vision of financial stewardship and transparency within the organization. Nonprofit Financial Expertise: Leverage extensive experience in nonprofit financial management to support grant acquisition, donor relations, and program funding. Ensure compliance with all regulatory and donor requirements. Oversee the preparation and presentation of financial statements, audits, and tax filings. Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with key stakeholders, including donors, partners, and regulatory bodies, to enhance financial sustainability and accountability. Represent the organization in financial and investment discussions with external partners and networks. Qualifications For The Chief Financial Investment Officer Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation preferred. Willingness and ability to travel internationally throughout the year. Several years of progressive financial management experience, including senior leadership experience. Proven experience in nonprofit financial management, including global accounting practices. Demonstrated success in managing investment portfolios and making strategic financial decisions. Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and develop high-performing teams. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels. Commitment to the mission, vision, and values of the organization **This position can be fully remote** #INMAY2024
summary: A faith-based nonprofit organization seeking a Chief Financial Investment Officer (CFIO) to lead their global financial strategy and investment initiatives. The CFIO will manage financial resources, ensure sustainable growth, and maximize the impact of their programs. Responsibilities include strategic financial leadership, investment management, global accounting and financial management, leadership and team development, nonprofit financial expertise, and stakeholder engagement. This fully remote position requires a degree in finance, accounting, or business administration, CPA or CFA designation preferred, several years of progressive financial management experience, proven experience in nonprofit financial management, and strong leadership skills.
