title: Sr FP&A Analyst
description: Position Description Our client is looking for a Sr FP&A analyst to handle a broad range of business and financial issues that empower their executive team prepare for and make broad, tactical and strategic business decisions. As a Sr FP&A Analyst, you will collaborate closely with our client's executive management team to develop business strategies, produce key reports, and tackle the most complex challenges. This dynamic and high-potential position will enable you to quickly master financial statement analysis, forecasting, valuation, investment analysis, and operational strategy. Key Relationships This role reports to the Manager of Financial Planning and Analysis and will support and interact with both domestic and international businesses, as well as C-level corporate executives. Duties: Prepare and analyze financial information and reports. Assist with consolidation and analysis of monthly forecasts and annual budgeting processes. Prepare financial presentations for the Board of Directors and Senior Management. Develop financial models to support decision-making for various stakeholders. Develop relationships with multiple levels of business unit financial teams. Support M&A due diligence. Conduct ad hoc reporting and analysis. Report key metrics/KPIs to management. Required Attributes, Skills, and Abilities: Proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint. Solid understanding of financial statements. Strong interpersonal skills and integrity. Proven problem-solving ability. Desire to learn quickly and take on additional responsibilities. Strong financial modeling skills. Effective communication skills, both written and oral, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to colleagues and management. Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized. Excellent conceptual, critical thinking, analytical, and quantitative skills. Must be self-motivated, independent, and driven toward superior effort and performance, with a desire to work in a dynamic environment. Our client requires candidates have a their bachelor's in accounting, or finance, 3 plus years of overall experience, and is preferring candidates with more advanced education and/or credentials.
summary: Sr FP&A Analyst responsible for financial analysis, reporting, forecasting, budgeting, and supporting strategic decisions for a company. The role involves working closely with executive management and various business units, including M&A due diligence.

title: Departmental Analyst 9-P11
description: Job Description The Department of Technology, Management and Budget supports the business operations of the state agencies through a variety of services including Information Technology project delivery, maintenance and support. This position is with the Agency Services area of DTMB. This position will perform a range of professional assignments involving research and analysis to evaluate, assess, plan, develop and implement the Eligibility’s area operations and/or services and perform various duties, both analytical and administrative, to meet the needs of for the BRM that supports DHHS Eligibility, including analyzing performance of business and administrative activities of the Bridges Resource Center (BRC) to ensure customer satisfaction and serving as a resource to provide advice to the agency BRC concerning help desk activities and reporting issues for all Eligibility applications in accordance with all policies and procedures. This position includes developing and improving existing procedures to streamline workflows and problem resolution, it will oversee the daily processes within Eligibility runs smoothly. This position will research issues and provide reports and solutions. Lead in on and offboarding resources for the Eligibility division in accordance with DTMB policies and procedures to ensure all access granted is based on requirements of the work being performed. Track purchases, time management, provide specific reports as and when requested by Division Director. Track and report equipment and software inventory to ensure all equipment is accounted for and properly secured following department processes and procedures. Support and backup Eligibility financial business analyst to track procurement and billing and working with DHHS Financial to ensure quality of service. Research issues and provide reports and solutions. Lead in on and offboarding resources for the Eligibility division in accordance with DTMB policies and procedures to ensure all access granted is based on requirements of the work being performed. Assist and work closely with BRM, Financial Analyst, and aid SAM15s and ITM14s in monitoring time tracking and reporting in Clarity and SIGMA for the Eligibility area. Departmental Analyst 9-P11 - Position Description If you are a self-motivated person who wants a challenge and to work in a high paced environment, we are really interested in hearing from you. The state of Michigan offers a competitive work experience that includes a tuition reduction program at several key higher education institutes to help meet your educational and career goals. We offer health, life, dental vision, and disability insurances. Our employees enjoy paid parental leave, up to 9% match with 401(k), flexible spending accounts, excellent vacation and sick time policies, 14 holidays, and the ability to achieve work-life balance. Apply today to join the state of Michigan employee family! Required Education And Experience Please submit a copy of your official college transcripts with your application. ** Education Possession of a bachelor's degree in any major. Experience Departmental Analyst 9 No specific type or amount is required. Departmental Analyst 10 One year of professional experience. Departmental Analyst P11 Two years of professional experience, including one year of experience equivalent to the intermediate (10) level in state service. Alternate Education And Experience Departmental Analyst 9 - 12 Educational level typically acquired through completion of high school and the equivalent of at least two years of full-time active-duty experience at or above the E-6 level in the uniformed services may be substituted for the education requirement. Additional Requirements And Information If applicable, attach copies of official college transcripts to your application. (Internet version of transcripts will not be accepted). Failure to attach applicable transcripts may result in your application being screened out. Your application for any position does not guarantee that you will be contacted by the Department/Agency for further consideration. Only those applicants interviewed will be notified of the results. The department reserves the right to close this posting prior to its original end date once a sufficient number of applications have been received. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire. The office of Career Services offers current state employees and interested applicants access to the job application process and a variety of career planning resources. View the job specification at: http://www.michigan.gov/documents/DepartmentalAnalyst_12505_7.pdf
summary: The Department of Technology, Management and Budget (DTMB) is seeking a Departmental Analyst to support the Eligibility area of the Bridges Resource Center (BRC). This position involves research, analysis, and implementation of operations and services, including performance analysis, customer satisfaction, help desk support, and workflow optimization. The analyst will also manage resources, track purchases and equipment, provide reports, and collaborate with other departments. The ideal candidate is self-motivated and enjoys a fast-paced environment.

title: IT Business Systems Analyst
description: With more than 120 operations and approximately 20,000 employees worldwide, Precision Castparts Corp. is the market leader in manufacturing large, complex structural investment castings, airfoil castings, forged components, aerostructures and highly engineered, critical fasteners for aerospace applications. In addition, we are the leading producer of airfoil castings for the industrial gas turbine market. We also manufacture extruded seamless pipe, fittings, and forgings for power generation and oil & gas applications; commercial and military airframe aerostructures; and metal alloys and other materials for the casting and forging industries. With such critical applications, we insist on quality and dependability – not just in the materials and products we make, but in the people we recruit. PCC is relentless in its dedication to being a high-quality, low-cost and on-time producer; delivering the highest value to its customers while continually pursuing strategic, profitable growth. In 2016, Berkshire Hathaway, led by Chairman and CEO Warren E. Buffett, acquired Precision Castparts Corp. Summary Job Description This position will improve IT systems across all business units; improve productivity and information flow throughout the Company; assist the IT team to keep the systems functioning in an orderly manner; act as senior programmer / analyst for IT applications; assist users through computer related issues. Essential Functions Work safely. Adhere to all Company and regulatory EH&S policies and procedures. Adhere to all Company 6-S initiatives and policies. Identify and solve problems for the programmers and system users. Write, test, debug, and document application programs. Train users in methods and capabilities of on-line applications and software. Assist in training of new IT personnel. Keep informed with current IT technologies, specifically that which relates to the Company’s requirements and equipment. Accept after-hour phone calls in emergency situations. Assist in program management and issue resolution to avoid service interruption. Assist in management of changes to all software, data tables and network configurations for IT applications. Assist in user administration including new user set-up, maintain security levels, user profiles and termination of user privileges. Assist in vital record management including data storage, back-up, and recovery procedures. Work with vendors to support additional software applications as needed: LIMS, ABS, shop floor data collection. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Education and Experience Four-year degree in Computer Information Systems or a related field of study, and a minimum of three (3) years of programmer/analyst experience. Skills Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. Excellent oral and written communications skills including the ability to interface with all levels of the organization. Instructional skills – ability to teach others. Adaptability – open to new methods and changes in technology to address work related issues or problems. Familiar with Microsoft Office products. Drive and initiative. Expertise using Glovia / G2, Syteline Cloud, LIMs and other ERP, MES and QMS systems. Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. Detail oriented. Ability to comprehend a variety of complex problems, collect data and translate information into a user-friendly application program. Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to interface with all levels of the organization. Initiative. Customer oriented. Familiarity with MS SQL server administrations: (database, backup, restore, archiving, and security). Familiarity with SQL programming. Power BI Report administration. Working knowledge of Microsoft Integration Services. Ability to write and maintain Powershell Scripts. Adaptability – open to new ways and change in technology to address work related issues and problems. Additional Notes Occasional work required outside normal business hours. Must be able to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc. Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, scanner/copier, and printer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work Environment – Work primarily in a climate-controlled environment with minimal safety/health hazard potential. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Additional Notes The Company retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. Proof of US citizenship, nationality, and/or permanent resident status in order to comply with all applicable export and import laws and regulations. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. This position requires use of information or access to production processes subject to national security controls under U.S. export control laws and regulations (including, but not limited to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR)). To be qualified to work in this facility, a successful applicant must be a U.S. Person, as defined in those regulations, and able to supply evidence of that qualification prior to starting work or be authorized to receive controlled information under a specific license or permission from the relevant government agency. The U.S. export control regulations define a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. National, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), and certain categories of Asylees and Refugees.
summary: Precision Castparts Corp. (PCC) is seeking a Senior Programmer/Analyst to improve IT systems across all business units, enhance productivity and information flow, and provide technical support to users. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent communication skills, and experience working with ERP, MES, and QMS systems, specifically Glovia/G2 and Syteline Cloud. title: Senior Financial Analyst - Cost Estimation
description: Henniges Automotive has an opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst to join the Cost Estimation team. The Senior Financial Analyst will be responsible for providing quotes and product costs for current and future business by developing and reviewing the business case and ensuring that it is a competitively and financially sound opportunity for the company to pursue. Qualifications/Requirements Responsible for analyzing customer requests for quotes (RFQ), ensuring that the information provided by Engineering, Program Management, Sales, and Manufacturing balances to meet the customer’s needs and the program’s profitability. Compile and analyze all financial factors to make viable financial and logistical recommendations to respond to customer requests for quotes (RFQ). Develop financial models based on current market price, plant location, plant capacity, and capability to meet the needs of the provided quote. Develop and analyze calculations for contribution margins, testing costs, and for amortizations of minimum purchases of raw materials and tooling. Generate multiple iterations of cost sheets and financial models for side-to-side comparisons of multiple and alternative material options, multiple equipment processing options, and multiple labor staffing scenarios across multiple plants and manufacturing locations. Collaborate with the customer business units to complete cost breakdowns and submit quote packages to the customer in a timely fashion. Create cost comparisons with surrogate parts. Assist the Executive team via the creation and analysis of manufacture vs. purchase business cases to guide them in making sound business decisions. Consult with design and process engineers to calculate cost estimates of materials, labor, processes and equipment utilization. Support Program Management with financial analysis of awarded programs for gateway reviews. Continuous improvement activities. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship. Local candidates only. Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting. Minimum: Knowledge and skills typically acquired through 5 plus years of experience in manufacturing cost accounting, cost estimation, or related field. Basic knowledge of materials, design, and manufacturing process is a plus. Skills and Abilities Consulting and influencing skills consistent with the ability to build relationships and influence parties; may include getting parties to embrace changing expectations and initiatives. Communicates effectively (verbally and in writing) with individuals at all levels, inside and outside the company. Analytical and problem-solving skills consistent with identifying key issues from a broad range of alternatives and recommending optimal solutions for various situations. Develops challenging short-and long-term group plans and objectives aligned with those of the department and/or company; solicits staff input in the development process. Working knowledge of automotive manufacturing processes, practices, and challenges. Ability to apply project planning, implementation, and/or continuous improvement principles to affect tangible, positive outcomes. Proficiency in the following software applications: Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook; sufficient to apply and/or support the application with minimal instructions or guidance; this level of proficiency is typically attainable through 3 plus years of substantive experience with the applications. Promotes an atmosphere conducive to the open exchange of new ideas and alternatives to orthodox approaches. Deals effectively with resistance; takes positive steps to avoid the recurrence of errors through constructive critique.
summary: This position involves providing quotes and product costs for current and future business by developing and reviewing business cases. The Senior Financial Analyst will be responsible for analyzing customer requests for quotes (RFQ), compiling financial data, developing financial models, and collaborating with various departments to ensure that quotes are competitive and financially sound. They will also provide cost breakdowns, assist with manufacture vs. purchase business cases, and support program management with financial analysis.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: Simon Group Holdings (SGH) is a private equity firm and family office that was established in 1985 with the founding of the Atlas Oil Company. SGH has diverse business interests including energy supply & marketing, oil field services, logistics and transportation, amateur & professional sports, alcoholic spirits, real estate, technology incubation, aerospace and defense, and insurance solutions. We are seeking a Senior Financial Analyst with 3-5 years of experience, preferably in Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A), data analysis, or investment banking, to join our team. The Senior Financial Analyst will report to the Director of Finance and will be instrumental in budgeting, forecasting, strategic planning, capital expenditure requests, and handling various ad hoc requests as they arise. Primary Responsibilities: Budgeting and Forecasting: Develop, analyze, and interpret financial information to forecast future financial performance and assist in budgeting processes. Strategic Planning: Lead the creation of long-term strategic plans, including identifying financial trends and providing insights to support business decisions. Capital Expenditure Requests: Evaluate capital expenditure requests using financial metrics such as Net Present Value (NPV), Discounted Cash Flow (DCF), and Internal Rate of Return (IRR). Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A): Conduct comprehensive analyses of potential M&A opportunities, including due diligence, valuation, and integration planning. Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights. Reporting: Prepare and present concise and insightful financial reports and presentations for management and senior operational roles, highlighting key performance indicators and trends. Ad Hoc Requests: Address various ad hoc financial requests and projects as needed. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in financial analysis, with a strong background in M&A, data analysis, or investment banking. Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint are required; experience with PowerBI is a strong plus. Proven ability to develop thorough financial analyses from the ground up and effectively communicate reasonable, accurate, and defendable conclusions. Excellent communication skills, with a collaborative mindset and ability to thrive in a high-energy, high-impact environment. Preference will be given to applicants pursuing or holding a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation or similar professional certification. Benefits: Medical insurance Vision insurance Dental insurance 401(k) Disability insurance Start Date: The start date will commence two weeks after the candidate has been hired. Disclaimer: This is not intended to be an exhaustive listing of all skills, duties, or responsibilities associated with the job. Management reserves the right to revise the job or to require other or different tasks to be performed should circumstances change (e.g., changes in personnel, workload, or technological developments). Equal Employment Opportunity: Simon Group Holdings provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, weight, height, or military status in accordance with applicable federal laws.
summary: Simon Group Holdings (SGH), a private equity firm with diverse interests in energy, logistics, sports, real estate, and technology, is looking for a Senior Financial Analyst with 3-5 years of experience in M&A, data analysis, or investment banking. The role involves budgeting, forecasting, strategic planning, capital expenditure analysis, M&A due diligence, and data-driven insights. Strong Excel, PowerPoint, and PowerBI skills are required. Preference is given to CFA candidates. The position offers benefits like medical, vision, dental, 401(k), and disability insurance.

title: GIS Analyst
description: Title- GIS Analyst Location- Onsite, Detroit, Michigan ( Candidate MUST be local to MI) Linkedin must. Jd- Additional Information Candidate MUST have at least 10 years of total IT experience* Candidate MUST be local to MI Project Scope The Technology Services department of the Wayne County Airport Authority is responsible for providing and managing the Airport Authority’s technology needs for both Detroit Metro (DTW) and Willow Run (YIP) airports. The Airport Authority is seeking full-time, local qualified candidates who will utilize their knowledge, skills, and abilities to serve as a GIS Analyst. In this role, the ideal candidate will demonstrate a solid understanding of GIS theory and applications; possess clear understanding of ArcGIS Enterprise architecture, applications, and functionality; identify, understand, and articulate solutions for business objectives through knowledge in ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Desktop, Survey123, ArcGIS Collector, and other related ArcGIS technologies. Technology Services is seeking a qualified, full-time candidate who will utilize their knowledge and expertise to: Roles/Responsibilities Preform a wide variety of analytical and geoprocessing functions to create, maintain and retrieve data Monitor of GIS environment – GIS Enterprise Portal (ArcGIS Server/Portal), ArcGIS Online, and SQL Relational database Develop GIS solutions using ArcGIS software to enhance existing and future GIS projects Responsible for meeting with the business and evaluating project/request requirements and providing guidance/solutions accordingly. Develop geographic databases, including designs and models. Comprehensive working knowledge of database concepts (including SQL DB) Assist with field data collection using ArcGIS Survey123 and ArcGIS Collector Assist with training and technical support of end users and stakeholders Mandatory Skills The successful candidate should have a broad business background, good interpersonal communications skills and a thorough understanding of GIS theory and applications. For consideration, the candidate must meet the following minimum qualifications: B.S. in Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Computer Science, or a closely related field Minimum 5 years of related experience as a GIS Analyst working with ESRI Product suite Minimum 5 years’ experience related to Geodatabase management procedures, and relational databases Minimum 3 years’ experience of GIS programming/scripting languages (Python, SQL) Minimum 3 years’ experience with Autodesk’s AutoCAD, BIM, and the conversion into GIS Strong written and oral communication skills Attention to detail, customer focus, teamwork, and interpersonal skills Desirable Skills The ideal candidate will also have: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and easily transition from one task to another to complete projects in a timely manner Certificate and/or Licenses: Geographic Information Science Certificate or equivalent General knowledge of Maximo Asset Management System Experience with subsurface utility mapping Experience with interior building mapping and wayfinding Experience working with 3D GIS software (ArcScene)
summary: The Wayne County Airport Authority seeks a GIS Analyst with at least 10 years of IT experience to join the Technology Services department. The role involves performing analytical and geoprocessing functions, monitoring the GIS environment, developing GIS solutions using ArcGIS software, creating geographic databases, assisting with field data collection, and providing training and technical support. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of GIS theory and applications, experience with ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Desktop, Survey123, ArcGIS Collector, and other related technologies, and proficiency in database management, GIS programming/scripting languages (Python, SQL), and AutoCAD/BIM.

title: Senior Financial Analyst

summary: Senior Financial Analyst role focused on financial modeling, consolidations, and analysis. Responsibilities include building and maintaining financial models, consolidating financial statements, analyzing data and trends, assisting with budgeting and forecasting. title: Senior Analyst, Revenue Operations (Hybrid)
description: We are excited to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces by Fortune Magazine! We are proud to offer you 12 paid holidays annually. For an overview of our benefits and time off, please follow this link to learn more:US Stryker employee benefits. Who We Want Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure business goals and objective are met Business-oriented evaluators. People who effectively interpret information to demonstrate the effects of business initiatives, regulation and industry trends for sales, management and leadership teams. Collaborative partner. Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships, influence and partner with business leaders in multiple functional areas What You Will Do The Senior Analyst in Revenue Operations plays a pivotal role in the success of the organization by delivering data-driven insights, improving processes, and offering strategic guidance to enhance revenue growth and operational effectiveness. This position requires collaborative efforts across sales, marketing, and customer success departments to refine the entire revenue cycle. Works collaboratively to execute a strategic plan to meet revenue commitments and customer expectations. Drives a process-focused mentality through the organization to ensure the processes established by the teams are understood and followed across the enterprise. Analyze sales, marketing, and customer success data to identify trends and develop and implement strategies to drive revenue growth. Identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies in revenue generation, developing strategies to eliminate waste in the order to cash process. Identify and implement process improvements to streamline operations. Acts as process owner for Customer loyalty financial program Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance metrics. Assist in the revenue forecasting for Emergency Care, including analyzing historical data and current trends and developing strategies to maximize revenue attainment. Works collaboratively across customer-facing teams, including marketing, customer service, finance, and sales, to drive rapid response to customers. Respond to numerous inquiries and ensure proper asset details are updated in the appropriate systems. Develop informative metrics that drive improvement of service levels, internal processes, and customer support methodology. Consistently demonstrate a positive, constructive, and cooperative attitude in the business environment. What You Need Bachelor’s degree in business management or a related field 2+ years of experience Experience with Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Power BI. Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint skills are required. You will need to live within commuting distance to our Portage, MI office. You will need to be in the office 2-3 days a week (Mon-Wed), but you will have the flexibility to work from home on the other days. Health benefits include: Medical and prescription drug insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, critical illness insurance, accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, personalized healthcare support, wellbeing program and tobacco cessation program. Financial benefits include: Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance. Stryker offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually. Depending on customer requirements employees and new hires in sales and field roles that require access to customer accounts as a function of the job may be required to obtain various vaccinations as an essential function of their role.

This role requires collaboration across sales, marketing, and customer success departments, as well as a strong understanding of revenue generation, order to cash processes, and customer loyalty programs. The position involves analyzing data, identifying trends and bottlenecks, implementing process improvements, developing reports and dashboards, and assisting with revenue forecasting. At Ford, we're all a part of something bigger than ourselves. As a key member of our Enterprise Technology Group, you'll play a critical part in crafting the future of mobility. If you're looking for the chance to bring to bear advanced technology to redefine the transportation landscape, enhance the customer experience, and improve people's lives, this is your opportunity. Join us and challenge your IT expertise and analytical skills to help build vehicles that are as inquisitive as you are. We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst - SCM Reporting who has techno-functional skills in the automotive supply chain and will bring exceptional collaboration skills and familiar with Agile processes for business value delivery. You should have experience with SaaS implementations for supply chain software and machine learning. Your focus will be to design and be hands-on to develop specifications/reports/products that reflect the customer's needs aligning with technical and business requirements. Understands the structure of workflow systems and processes. Identifies and validates pain points and opportunities with the team for impactful solutions. Researches, imagines, and designs highly usable and intuitive solutions for products and services to solve customers' problems that align with targeted business opportunities. Responsible for end-to-end design and development of Qlik, PowerBI, or related reporting applications and dashboards including mockups. Analyze, design, and define new or re-engineered business processes to propose powerful analytics solutions to enable informed decision-making. Collaborate with cross-functional technical and functional stakeholders for the implementation of large-scale SC operational dashboards and solutions. Deliver valuable intelligence to the end-user with the least clicks to enable better decision-making. Deliver automation and visualization consistent with Ford processes and standards. Manage day-to-day operations of the SCM reporting system along with development and maintenance. Maintain backlogs and participate in sprint planning and other product management agile ceremonies. Work independently with business users, document the business requirements and pain points, and convert them into powerful analytics solutions. Responsible for unit and integration testing, and provide release management instructions through UAT and production environments. Ensure quality data creation, presentation, and data flow across systems. Clear documentation of work deliverables requirements, design, and mappings, etc; Explore machine learning and Artificial intelligence opportunities. Analyze business requirements and translate them into the BI data layer design to provide meaningful business insights based on BI best practices. The minimum requirements we seek: Bachelor's degree in Arts, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field 7+ years of progressive experience with creating IT solutions to solve business problems. 3+ years of report development experience in Qlik/PowerBI or related tool 1+ years of Implementing Machine learning and Artificial intelligence 1+ years of experience with Supply Chain Management solution 1+ years of Digital Twin design and delivery Prior experience utilizing SQL performing data analysis and consuming data models Our preferred qualifications: Advanced degree in Arts, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field Experience applying AI/ML techniques to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities, using Python and related technologies. Proposing BI solution architecture and articulating best practices in end-user visualizations. Knowledge of forecast, and demand methodologies Experience with Graph-based DB implementations Experience with data analysis and data modeling is a plus. Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and architecture. Experience with Google cloud-based platforms is a plus. Knowledge of Excel and pivot tables to perform analysis on large datasets. Good team player and encourages team learning opportunities like Design Thinking Comfortable working in a dynamic environment where problems are not always well-defined. What you'll receive in return: As an established global company, we offer the benefit of choice. You can choose what your Ford future will look like: will your story span the globe, or keep you close to home? Will your career be a deep dive into what you love or a series of new teams and new skills? Will you be a leader, a changemaker, a technical expert, a culture builder...or all the above? No matter what you choose, we offer a work life that works for you, including Immediate medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage, generous PTO, retirement, and savings plans, incentive compensation, tuition assistance, a vehicle discount program, and much more For information on Ford's salary and benefits, please visit: Please see our Company Profile. Candidates with Ford Motor Company positions must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or protected veteran status. description: Senior financial Analyst is responsible for financial planning, analysis, and reporting within the organization. Responsibilities: Assist in the development of the annual budget and periodic forecasts in collaboration with department heads Monitor and analyze financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identifying variances and recommending corrective actions Prepare financial models and scenarios to assess potential outcomes Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and benchmarks to measure business performance Assist with preparation and distribution of timely and accurate financial reports for internal stakeholders and external parties as required Develop and maintain dashboards and other reporting tools to facilitate data-driven decision-making Works with various ERP software systems and consolidation, data mining and reporting tools Assists in Merger & Acquisition (M&A) valuations Supports ad-hoc reporting assignments as directed Supports travel requirements as required Other duties as assigned Education Requirements: Bachelors degree in Finance or Accounting Experience Requirements: Specific Skills and/or Experience with Software, Equipment, etc. 3-5 years of experience in financial planning, analysis, and reporting Preferred experience with Oracle FCCS/Hyperion Financial Management Knowledge of ERP business management packages Strong analytical skills with proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis tools Strong fluency with Excel formulas and functions Analytical and problem-solving experience with strong attention to detail PowerBI or other data analytics tool experience a plus Additional Information: Due to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and Export Administration Regulations (EAR) requirements, all candidates must be presently classified as a “US Person" which includes: a United States citizen; a permanent legal resident (green card holder); or a protected individual (refugee/asylum status). Clarience Technologies is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce.
summary: Senior Financial Analyst responsible for financial planning, analysis, and reporting. This role involves collaborating with departments, conducting financial analysis, identifying trends, opportunities, and risks, and providing actionable insights to senior management for decision-making.

Posting Summary Looking for a PowerBuilder Developer and IT Analyst with a strong background specialized in PowerBuilder Development (version 7 or higher) and possess advanced skills in T-SQL query writing for Sybase and MS SQL Server databases. Day to day activities include data management, source control (TFS/Azure DevOps, GIT), unit testing, documentation, testing, production support, change management, software development and data integrity. Minimum Qualifications  Some college preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline  PowerBuilder Development (version 7 or higher)  Work in a hybrid office  Willingness to learn Required Skills Job Function Description Years of Experience PowerBuilder Developer Research and modify PowerBuilder source code to document the steps the application uses with data. Current Experience 5 T-SQL Query Writing Resource must have a high level of SQL query writing skills to write complex queries to pull data from a Sybase and MS SQL Server database. Must have experience developing processes to extract and manipulate data to support data migration and data cleansing of application data. 10 Data Management Must have experience in performing data profiling, data mapping, data manipulation, validation, and analysis. 10 Source Control Must have experience working with source control technologies such as TFS/Azure DevOps, or GIT. 5 Unit Testing Must have experience documenting and performing unit testing to support program changes. 10 Documentatio n Must have experience creating, updating, and maintaining documentation for programs, system specs, and flow diagrams. 10 Testing Must be able to work with the client and/or Business Analyst to support test scenarios. 5 Production Support Analyze and document identified problems to determine root cause and provide root cause analysis. 5 Change Management Follow change management procedures and provide input to execute changes. 5

title: Senior Financial Planning Analyst

Responsibilities include: Prepare and analyze financial information and reports Assist with consolidation and analysis of monthly forecast and annual budgeting processes Prepare financial presentations for the Board of Directors and Senior Management Develop financial models to support decision making Work cross functionally with various constituents at corporate office and various operations Provide merger & acquisition due diligence support Ad hoc reporting and analysis Report results of key metrics/KPI’s to management Your skills and experience Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance Three or more years of position related experience Solid understanding of financial statements Advanced level MS Excel skills Quick learner who takes initiative Strong work ethic Strong interpersonal skills What’s in it for you? title: System Analyst
description: Local candidates ONLY. Candidates must be 2 hours of Lansing or Detriot, Michigan. (No relocation candidates) NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION Apply only if you can attend inperson interview and are local to Michigan . This System Analyst position will support LEO – E & T workforce development applications, One Stop Management Information System (OSMIS), OSMIS Dashboard, Career Explorer, Michigan Adult Education Reporting System (MAERS) and Information Management, Performance, and Customer Tracking (IMPACT). Experience Minimum 3 years of experience as System/Business Analyst conducting Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions with Customers and requirement gatherings. Minimum 2 years of experience in software testing Minimum 1 year of RDBMS / SQL experience Preferred experience in Agile/Scrum Experience in SAP BO is a plus Job duties of this position include but not limited to: Requirement gathering, business process analysis/improvement, requirements management and software testing; Assess “As Is” and “To Be” processes and document gaps; collect end-user requirements for improving business processes and software via interviews, focus groups and other stakeholder discussions. Categorize/segment similar requirements and create additional requirements that address client pain points. Maintain up-to-date requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, test plans (in Excel, word docs, Microsoft Azure), and run reports on the same to inform management discussions. Facilitate planning and requirements meetings, understand, and create solutions to improve user experience, agile product development support; participate in Sprint ceremonies. Collaborate with product development team to translate requirements into technical specifications for the proposed solution; design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design. Maintain reusable scripts, technical documentation, and specifications; develop user stories and initial wireframes to guide the architecture of the proposed solution; develop software test plans. Participate in regression testing, quality assurance testing, user acceptance testing and conduct necessary sessions/focus groups with users to capture feedback on functionality being developed within each agile sprint; translate user feedback into refined requirements for development team. Serve as liaison between client business users and development team, communicating and interpreting requirements and technical solutions. Collaborate to elicit new product ideas and improve existing solutions; program management documentation support, including developing high-quality presentations for client meetings; and participate in team and customer meetings, documenting notes and action items; basic knowledge of relational database management systems (RDBMS), Structured Query Language (SQL) and Microsoft products Word, Excel and Visio.
summary: This System Analyst position supports various workforce development applications like LEO – E & T, OSMIS, Career Explorer, MAERS, and IMPACT. The role involves gathering requirements, analyzing business processes, testing software, and collaborating with development teams.

title: Senior Commercial Analyst
description: At AAM, the POWER is in our people. We believe that an equitable and inclusive workplace benefits everyone and that the diversity of our Associates drives creativity and innovation. Our global team of associates is made of dreamers, doers and innovators who are Bringing the Future Faster by Delivering POWER for a safer, brighter and more sustainable tomorrow. As a member of #TeamAAM, you’ll get to make a difference on day one. You’ll have the opportunity to grow, embrace challenges, build your skills and bring your authentic self to work every day, all while helping to shape the future of mobility for AAM…and the world. Job Posting Title Senior Commercial Analyst Job Description Summary We are searching for a Senior Commercial Analyst to contribute to our Finance group within our Metal Forming organization. This role will be based out of our World Headquarters in Detroit. Join the rapidly growing team of motivated financial professionals working as a key member of a cross functional team, involved in activities like quoting new business, costing engineering changes, valuing make/buy scenarios and cost reduction opportunities. The position is responsible for monitoring and reporting the financial health of new programs until start of regular production. Job Description lead and manage all financial responsibilities related the development of Business Cases and Cost Analyses for product programs. Coordinate with other functions to develop a business case and quote for opportunities. Review a bill of material(s) and manufacturing assumptions for reasonableness as part of the process. Assist Sales team in quote preparation and run various pricing / volume scenarios as the need arises. Prepare a cost analysis for every change in program design, sourcing, and or process change. Conduct make vs buy studies and evaluate cost reduction initiatives for financial feasibility. As a member of the launch team, attend weekly team meetings to remain up to date with program changes. Report financial status of product programs at Program reviews with the management team. Support plant finance develop cost models and manufacturing costs / rates. Work with different regions on customer, program, and product margin analysis Collaborate with the capital planning group in budgeting and forecasting process. Actively contribute to departmental initiatives/process improvements to improve the overall department’s efficiency. Support ad-hoc quick cost analysis as per management request Required Skills And Education Bachelor's degree in Finance or equivalent experience. 8+ years in Finance; at least 4 years as Finance Controller, at least 2 years in Cost Accounting. Experience in cash flow analysis Experience with Financial Valuation and modeling Familiarity with ABC Costing Excel skills at least at 80% level About American Axle & Manufacturing As a leading global Tier 1 Automotive and Mobility Supplier, AAM (NYSE: AXL) designs, engineers and manufactures Driveline and Metal Forming technologies to support electric, hybrid and internal combustion vehicles. Headquartered in Detroit with over 80 facilities in 18 countries, AAM is bringing the future faster for a safer and more sustainable future. We work together to support our customers on global and regional platforms with a focus on quality, operational excellence and technology leadership. With our global footprint, we are committed to building an equitable and inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the unique voices of our diverse workforce. Be part of the future with #TeamAAM. AAM will not discriminate against any Associate or applicant for employment because of age, race, color, gender, religion, weight, height, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or other characteristic protected by law. AAM will take affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed, and that Associates are treated equally during employment, without regard to their age, race, color, gender, religion, weight, height, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or other characteristic protected by law. For the Disabled Job Seeker: We offer reasonable accommodations for qualified disabled individuals who are applicants for employment. To request assistance or accommodations, please e-mail TalentAcquisition@aam.com. AAM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters Please note that as per AAM policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that AAM will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.
summary: AAM is seeking a Senior Commercial Analyst to join their Finance group within their Metal Forming organization. The role will involve activities like quoting new business, costing engineering changes, valuing make/buy scenarios, and cost reduction opportunities. The candidate will be responsible for monitoring and reporting the financial health of new programs until the start of regular production.

title: Senior Financial Analyst, Revenue
description: Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to large, Fortune 100 enterprises with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential. Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers. Upwork is looking for a Senior Financial Analyst, Revenue to help make sound financial decisions. Work will include functional business partnering, financial forecasting, modeling business scenarios, tracking performance measurements, and other financial directives. We are looking for someone who is a highly motivated teammate, has excellent attention to detail, can work cross functionally in a team environment, as well as independently. This person will work with various department business partners to understand historical and future revenue and cost of revenue streams, contributing to the company’s P&L forecasting and reporting processes. Your Responsibilities: Lead portions of the weekly/monthly/quarterly forecasting and variance reporting around the company’s topline metrics - analyzing financial results, distilling/synthesizing key trends, and assessing current and future business risks Work with various cross-functional teams (Product, Payments, Accounting, Analytics) to assist forecasting topline metrics (GSV, Take Rate and Revenue) Analyze financial data to build models for decision support and making recommendations Proactively collaborates with peers to solve business challenges, needing little to no instruction for day-today work Identify and drive operational improvements which may include challenging assumptions in a productive manner and trying new ways of working to achieve results What it takes to catch our eye: 2-4 years of experience in a finance-related role with FP&A, investment banking, or consulting experience is a plus Excellent communication skills combined with collaborative mindset to arrive at the best business decision Modeling, reporting, and presentation skills (Adaptive Insights, Excel, Looker, and G-suite experience a plus) Critical thinker with sound business judgment and a continuous improvement attitude who quickly raises issues and facilitates an environment to solve them Come change how the world works. At Upwork, you’ll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees. At the core of our vibrant culture are shared values that form the foundation of our organization. These values revolve around trust, risk-taking, customer focus, and excellence. Our overarching mission is to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster an environment where individuals are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, nurturing personal and professional growth through development opportunities, mentorship programs, and participation in Upwork Belonging Communities. We take pride in providing exceptional benefits to our employees. These include comprehensive medical insurance coverage for both you and your family, unlimited paid time off, a 401(k) plan with matching contributions, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. To explore these benefits in detail, as well as gain insights into our company values, working principles, and the overall employee experience, we invite you to visit our Life at Upwork page. Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. The annual base salary range for this position in California and Washington is displayed below. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive program. Annual Base Compensation $116,750—$134,000 USD To learn more about how Upwork processes and protects your personal information as part of the application process, please review our Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice
summary: Upwork is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst, Revenue to join their team. The role involves leading forecasting and reporting, analyzing financial data, building models for decision support, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Ideal candidates possess 2-4 years of finance experience and strong communication, modeling, and presentation skills.

description: Requisition Name : System Analyst 5 Location : Lansing, MI. Hybrid Role with 2 days onsite . The process of a complete redesign of their external-facing web portals, internal line-of-business application, and their call center CRM application. Understands testing cycles to help identify the context of the test plans (functional, performance, security, acceptance and regression). Able to engage the test automation group to efficiently automate test plans and to identify test data. Able to identify and document application performance requirements, including load parameters and service-level agreements. Able to identify application security requirements, and to coordinate security scans with the project team. Required Knowledge of Playwright (or comparable tool), Locust (or comparable tool), Python, VS Code, Azure DevOps, Git, and Microsoft Dynamics development technologies. Flexibility to work with other Responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test that can verify software functionality and performance. Experience writing Structured Query Language (SQL) to identify and create test data Experience in Smoke, Regression, functional and performance testing criteria Experience performing user story sessions with customers Experience developing success criteria during the development of user stories Experience with documenting test plans, both manual and automated, to validate positive and negative validation criteria Experience With Providing Requirements/user Story Traceability Reports Experience with providing requirements/user story test coverage metrics Experience with the Agile SDLC methodology utilized in the development of new systems and enhancements Experience providing test effort estimations and daily stand-up status reports Experience working with developers to identify risk areas within the application that may require additional testing Experience in running smoke tests for each deployment/release Ability to evaluate and document test results, including defect reporting and management Ability to work and communicate well with all levels of IT co-workers and users Ability to prepare detailed written instructions and technical documentation using industry best practices Ability to work under pressure and tight timelines and diagnose and resolve complex problems quickly Other technologies as identified through discovery Nice to Have Experience with OpenText Unified Functional Testing (UFT) Experience with OpenText LoadRunner Experience with testing automation tools in general

Serve as liaison between client business users and development team, communicating and interpreting requirements and technical solutions. Collaborate to elicit new product ideas and improve existing solutions; program management documentation support, including developing high-quality presentations for client meetings; and participate in team and customer meetings, documenting notes and action items; basic knowledge of relational database management systems (RDBMS), Structured Query Language (SQL) and Microsoft products Word, Excel and Visio
summary: This position involves supporting various workforce development applications for the State of Michigan's Department of Technology, Management, and Budget (DTMB). The role requires experience in system analysis, requirement gathering, business process analysis, software testing, and collaboration with development teams. The candidate will analyze existing processes, document gaps, and collect user feedback to improve business processes and software.

title: Consumer Credit Analyst 2
description: Job Summary This role will be responsible for: Analyzes consumer credit applications to determine the credit worthiness of applicants within smaller markets and determines the risk level based on an evaluation and assessment of the Credit Bureau and other sources. Negotiates tiers and term and reviews deal structure with dealers, develops and maintains a positive business relationship with the dealers, providing customer service and support to the dealer regarding credit policy and the dealer's applicants. Credit Analyst position assigned to entry-level Regional assignment, non-Metro area, with cross-regional movement for growth and development. *Position is eligible to work remotely* **Candidate must be willing to commit to weekend shift which includes both Saturdays and Sundays as well as some evening hours.** Job Functions The following job function statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. The job function statements reflect expectations of the fully trained, proficient incumbent who meets all performance criteria. Evaluates credit applications based on information received from credit bureau reports and various other sources. Ensures that decisions conform to credit guidelines and lending retail authority levels of a Credit Level I analyst at entry-level Regional assignment, makes credit decision recommendations to Credit Level II and Senior Analyst for credit approval. Authority level may progress based on demonstrated performance measurements. Processes and decisions credit applications received and presented in LOS, decisions VRU, Funding, Transfer of Equity and Internet queues, dealer inbound phone calls and initiates outbound dealer calls. Develops and maintains business relationships with dealer personnel. Interacts with dealers regarding lending decisions based on credit evaluations. Negotiates credit decisions tiers and terms on applications, approvals and declines. Utilizes scoring and credit analysis to administer to a risk-based finance program. Maintains positive relationship with support staff and Field Service Managers to resolve credit and finance issues. Supports the Field team and Funding department by solving credit, finance, and compliance issues. As necessary, performs other related duties of which the above are representative. Minimum Qualifications And Demonstrated Knowledge, Skills & Abilities The following qualification statements reflect the minimum skills and abilities required of the qualified applicant. Job Knowledge and Skill: Basic knowledge of consumer credit analysis and approval process. Thorough knowledge of financial institutions/Finance. Excellent customer service, interpersonal, negotiation and analytical skills. Good problem solving, written and verbal communication skills. Experience: 1 or 2 years credit experience. Education: Bachelor's degree in Finance or degree in related field preferred or 9-10 years sales finance experience, including 1-2 of credit experience Computer Skills: Proficient in: Computer use to look up data or information, to generate/print standard reports or spreadsheets developed by others, or to use computer programs developed by others. Physical Requirements The physical requirements described below are representative of those an employee must normally meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable otherwise qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. Travel: Occasional day and overnight travel. All of us at Nissan - regardless of functional area or expertise - share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance vehicles. It is Nissan's policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, military status, disability, or any other status protected by law. Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire. **Visa sponsorship for this position is not available at this time.** Salary Range Estimate: Annual Salary: ($57,880-$96,182). This compensation range is provided as a reasonable estimate of the salary range for the job's grade level. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include, among other things, your specific skills, your work location, how many years of experience you have, and comparison to other employees already in this role. NISSAN FOR EVERYONE People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. We are committed to procuring innovative goods and services, retailing our products and communicating from a diverse perspective which will help us continue to offer our customers competitively designed, market-driven products. Join us as we carry our commitment to diversity and inclusion into the future. Irving Texas United States of America

title: System Analyst
description: A great UHY client is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have IT Help Desk Experience and Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365. The Business Systems Analyst is a flexible position, with in office Mon-Fri and Remote Friday (opportunity to work ½ day Friday). This is a client direct hire position. Business Systems Analyst Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Analyze business issues and challenges to identify, evaluate, and recommend technology solutions to solve business problems and improve business decision-making with a focus on core systems, technology strategies, and standards. Primary responsibility for managing systems and processes related to the delivery of end-user support. Provide first tier troubleshooting for end-user technical support. Escalate issues beyond technical expertise to appropriate support personnel. Manage support ticket life cycle, ensuring that issues are resolved in a timely manner. Assist users, when requested, in the technical set up of meetings in Foundation conference rooms. Maintain files, contracts, invoices, and other records. Maintain calendar and arrange schedules. Take notes or minutes at meetings. Proofread materials. Ensure follow-up for deadlines, timely reports, and other administrative details. Work to solve administration problems and suggest changes in internal process and procedures as needed. Track, review, and route invoices for approval and payment. Address and resolve relevant inquiries and questions. Manage lifecycle of equipment records. Collaborate with vendors and resources to achieve project goals. Maintain and update knowledgebase documentation to provide to staff, as well as contributing to the departmental depository of information. Collaborate with other stakeholders and vendors to ensure successful implementation of technology solutions in accordance with business requirements. Translate business requirements into appropriate technical specifications documenting functional specifications, conversions, interfaces, reports, forms, and workflows. Business Systems Analyst Qualifications: A bachelor's degree is required, or an equivalent combination of education and experience in this position. One to three years’ experience in an analyst role or IT environment. Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365. Effective analytical and organizational skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. The capacity for independent judgment. The ability to work effectively with people. The position requires an on-site presence in the Flint office Monday through Thursday, with the option to work remotely on Friday. Employees may flex their hours earlier in the week to work a half day on Friday, and they also have an additional bank of remote-work days each year. ----------------- UHY Advisors' Resource Solutions Group provides clients with accomplished professionals to support finance, accounting, internal audit and tax teams. Whether it is project work, loaned staff support or business process outsourcing–we are ready to meet your needs. Our team has extensive experience with a wide range of clients from middle market, closely held organizations to large Fortune 500 companies. We focus on finance and accounting, internal audit, IT audit and tax. We offer direct, personal involvement from senior practitioners and strive to meet clients' needs rapidly.
summary: UHY Advisors is seeking a Business Systems Analyst with 1-3 years of experience in an analyst role or IT environment. The role involves analyzing business issues, recommending technology solutions, managing system support, troubleshooting technical issues, and collaborating with stakeholders. Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 is required, along with strong analytical, organizational, written, and verbal communication skills.

Design, prototype, develop and implement software to achieve business results for the client. Experienced expert able to lead and deliver solutions using D365 Customer Engagement/Power Platform, object-oriented, service-oriented architecture, and n-tier architectures. title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: Senior Financial Analyst – Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) – 3+ years’ experience Venteon is currently seeking a Senior Financial Analyst – Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) The ideal candidate will be a critical contributor to the company’s overall financial success. The Senior Financial Analyst - Financial Planning & Analysis is strategic member of the Finance organization responsible for supporting the senior leadership on company financial performance to ensure key metrics and expected returns on investment are achieved. This individual will support key decisions for achieving the Company’s long-range financial goals and strategies and identify areas of focus for the management and operational teams. Requirements of the Senior Financial Analyst – Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) · Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field ·3+ years of applicable finance experience in public or private industry · Strong accounting and financial analysis skills · Proven ability to model and analyze to synthesize insight · Experience with ERP / CPM software · Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint · Exposure to Power BI, Tableau, or Domo a plus Benefits of the Senior Financial Analyst – Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Medical Plan Dental & Vision Insurance Life Insurance Short & Long Term Disability Vacation Time Paid Holidays Professional Development Responsibilities of the Senior Financial Analyst – Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) · Developing Strategic Financial Plans - financial and strategic planning for a Company with BIG plans for growth and success). · Driving long-term Financial Planning- partnering with different departments to assess overall corporate goals and partners with diverse stakeholders to build streamlined, repeatable workflows to surface insights to leadership and across the regions. · Building key storylines and insights- drive long-term strategic objectives, acts as thought partner to Leadership. · Collaborates with Senior Leadership- plan and analyze business plans by identifying gaps between business goals and corporate objectives; providing feedback to management regarding risks associated with financial projects; supporting region budget process; and providing insight on relevant historical trends, expected future events, and operational trends. · Act as the lead finance support for regions - Prepare monthly financial reporting including variance and financial statement analysis. Able to clearly communicate a cohesive and concise story around business drivers behind financial data and potential implications on future results. Interact with the Region VP to point out revenue and cost opportunities to improve the EBITDA performance for the region. Proactively develop and share ideas - as a champion for continuous improvement in financial processes and margin reporting. · Communication and Presentation - Provides strategic input for business decisions by producing complex financial models that incorporate assumptions, expectations, and known risks; preparing presentations and other supporting materials for recommendations; participating in business case presentations to senior and executive management; and communicating forecast, assumptions, and variances to senior management. Lead period P&L review with the Region teams, covering key variances and escalating meaningful trends. If you are a high performer and would like to work for an equally high performing company and you think the above opportunity is appropriate for you, we invite you to apply to this job and email your resume to kroehrig@venteon.us.com We treat all resumes with strict confidentiality. We will always contact you first before submitting your resume to our client(s) for review. If you do not receive correspondence, you are not a fit for this position. At Venteon, our talent acquisition team is proud to provide our clients with the most qualified Accounting & Finance, Engineering, and IT talent in the industry today.
summary: Venteon seeks a Senior Financial Analyst to contribute to its financial success, supporting senior leadership on company financial performance and driving long-term financial planning. This role involves developing strategic financial plans, building key storylines and insights, collaborating with senior leadership, and providing financial support for regions.

title: .net Programmer analyst
description: In person interview is needed. Onsite from day 1 Location: Lansing, MI Duration: 12+ months In the analyst role, the Programmer Analyst is responsible for gathering and documenting clear, unambiguous, and testable business requirements from the client, understanding the business requirements thoroughly to communicate business need and system functionality to technical and non-technical stakeholders, project team members, and the user community. The resource will be responsible for working with the project team and stakeholders to examine existing and future-state business processes, data, and systems. This information is used to guide the gathering of business requirements as they relate to the desired system functionality. In the programmer role, the Programmer Analyst is responsible for planning, developing, testing, and documenting computer programs, applying knowledge of programming techniques and computer systems. Responsibilities Document business requirements that are clear, unambiguous, testable, and satisfy the business need in accordance with standard templates and adherence to DTMB and Treasury policies, standards, and guidelines. Facilitate requirement gathering meetings to identify impacted business processes and document the project business requirements. Attendees include relevant project team members and stakeholders as identified in the Communication Plan. Adhere to the project schedule by developing and maintaining the project backlog during Agile projects and working with the product owner to set priority throughout the duration of project. Understand project scope and actively monitor requirements process to maintain adherence to the objectives set for the project. Understand high-level information governance objectives and ensure appropriate Stakeholder inclusion and/or awareness regarding data requirements. Resolution of critical IT issues as it pertains to the BA role. Understand project specific benefits and related impact of changes to project scope or business requirements. Ensure SEM deliverables for the project that are a responsibility of the BA are completed, reviewed, and approved in alignment with area processes. Work directly with project team including user interface/user experience (UI/UX) designers, tech leads, solution architects, database administrators, developers, QA testers, and technical writers to ensure understanding of the requirements, functionality, size, and scalability of the IT solution. Work with security team to develop system security plans (SSPs). Programmer Responsibilities Possess knowledge and experience of advanced principles, theories, techniques, and methods in the development and design of web applications. Work as a team and individually on projects and tasks using Agile and/or traditional project management methodologies. Participate in project review meetings and project workgroups. Presents the information gathered to the Project Review Board and/or Project Sponsors during project review meetings, project workgroups and to the Technical Review Board providing clarification and answers to questions. Create, update, and maintain systems and IT programs documentation, including but not limited to system and functional specifications. Draft technical models that capture requirements of data elements, and design data elements to best meet application needs. Design and develop software code based on reusability, approved architecture/design, and in compliance with security (SADLC) and other applicable State of Michigan standards, policies, and procedures including Americans with Disabilities (ADA) compliance. Mitigate application-level security risks, and remediate vulnerabilities as soon as identified. Participate and provide input for structured walk throughs, code reviews, and stage exits. Strictly follow configuration management procedures as defined by the development team. Follow change management procedures as defined by the State of Michigan Center for Excellence and provide input in execute change management. Support project documentation requirements by following System Engineering - SUITE standards for Agile and Traditional methodologies as applicable. Perform application unit, string, and integrated testing to ensure compliance with the business and technical requirements. Develop system/module level test scripts, test plans, and test cases required to support the execution of unit, string, and integrated system testing activities. Analyze and document identified problems to determine root cause and provide root cause analysis reports. Develop user manuals and conduct training for users. Evaluate requests for modifications and enhancements for impact on existing project and applications. Skills Needed Experience working directly with customers to develop requirements for application development. Experience creating functional and technical designs and documentation. Experience developing applications using Microsoft Visual Studio/Azure DevOps/C#/.NET/MVC/JavaScript. Experience with data access and manipulation including queries/stored procedures/Entity Framework. Experience developing secure applications and system security plans. Experience developing and executing test plans/suites/cases. ADO test plans are a plus.
