title: Business Analyst - Business Process Optimization
description: Who You'll Work With As a member of McKinsey’s world-class Operations practice you will be responsible for blending strategic thinking with hands-on implementation, advising on developing and defining operational strategies to help our clients around the world solve their most critical problems. Service Operations is a growing service line with deep functional expertise implementing holistic transformation including Customer Experience/Service Design, Frontline & Field Operations, Service Factory Operations, Corporate Business Functions, and Customer Care with cross-cutting foundation capabilities (e.g., Lean expertise; IT enablement; Performance transformation) to deliver significant and sustainable cost impact. We provide a unique set of tools and techniques to help clients identify opportunities for improvement and implement recommendations in support of our client’s business objectives. What You'll Do You’ll work in teams of typically 3–5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. You’ll gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. Business Analysts receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a Partner from Operations that is assigned to you to help guide your career as well as several weeks of formal training in your first two years as a Business Analyst. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network. Following your BA tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some BAs will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firm’s support. Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm. Qualifications Bachelors degree with record of academic achievement 2+ year of post-graduate work experience with a distinctive record of achievement and impact Experience in at least two of the following process optimization in service industries, customer experience, frontline & sales transformation, field service, customer care, business support functions Demonstrated experience in successfully leading a transformational/capability building activity within a service operations environment Industry experience with a service industries such as retail, telecom, banking, media, etc. Willingness to travel up to 80%
summary: McKinsey & Company is hiring Business Analysts to join their Operations practice. This role will involve working in teams to advise clients on developing and defining operational strategies, specifically in Service Operations. The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience in process optimization, customer experience, frontline & sales transformation, field service, customer care, or business support functions, and a demonstrated ability to lead transformational projects.  This position offers opportunities for growth, including post-graduate school roles, secondments, and graduate school support.

title: Business Analyst
description: Who we are: Allwyn is a multi-national lottery operator with leading market positions in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, Italy, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Our primary focus is lotteries, helping them raise more for good causes. We drive innovation, efficiency, and safety across our casual gaming entertainment platform in the quest for enhanced player engagement. Allwyn North America is headquartered in Chicago. It currently operates the Illinois Lottery under a private management agreement while seeking other opportunities throughout the U.S. We also provide products and services to lotteries and their players throughout Europe and the United States. About the Team: The Technology team utilizes the latest technological trends to effectively build and manage solutions in an informal, open, collaborative, and fast-paced environment. Position Overview: Within Allwyn North America, the Business Analyst will be responsible for performing business process and software requirements analysis. Responsibilities: Prepare requirements to plan, and manage the overall requirements phase, including stakeholders and third-party suppliers Perform business process and software requirements analysis on large and commercially important projects Perform research and analysis and provide subject matter expertise on technology trends for key capabilities Analyze products, suppliers, and competitors, and advise on which actions to take Possess a variety of analysis techniques that can be adapted to suit different projects and customers Define the logical architecture for large product development and implementations Independently coordinate and facilitate business information discussions with internal and external stakeholders Consult and advise Allwyn Illinois on a variety of internal and external business systems-related topics Identify business opportunities and product features for Allwyn Illinois's products, and work with a development team to deliver feature-rich solutions. Independently analyze and craft execution plans to delegate problems, issues, and escalations Ensure all governance documents about the requirements phase are in place Support audits as needed Supplier management and oversight as needed Work directly with different workstream leaders to drive the successful completion of efforts Contribute towards business analysis process improvements Requirements Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field Strong analytical and problem-solving skills A proven background in working on software development projects in a requirements analysis role Knowledge and experience with core technology and infrastructure capabilities (Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), application development and management, and innovation Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams Strong facilitation skills and management of a variety of stakeholders (third-party suppliers, business stakeholders) Ability to take a project from inception (idea stage) to detailed requirements and organize a plan to deliver the final working solution. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and manage several deliverables simultaneously with stakeholders. Proactive and results-oriented is a must Ability to articulate examples of large multiple system implementation projects in a customer environment Experience in working on multiple and varied projects, delivering a variety of software applications, with lottery or gaming experience being an advantage Proficient understanding of software/application architecture and design Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience in the lottery or gaming industry is a plus Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques Strong attention to detail and organizational skills Benefits Working for Allwyn North America: Our goal is to create one of North America's most inclusive organizations - where people can bring the best of themselves, to do their best work, every day, for the benefit of good causes. While the main contribution of the Lottery to society is through the funds to good causes, at Allwyn we put our purpose and values at the heart of everything we do. That's why we have committed to an ambitious Social Value strategy, which is woven into the way we do business. We believe that lotteries must serve everyone, not just those who play. So, whether as an employee, a supplier, a retailer or any of the stakeholders that we interact with, we will be powering good across the US. Moreover, we pledge to have the highest standards of respect, diversity and inclusion at our company and support and encourage our partners to do the same. Allwyn North America is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. title: Business Analyst
description: Title: Business Analyst, Life Insurance Location: Hybrid, 2 days per week in one of the following locations: Rosemont IL, Cedar Rapids IA, Des Moines, IA, or Baton Rouge, LA Position: Full-Time Direct Hire Overview TalentFish is casting a line for an analytical & motivated Business Analyst ! This is a full-time opportunity with our premier client in the Life Insurance industry. Candidates must have Life Insurance or Annuities industry experience. The role of the Business Analyst is to develop and ensure quality of business analysis deliverables across the organization in support of key projects varying from small to complex. The Business Analyst will create clear and consistent business requirements, analyze data, design, automate processes, and implement technology strategies. They will also be required to develop testing documentation and perform testing to ensure business requirements are met. What You'll Do in a Day. (Skills Used in this Position) Translate conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers, the project team, and key stakeholders. Work with internal resources and processes as well as multiple outside vendor resources and processes. Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; clarify and redefine as necessary. Develops and utilizes standard templates to write requirements and specifications accurately and concisely. Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements. Collaborate with project manager, project business owner, SMEs, and vendors to determine project scope and define requirements. Define test strategy and perform user acceptance testing. Develops and utilizes standard templates to accurately track and manage test plans and defects. Facilitates meetings focused on requirements gathering, requirements walkthrough, test results and defect resolution. Communicate issues effectively to multiple levels within the organization. Recreate issues and document requirements for system enhancements. Create documentation and training materials, Provide end-user training to internal and external customers. Research, review, and analyze the different ways to meet the needs of the business within individual projects. Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develops strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes. Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Effectively communicate insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. What You Bring to the Role. (Ideal Experience) Bachelor's degree. Minimum 4 years' experience as a Business Analyst. Life Insurance or Annuities insurance business analysis experience. Third Party Administrator and Vendor Management experience is a plus! Excellent MS Excel and other data technology experience such as Power BI, SQL, Access, etc. Salesforce experience/exposure, a plus! Business analysis experience in cross-platform projects and multiple vendors with moderate supervision. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong business and collaboration skills. Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Access, Word, PPT). Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Flexible "can-do” attitude, willing to help with all types of tasks in an ever-changing environment. Passion to learn new things and design new solutions. Work both independently and as part of a team. WHAT YOU'LL GET Our client cares about employees! The company fosters a supportive environment as well as competitive compensation and full employee benefits. They are committed to provide an outstanding employee experience which includes a comprehensive benefits package that fits different individual needs. TalentFish is an employee-owned company pioneering a new realm in talent acquisition. We are redefining IT staffing by evolving AI, video screening and our unique platform. TalentFish focuses on providing the best employee, consultant, and client experience possible. At TalentFish we are an Equal Opportunity Employer we embrace and encourage diversity!

title: eCommerce Business Analyst
description: Job Description Job Summary The eCommerce Business Analyst will work alongside other business analysts and report directly to the Project Manager/Director eCommerce and Operations. The role includes performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing some user acceptance testing. Responsibilities Work with Thanx Media and client team members to understand complex technological and business environments. Assist Thanx Media team members in scoping out project based on client timelines and effort necessary to complete requirements. Effectively participate in all stages of the software development lifecycle including: conducting meetings and presentations performing requirements gathering, gap analysis and functional designed creating reports to document and communicate results ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements performing user acceptance training conducting training, and performing other related duties as requested. Demonstrate strong analytical problem solving and decision-making skills. Work with other business analysts, project managers and stakeholders to gather requirements and create functional and technical specifications. Job Qualifications/Education REQUIRED: Expert knowledge of eCommerce processes and lifecycle, specifically business processes around understanding and supporting the implementation of eCommerce platforms and associated risk Strong understanding of SEO and personalization, and other key industry terms and functions, such as A/B testing, cart abandonment rate, AOV, site search and navigation, back office integration, email marketing and analytics. Exposure and experience with key industry platforms such as Optimizely (formerly Episerver) and BigCommerce a plus. General business understanding of B2C and B2B eCommerce processes including integrations with core supporting business applications such as ERP, OMS, and PIM. Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills. The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Advanced technical skills. Excellent documentation and communication skills. Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Education: Bachelor’s degree in business or related field Experience: 5 years of experience in eCommerce business analysis or a related field. Preferred Skills Excellent verbal and written communication Deep analytical skills with the ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users Project and product management skills Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. Independent thinker with the ability to work collaboratively Able to plan, organize and prioritize effectively Quick learner Self-motivated The company reserves the right to add or change duties at any time. Company Description Thanx Media is a digital agency that focuses on implementation, strategy services and post-launch support of eCommerce platforms for B2B and B2C sites. Having helped over 250 clients achieve online success and forming partnerships with Oracle Commerce Cloud (OCC), Optimizely (formerly Episerver), BigCommerce and others, Thanx Media is uniquely qualified to help our clients not only identify the right eCommerce technology for their growing business, but become an expert extension of their team to implement and assist along the digital eCommerce journey. title: Training & Business Analyst
description: Save lives, from the workplace to anyplace. The National Safety Council is America’s leading nonprofit safety advocate. We focus on eliminating the leading causes of preventable injuries and deaths. Through leadership, research, education, and advocacy, NSC focuses on areas where most unintentional injuries and deaths occur. We are currently looking for a Training & Business Analyst to join us in our mission to save lives and prevent injuries. Position Highlights: The Training & Business Analyst will be responsible for gathering project requirements, conducting user acceptance testing (UAT) post-development, and delivering corporate training on technical concepts. What You’ll Do: Gather and document project requirements from various stakeholders. Collaborate with development teams to ensure accurate translation of business needs into technical specifications. Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure developed solutions meet business requirements. Identify, document, and report defects, ensuring their resolution before deployment. Develop and deliver corporate training programs on technical concepts to non-technical staff. Create training materials, including manuals, guides, and online resources. Stay updated with the latest trends and developments in business analysis and corporate training. Facilitate workshops and training sessions to enhance employees’ technical skills. Assist in the continuous improvement of business processes through detailed analysis and feedback. We’re Looking for Someone with: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Education, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in business analysis, corporate training, or a similar role. Experience in gathering and documenting business requirements. Proficiency in conducting user acceptance testing (UAT). Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus. Experience with SmartSheets is highly desirable. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to create detailed documentation and training materials. Experience with project management and business process modeling tools. Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with various stakeholders. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. This is a remote position. The salary is $85,000 Reasons You’ll Love it here: NSC cares about the safety, health, and overall well-being of our employees. We offer competitive benefits, resources, and tools to promote a work-life balance that supports employees during all phases of life. We offer the following: At least 20 PTO days accrued 1 st year and 11 paid holidays Flexible work arrangements Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans Flex spending accounts for medical and dependent care 403(b) & Roth 403(b) with employer match up to 6% Reimbursable training Student loan pay-down Dress for your day We believe that you can’t be safe if you don’t feel safe. Feeling safe requires a commitment to equitable policy implementation and promoting diversity in the safety profession. We must cultivate our own diverse, inclusive, and equitable work environment to deliver on our mission to save lives, from the workplace to anyplace. NSC is an equal-opportunity employer
summary: The National Safety Council is seeking a Training & Business Analyst to join their team. This remote role will involve gathering project requirements, conducting user acceptance testing, and delivering corporate training on technical concepts. Candidates should have a Bachelor's degree in a related field and 3-5 years of experience in business analysis, corporate training, or a similar role. Experience with Salesforce and SmartSheets is a plus.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description: Business Analyst (Contract) **Location:** Onsite in Chicago, IL Contract at $65-75 hr We are seeking a Business Analyst to document new finance and accounting processes, including workflow and controls, due to the development of a new general ledger and supporting accounting systems. This role is crucial in translating business objectives into effective and efficient processes with appropriate controls. The Business Analyst will work within the accounting team and closely align with project management and IT development teams. A thorough understanding of documentation for business process requirements, procedures, and internal controls is critical for this position. Job Responsibilities: **Requirement Gathering and Analysis:** - Participate in stakeholder meetings to understand business needs, gather requirements, and document them. - Analyze business processes, workflows, and systems to identify opportunities for improvement. - Create detailed business analyses, outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions for the business. - Collaborate with process owners and developers to ensure the best solution design within an agile framework. **Documentation:** - Prepare comprehensive Business Requirement Documents (BRDs), use cases, user stories, and other relevant documentation. - Create and maintain standardized processes and documentation for business requirement gathering. - Develop or update internal policy and procedure documents, including SOX and other Key Financial Controls (KFC). - Work with internal and external audit teams to review processes and controls, making necessary changes in collaboration with the accounting team. **Testing and Validation:** - Participate in testing new systems, processes, and controls to ensure they meet specified requirements. - Conduct post-implementation reviews to assess the effectiveness of new processes and controls. - Support internal and external audit testing and review of processes and controls. Job Requirements: - B.S. in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. - 5+ years of business analysis experience. - Strong communication skills with the ability to present to senior management. - Solid technical knowledge and competencies in business process automation. - Proficiency in workflow, process, and controls document management. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. - Ability to promote core values. - Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization. -US Citizen or Green Card Preferred Qualifications: - Experience in the financial services industry, accounting systems, or audit. - Experience with policy, procedure, and internal control systems. The successful completion of an applicable pre-employment background check is required. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer for minorities, females, protected veterans, and individuals with a disability.

CRITICAL SKILL SETS COMPETENCIES Initiative – focuses on results and desired outcomes and how best to achieve them. Gets the job done. Goal setting – develops the criteria, boundaries, time limits etc. necessary to move toward and achieve a specific outcome for the group or organization. Integrity/Ethics - operates in a truthful and / or principled manner that is consistent with PLZ’s Core Values Collaboration – Readily and frequently collaborates with others; involving them in issues that impact them in understanding of their needs and concerns. Willingness to share expertise with others to enable other team members. Forward thinking – conceiving, analyzing and reflecting on information or data in a futuristic way. Thinks about possibilities, weighs and balances options and presents new ideas or outcomes.

description: Business Analyst Apprentice Location: Onsite in South CHICAGO (specific details below) We are targeting candidates who live in our priority recruitment area of Chicago which includes these zip codes and neighborhoods: Zipcodes: 60615, 60617, 60619, 60620, 60621, 60628, 60637, 60649 Neighborhood Names: Greater Grand Crossing, Woodlawn, South Shore, Washington park, Chatam, Englewood, Auburn Gresham, Avalon Park Become a Business Analyst Apprentice. No experience needed. FREE TRAINING!!! What does a Business Analyst do? A Business Analyst bridges the gap between IT and business needs, analyzing processes, defining requirements, and delivering data-driven solutions to enhance performance. They identify improvement areas, document information, and work closely with different departments to boost efficiency and profitability. Their role involves interpreting data, forecasting trends, and communicating findings, aligning IT infrastructure with business strategies. How does the program work? During your apprenticeship with Catalyte, you will develop and hone your foundational skills as a Business Analyst under tutelage of experienced analysts. You will utilize your new skills supporting client companies in driving forward IT projects. Qualifications Be at least 18 years old Have a high school diploma (10th grade or better ability in reading + math) Basic proficiency using a computer and the internet Be a U.S. citizen or eligible to work in the U.S. for 30 continuous months. Catalyte does not offer visa assistance or sponsorship of any kind. Curiosity to learn new skills Motivated Responsibilities Assessing and analyzing business processes and requirements. Identifying areas for improvement and developing solutions. Documenting and managing business requirements and data. Liaising between stakeholders and IT teams to ensure alignment. Conducting market analysis and forecasting trends. Presenting findings and recommendations to decision-makers. Overseeing the implementation of business solutions. Pay and benefits Start your career without prior experience! Mentorship from experienced Tech professionals Competitive salary Paid time off About Catalyte Catalyte has redefined hiring. Its proprietary AI uses 500+ data points to unbiasedly discover and develop high-potential talent. By elevating aptitude over pedigree, Catalyte deploys a workforce that looks like America and that helps its clients boost productivity, quality and diversity metrics. By giving high-grit, high-aptitude talent the opportunity to launch new careers, Catalyte transforms individuals, companies and communities. For more information, visit www.catalyte.io. Catalyte provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
summary: Catalyte is offering a Business Analyst Apprentice program for individuals with no prior experience. The program provides free training and mentorship from experienced tech professionals, leading to a competitive salary and benefits like paid time off. The program focuses on developing foundational skills in business analysis, which will be utilized to support client companies in driving forward IT projects. The program is open to US citizens or those eligible to work in the US for 30 continuous months.

title: Business Analyst
description: Business Analyst Location: Hybrid (Tuesday-Thursday) in Bolingbrook, IL Pay: up to $44 an hour/ DOE Our client in the Beauty and Retail space has a need for a Business Analyst! This contract role will be for roughly 6 months, 40 hours a week and does require a hybrid schedule out of their offices in Bolingbrook. Business Analyst Responsibilities: Support business partners both internal and external through business requirements, documentation, enhancements, and implementation. Support the Merchandising, MP&I, and eCommerce team through the use of the merchandise system to ensure that it is properly functioning, processing data, and results. Define system settings to ensure accurate performance and troubleshoot/ solve issues that arise. Review and implement changes in the system parameters and formats. Address daily tickets and resolve tickets or escalate to the right person. Implement consistent processes and resolutions for daily work tickets while adhering to SLA. The role requires experience with Merchandising, eCommerce, Omni-Channel, and Supply Chain systems, as well as an understanding of SDLC. Experience with SAP and PIM/PXM systems is ideal.

title: Senior Consultant, Business Analyst
description: Ashling Partners is at the forefront of the hyper automation revolution! We help clients improve productivity and employee engagement by leveraging intelligent process automation, RPA, Process Intelligence, data capture/OCR and Machine Learning technologies. Our team leverages lean agile principles to make automation gains sustainable and a driving force for digital innovation. As a Business Analyst, Senior Consultant, for Ashling Partners, you will serve as primary point of contact with assigned Intelligent Automation customers and liaise between customers and developers to ensure we deliver quality, excellence and value! Founded by business process improvement & technology industry veterans, Ashling Partners values meaningful work for our employees while driving real value for our clients in a sustainable and continuous manner. We will always value progress over perfection. While doing so, we strive to continually build a positive, appreciative, and fun culture for our organization. Find us on the INC Best Workplace list for 2021 and #4 on Crain's Chicago Fast 50 for 2024! Our rapidly growing organization is taking the world by storm, quickly becoming THE global boutique in intelligent automation. We are looking for life-long learners and servant-leaders who are passionate about innovation and the future of work. If this sounds like a place for you, we would love to meet you! What You Will Do: Serve as primary point of contact with assigned Intelligent Automation customers and liaise between customers and developers Support customers by providing answers, expertise, and insights as needed Conduct site visits to customers, travel up to 25% when warranted Create Business Cases and ROI for all automation projects Collaborate with the developers to ensure customers' development requirements are accurately captured for automation projects Be informed on intelligent automation solutions and use cases to better inform customers on capabilities Support the governance of the lifecycle/process Develop and track metrics and financial projections for each automation/solution Facilitate email communications between clients Accountable for high client NPS (net promoter score) to ensure we deliver quality, excellence and value Support sales team by defining project complexity and total hours needed from Business Analyst resources for new projects What You Will Bring: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance Experience with RPA Tools such as UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism a plus Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing Advanced knowledge in generating process documentation including process flows, as-is/to-be documentation, and process design documents (pdds) Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) Lifelong learner mindset Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communication and management skills Understanding of Agile SDLC Why Ashling Partners: At Ashling Partners, we strive to provide meaningful work in a positive, appreciative and fun culture for our own team. All firm members are referred to as “Ohana,” the Hawaiian word for family, with regards to extended family beyond relatives. The concept emphasizes that extended families are bound together by a common belief, attitude or purpose and members must cooperate and remember one another. Lifelong Learning - In the intelligent automation space change happens fast, in order to support that change, Ashling has developed a culture that enables lifelong learners to continuously develop their skill sets Diversity of Thought, Culture, Background & Identity – We build diversity, equity, and inclusion capabilities into all facets of our business to support innovation, creativity, and our global growth objectives Consistently Innovate with Cutting Edge Technology – We offer a continuous model for performance improvement and the opportunity to work with best of breed automation technology stacks Provide Servant-Based Leadership – We believe the leader’s role is to serve the organization, not the other way around Practice Stewardship – We work together as peers, regardless of a person’s formal role or authority in the organization Be Entrepreneurial in Management – We empower people to bring ideas and challenge them with the responsibility to make them successful Offer Open-Book Finance – We give everyone the opportunity to see the books, how we are being measured and what our score is, so they can feel empowered to impact success Provide the Best Service – We may not be the cheapest, but we will deliver the best value to our clients Make Data-Driven Decisions – We are a data-driven organization internally and externally Be a fun place to work - We provide a positive, appreciative and fun culture What Sets Us Apart: Quarterly book allotment (any book of your choice, no cap!) Uncapped training allotment Unlimited holidays Unlimited PTO! Immediate 401K contributions
summary: Ashling Partners seeks a Business Analyst, Senior Consultant to be the primary contact for Intelligent Automation clients. You will liaise between customers and developers, ensuring high-quality deliverables. Responsibilities include creating business cases, collaborating on development requirements, staying abreast of automation solutions, and tracking project metrics. The ideal candidate will have experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance, RPA tools like UiPath, Automation Anywhere, and Blue Prism, and strong communication and analytical skills.  Ashling Partners offers a vibrant company culture, continuous learning opportunities, and a competitive benefits package including unlimited PTO, 401K contributions, and uncapped training allotments.

title: Business Analyst (HYBRID)
description: DivIHN (pronounced “divine”) is a CMMI ML3-certified Technology and Talent solutions firm. Driven by a unique Purpose, Culture, and Value Delivery Model, we enable meaningful connections between talented professionals and forward-thinking organizations. Since our formation in 2002, organizations across commercial and public sectors have been trusting us to help build their teams with exceptional temporary and permanent talent. Visit us at https://divihn.com/find-a-job/ to learn more and view our open positions. Please apply or call one of us to learn more For further inquiries regarding the following opportunity, please contact one of our Talent Specialists Lavanya at 224 369 0873 Title: Business Analyst (HYBRID) Location: Springfield, IL Duration: 4 years Description Client is currently migrating its applications from a legacy mainframe platform to a modernized Microsoft platform (SRS Central). At this stage, they are looking to migrate legacy systems (Accounting, Pension, Disability) into SRS Central. The business analyst role is critical to the success of migrating to the new platform. Users must have confidence that their requirements are being heard and that the new system will incorporate all of their required business practices. The BA will work with the users to identify what needs to be accomplished and then will work with the developers and technical architects to define the best way to implement technology so those needs are met. Required Skills 5 years of experience in ability to immerse oneself into the business area so that you can evaluate their processes and procedures and find areas for improvement with enhanced technology. 5 years of experience in ability to document clearly through user stories and other documentation the as-is and to-be states such that management, users and developers can understand and envision the proposed state. 3 years of experience in documenting user stories and managing progress using Azure DevOps. 3 years of experience in Develop and execute test plans to ensure a functional application is delivered. 5 years of experience in ability to establish a rapport with stakeholders such that trust and confidence are built. 3 years of experience giving presentations to groups up to 20 people. 5 years of experience analyzing and improving Pension Systems Desired Skills 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL 3 years of experience with Accounting Systems/Concepts 3 years of experience with Agile or other iterative development methodologies. About Us DivIHN , the 'IT Asset Performance Services' organization, provides Professional Consulting, Custom Projects, and Professional Resource Augmentation services to clients in the Mid-West and beyond. The strategic characteristics of the organization are Standardization, Specialization, and Collaboration. DivIHN is an equal opportunity employer. DivIHN does not and shall not discriminate against any employee or qualified applicant on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status.
summary: DivIHN is seeking a Business Analyst with 5+ years of experience to lead the migration of legacy systems (Accounting, Pension, Disability) from a mainframe platform to a modernized Microsoft platform (SRS Central). The role involves working closely with users to understand their requirements, documenting them, and collaborating with developers and technical architects to implement solutions.  Strong communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills are essential. Experience with Microsoft SQL, Accounting Systems, and Agile methodologies is desirable.

title: Business Analyst - D365 Operations & Warehousing
description: Company Description ITW (Illinois Tool Works Inc.) is a Fortune 200 company and is one of the world’s leading diversified manufacturers of specialized industrial equipment, automotive components, consumables, and related service businesses. ITW businesses serve local customers and markets around the globe, with operations in 55 countries and an employee base of more than 46,000 women and men who adhere to the highest ethical standards. These talented individuals, many of whom have specialized engineering or scientific expertise, contribute to our global leadership in innovation. We are proud of our broad portfolio of more than 17,000 granted and pending patents. ITW Residential and Renovation Construction provides Industry leading, premium branded, cordless nailing systems and fastening solutions, that deliver superior productivity and reliability to meet the needs of professional remodelers and residential framers, with a widely available product portfolio at their preferred retail or dealer outlets The 80 focus for the division is aggressive market growth while sustaining profitability. ITW offers its employees a path for advancement, a competitive salary, and a comprehensive benefits package designed to help employees care for themselves, their families, and their futures. Job Description The Business Analyst is an innovative strategy leader with a strong understanding operations and warehouse management in a manufacturing environment; with the ability to apply that knowledge to implement solutions to accommodate business requirements in a manufacturing environment. We are looking for a motivated team member with excellent leadership and the ability to build strong relationships. A qualified candidate can effectively translate organizational needs into strategic opportunities, while understanding the effect on a growing global organization. Responsibilities will include deep assessments into business challenges, evaluating new technologies, and defining functional standards. This individual will manage the planning and implementation of projects ensuring policies and procedures are consistent with company goals, best practices, software compliance, and regulatory requirements This role is based in Glenview, IL, and reports to the Business Solutions Manager. Core Responsibilities: Understanding of discrete manufacturing, quality control management, and warehouse management business system processes Industry best practice awareness of technology concepts and architecture patterns Work with vendors and service providers as a liaison for the technical team to select the services and products that meet company requirements Establish and maintain an effective system of communications throughout the organization Determine project schedules and effectively manage the allocation of resources to achieve project objectives Ability to translate technical language into non-technical understanding Work closely with our user community and IT professionals to build consensus and standards that are scalable, adaptable, and flexible to meet the needs of a changing business landscape Comply with audit requirements and execute change management best practices Drive to keep current with evolving technology and apply it to future strategic objectives Ability to deliver solutions with industry leading security and efficiencies that aligns with the Enterprise Agenda Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT Technical, or a related field 3+ years relevant Operations and Warehousing experience 10+ years of experience working in a large, multi-regional, corporate environment Experience with ERP systems, with preference for the Microsoft D365 platform Experience implementing cloud solutions is a plus Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with strong customer support orientation Proven record of meeting commitments with the highest standards of ethics and integrity Exhibits strong organizational and time management skills with a sense of drive and urgency Exceptional interpersonal, collaboration, and communication abilities Able to travel locally between division facilities ~20% (Bartlett, Elgin, Glenview, Itasca, Lake Forest, and Libertyville, Roselle, IL). Up to 10% travel to manufacturing facilities out of Illinois. Occasionally the employee may be required to spend time in our local manufacturing sites. Certain personal protective equipment is required when in the manufacturing areas. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the online application system process due to your disability, please click here for information on how to contact us directly. ITW is an equal opportunity employer. The role involves collaborating with vendors, managing projects, and translating technical information for non-technical audiences. The successful candidate will have experience with ERP systems, preferably Microsoft D365, and cloud solutions.

title: Business Analyst
description: Who We Are PCMI (Policy Claim Management International) is a fast-growing, leading provider of integrated software for Extended Warranty Management and Finance and Insurance (F&I) administration. We are a SaaS company that operates in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment. Our 3 teams located in the US, Poland, and Thailand work collaboratively around the clock to build our PCRS platform that automates the full administration lifecycle of all extended warranties, F&I products, and service contracts for our customers. What You’ll Do The Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for providing business analysis services to clients who seek to implement or have implemented PCMI’s software. The focus of this position is to collaborate closely with clients to gain in-depth understanding of the customer’s business strategy, processes, services, roadmap, and the context in which the business operates. You will oversee reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end. You will provide documented requirements to the Project Manager who shall incorporate them into a release plan. In This Role, You Will Facilitate requirements gathering discussions with staff at all levels of the organization, assess needs, document requirements, and proactively recommend solutions. Design, develop and maintain appropriate workflow documents and business process documentation in collaboration with stakeholders across the organization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities to optimize business processes. Analyze and determine the best path for solving business opportunities/issues which may include process improvements, application/system enhancements and/or end-user training. Liaise between IT and stakeholders to translate technical language into business terminology and vice versa. Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions or to support new initiatives. Perform data quality checks during data consumption to ensure that end users can use the data with minimal downstream enrichments. Experience What You’ll Need to Join Our Team Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3 years’ experience in SQL with an emphasis on Data Analysis and Troubleshooting Experience with Agile/Scrum project methodologies. Ability to quickly analyze and direct technical issues to relevant staff. The ability to clearly translate complex technical concepts to non-technical staff, as well as communicate business needs to technical staff. Skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong problem solving, client management, and multitasking skills. Strong strategic, analytical, and conceptual capabilities Independent and initiative-taking problem-solving mindset Why Work For Us Competitive Compensation Health, Dental & Vision Insurance Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Voluntary Life Insurance 401k with Company Match Paid Time Off 10 Paid Holidays Paid Parental Leave Commuter Benefits Annual Bonus Program Professional Development Opportunities & Certification Bonuses Employee Events Office in Park Ridge, IL - Convenient location to Blue Line Preferred for this role to be in the Park Ridge, IL office two days per week.
summary: PCMI seeks a Technical Business Analyst to collaborate with clients implementing their software. The role involves gathering requirements, designing workflows, and optimizing business processes. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical skills, data analysis expertise using SQL, and experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.

title: Senior Business Analyst -locals
description: Business Analyst Location: Hybrid in Chicago or Houston (2x per week) Is this an onsite, hybrid or remote role? The role would hybrid, based in either Chicago or Houston and would like in office 2 days a week. Those days can be flexible. 3 must have skills/knowledge? Data analysis skills. Experience with tools like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server Management Studio to understand and research database systems and extracting data as needed. Effective collaboration and communication with digital technology team members, business stakeholders, and data engineering group. Establishing the right contacts for various needs in this project and working with those resources is vital to the success of this effort. Strong documentation skills needed to record research findings, methodologies, and data-related processes. Any preferred background? Prefer to have someone with previous business analyst experience. Airline experience would be a huge positive as well, though not a must have. Years of experience? 5 years of experience would be preferred for this role. Will this assignment be potentially extended? If the person is a self-starter and is able to gain a lot of valuable knowledge of our business area and respective data structures the assignment would likely be extended, or the resource could transition into another role within our team. Interview process – how many interviews? Would like 3 interviews. Job Summary Drive identification of requirements across business units and identify substandard systems processes through evaluation of real-time data. Serve as thought leader for technical business processes, developing forward-thinking systems prototypes that promote increased efficiency and productivity on multiple levels Primary Responsibilities Create and implement precise management plans for every project, with attention to transparent communication at all levels. Perform, evaluate, and communicate thorough quality assurance at every stage of systems development. Determine and develop user requirements for systems in production, to ensure maximum usability. Partner with other stakeholder teams across business units (i.e., sales, finance, security, compliance) to develop necessary analysis and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with production, managerial, and executive teams. Evaluate, analyze, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties. Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation. Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems. Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations. Qualifications Technical Degree or related work experience Proven experience in an analytics and systems development capacity High proficiency with SQL language and database management Proven analytical abilities Practical experience generating process documentation and reports Excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights Experience working with Business Objects. Knowledge of ITIL Foundations.
summary: This is a hybrid Business Analyst role based in Chicago or Houston, requiring 2 days in the office per week. You will drive the identification of requirements across business units, analyze systems processes, and develop efficient systems prototypes. You will also work with stakeholders, document findings, and perform daily systems analytics.

title: Business Analyst 228774
description: Business Analyst 100% Remote Contract to hire role (6-12 month contract and conversion) $45-50/hr W2 At Medix, we are dedicated to creating opportunities for talent in Information Technology. company: Global Technical Talent, an Inc. 5000 Company
title: Business Analyst
description: Contract Duration 6 Months Job Description: Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, project managers, and developers, to gather and document detailed business requirements. Conduct interviews, workshops, and brainstorming sessions to elicit requirements, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of the business needs. Analyze and validate requirements, ensuring they are feasible and aligned with project objectives. Documentation of Process Flows: Create clear and concise process flow diagrams, mapping out current and future state processes. Identify process gaps, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with stakeholders to validate process flows and ensure accurate representation of business operations. Test Planning and Management: Develop comprehensive test plans, including test objectives, and test cases (including negative tests) based on gathered requirements. Coordinate with technology development teams to ensure appropriate test environments are set up and ready for testing activities. Execute and manage test activities, including test execution, defect management, and reporting. Collaborate with stakeholders to perform user acceptance testing (UAT), ensuring alignment with business requirements. Project Support: Work closely with project managers, providing support throughout each project lifecycle phase. Assist in project planning, tracking progress, and managing project documentation. Contribute to project risk management and issue resolution. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth project delivery. Creation and distribution of meeting minutes for meetings you lead; as well as assistance with note-taking and minutes for other project meetings as needed. Project Planning and Monitoring for BA-related Activities: Assist project managers in developing detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation. Monitor project progress against established plans, identify potential risks or issues, and propose mitigation strategies. Stakeholder Management for BA-related Activities: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business units, IT departments, and external vendors to ensure clear communication and coordination throughout the project. Facilitate regular meetings, workshops, and presentations to update stakeholders on activity progress, risks, and issue resolution. Documentation and Reporting: Create comprehensive project documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, use cases, and process flows. Develop and maintain project artifacts, such as the business requirements document (BRD), test plan, and process flow. Assist the project manager in preparing reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate activity status, risks, and issues to senior management and PMO as requested. Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve project management methodologies, tools, and templates to enhance project efficiency and effectiveness. Identify areas for process optimization and contribute to the development of best practices within the PMO. Provide recommendations for streamlining workflows and implementing standardized project management practices. Must Haves: 8+ years as a Business Analyst in the financial services/banking industry Strong experience with Microsoft Office- Visio, Word, Excel Technical acumen to translate technical terms Previous experience leading test planning (defining testing scope, working together with business to find out what needs to be tested to drive the UAT test cycle) Nice To Have: Recent experience at client Experience leading a team Knowledge of Azure Project management experience/background Soft Skills Willing to step in and help the program/project manager Exhibits autonomy Independent judgment Proactive Education and Certifications: Bachelor degree with any BA certification is ideal but not required Benefits: Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance Plans 401k Retirement Fund About The Company: Our client is a leading and well-diversified North American financial institution committed to creating enduring value for their clients, teams, communities, and shareholders as we activate our resources to create positive change and contribute to a more secure, equitable, and sustainable future. They know the importance of reliable financial products and services and are dedicated to providing them in a way that lets you bank however you want, whenever you want. They work hard to make client organization a place where everyone's welcome and can truly feel they belong. You deserve a job that's more than a job. Take your career to new heights and work alongside the best in the industry. #gtttf 24-08442
summary: This is a 6-month contract position for a Business Analyst in the financial services/banking industry. The role involves gathering and documenting business requirements, creating process flow diagrams, developing test plans, and supporting project management activities.  The ideal candidate has 8+ years of experience in the field and strong Microsoft Office skills.

title: Business Analyst
description: At Boundless Learning we are empowering our partners to deliver exceptional experiences that expand opportunities for learners around the world. We put learner success at the heart of everything we do, empowering our partners to deliver personalized, learner-centric experiences that boost access and create economic mobility. At Boundless Learning you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with passionate, diverse teams, where your ideas are valued, and your expertise is respected. Join us on this meaningful journey towards transforming education and making a lasting difference in the lives of learners worldwide. Summary Seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our dynamic Business Optimization team. The Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing business needs, identifying solutions, and delivering recommendations to drive efficiency and innovation. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, the ability to work with cross-functional teams, and a passion for improving business processes. Purpose of the Team Our purpose is to empower Boundless Learning to thrive and excel by unlocking its full potential. Through insightful analysis, strategic planning, and innovative solutions, we strive to enhance operational efficiency, streamline processes, and maximize performance across all areas of the business. Committed to continuous improvement, we collaboratively identify opportunities for growth, optimize resources, and implement data-driven strategies that drive sustainable success. With a focus on excellence, adaptability, and delivering tangible results, our mission is to drive positive change, foster a culture of innovation, and elevate the overall position of our organization in an ever-evolving business landscape. Key Responsibilities Requirement Gathering and Analysis: Elicit and gather business requirements from stakeholders through interviews, workshops, and documentation analysis. Create detailed and comprehensive Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) and Functional Requirement Documents (FRDs). User Story Development: Translate business requirements into clear and actionable user stories. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize scope, objectives, and deliverables. Serve as a liaison between business units, IT, and other departments to facilitate effective communication and collaboration. Process Improvement: Analyze and document current business processes, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. Develop and maintain process models, workflow diagrams, and other visual representations of business processes. Industry Knowledge: Stay informed about industry best practices, trends, and emerging technologies relevant to the business domain. Documentation and Reporting: Prepare clear and concise documentation of business requirements, processes, and workflows. Create reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management. Project Management: Assist in the planning and execution of projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives. Monitor project progress and provide regular updates to stakeholders. Solution Implementation: Work with IT and development teams to ensure successful implementation of solutions. Conduct user acceptance testing and provide training to end-users. Qualifications 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role. Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, Tableau, Jira, Confluence). Strong understanding of business processes and project management methodologies. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to think critically and solve complex problems. Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies is a plus. Salesforce experience strongly preferred Relevant certification (e.g., CBAP, PMP) is preferred. Skills & Competencies Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze data and identify patterns. Problem-Solving: Skilled in finding solutions to complex business issues. title: Business Analyst
description: Salary range is: $63,228.00 - $100,000.00 This position is bonus/commission eligible. CCC Intelligent Solutions is a leading technology company helping to improve the insurance claims process for millions of people. Our award-winning SaaS platform connects more than 35,000 businesses, including insurance carriers, repair facilities, automakers, part suppliers, lenders, and others to streamline the process from start to finish. You will also be involved in gathering and documenting requirements, conducting user training, and providing ongoing support to our Product & Technology organization. Key Responsibilities: Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs and translate them into functional requirements Analyze and document existing business processes and identify areas for improvement Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement solutions that meet business requirements Conduct user training and provide ongoing support to ensure successful adoption of new processes, system integrations and tools Support product management in data analysis and dashboard creation Assist in the development of product roadmaps and strategies Stay up-to-date with tooling best practices and updates to ensure the efficient use of tools and technologies Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the SaaS industry Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams Proficient in Aha!, Tableau and MS Suite (Excel, PowerBI and PowerPoint) Experience with Agile methodologies Knowledge of SaaS metrics and KPIs About The Company’s Commitment To Its Employees CCC Intelligent Solutions employees are part of an inclusive culture that brings together diverse backgrounds and perspectives. description: Facilitate requirements workshops and meetings with stakeholders. Conduct stakeholder interviews and gather system information to build a foundation for project assessments. Develop and maintain detailed project plans, including schedules, milestones, budgets, and deliverables. description: GoHealth Intro: GoHealth is a leading health insurance marketplace and Medicare-focused digital health company. Through the efficient, multi-tiered guidance of our highly specialized licensed insurance agents, GoHealth meets Medicare consumers where they are in their enrollment journeys and empowers them to choose the plan and carrier best suited for their healthcare needs. Our extensive industry expertise, including the use of data science and machine learning with key investments in proprietary technology, helps consumers cut through the confusion and enroll confidently. Why Apply: As an industry leader in the Medicare marketplace, we are compelled to not only embrace change but to actively be the change to adapt to our consumers complex needs. We believe in hiring risk-takers, innovators, and collaborators within our industry to create individualized, simplified healthcare solutions for our beneficiaries. Our #TeamGoHealth employees are at the core of our collective success; that's why we are committed to discovering the best in-class talent and ensuring that each team member receives the development tools and support they need to flourish in their professional endeavors. title: Business Analyst
description: Position Overview: A Business Analyst is responsible for bridging the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements, and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders. They are crucial in helping businesses improve their processes, products, services, and software through data analysis. Responsibilities and Duties: Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and gather detailed requirements. Document business requirements and create functional specifications. Data Analysis: Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. Process Improvement: Evaluate existing business processes and suggest improvements. Implement new processes and systems to enhance business performance. Project Management: Work with project managers to ensure timely delivery of projects. Monitor project progress and identify any potential issues or risks. Stakeholder Communication: Act as a liaison between business units, technology teams, and support teams. Communicate effectively with stakeholders to keep them informed of project status and changes. Documentation and Reporting: Create detailed documentation of business processes, requirements, and specifications. Prepare and present reports to management and other stakeholders. Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop and execute test plans to ensure solutions meet business requirements. Identify and resolve any issues or defects in collaboration with the development team. Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on new systems and processes. Education & Experience: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field Proven experience as a Business Analyst or a similar role Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau/PowerBI) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Knowledge of business process modeling and improvement methodologies The Perks The chance to work with a great team that is passionate about the same thing you are Paid on-the-job training The opportunity for advancement within the Company Competitive salary with bonus potential Medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, and life insurance Matching 401(k) Flexible schedules Paid vacation, personal and sick time within the first year Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Spectrum Automotive Holdings Corp.: Spectrum affirms that inequality is detrimental to our employees, our customers, and the communities we serve. title: Business Analyst, Regulatory Affairs
description: This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus. Experience in SQL or comparable coding language (e.g. Python, R, Java, C++). Experience in data analysis, with the ability to solve problems in complex, fast-moving, and ambiguous business environments through solid data intuition and business acumen. Promote and facilitate the development of self-service capabilities for the business in the access and reporting of business information. Ensure data integrity of all systems. Experience & Skills Strong team player with 6+ years of proven experience in business and technical requirements analysis, documenting business use cases, verification and drafting data & BI requirements Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks with strong customer service orientation Strong experience with MS Word, Excel and Power-point Strong experience with SQL. Be able to perform data analysis with minimal oversight. Must have experience working in a Snowflake / cloud data warehouse environment. Prior experience in data integration projects is a plus. Strong quantitative, analytical, critical-thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong work ethic and personal integrity; self-directed and self-motivated with a highly developed curiosity and willingness to learn and to teach. Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal and influencing skills. Proven ability to influence and work with cross-functional teams. Significant skill required to work effectively across internal functional areas in situations where clear parameters may not exist. Experience with hospitality industry a plus. Familiarity with analytics Tools (ThoughtSpot, Tableau etc.,) is a plus. #PCIT

title: Business Analyst
description: Research shows that women and underrepresented groups only apply to jobs only if they think they meet 100% of the qualifications on a job description. IMO Health is committed to considering all candidates even if you don’t think you meet 100% of the qualifications listed. We look forward to receiving your application! IMO Health is a clinical data intelligence business improving how data is used across the healthcare landscape. Combining rich, highly nuanced medical terminology, extensive domain knowledge, and artificial intelligence (AI), we expertly structure and operationalize clinical data to generate sharper insights and inform more intelligent decision-making. For all IMO Health positions, if you live in the Greater Chicagoland Area, Houston, TX, or Roseville, CA, you’ll be expected to work from any IMO Health office 2 days per week. The Business Analyst will be responsible for the end-to-end process related to his or her features, including developing functional and non-functional business requirements, understanding how requirements impact both the technical and functional nature of an application and collaborating with engineering to build features according to business needs. This Business Analyst is responsible for prioritizing the work of the software engineering team to ensure the most valued functionality. This role will require someone who understands technology and business, a high degree of organization and attention to detail, and the ability to professionally interact with a diverse blend of personalities to reach resolution and maintain strong relationships. What You'll Do As the Business Analyst, lead an agile team to deliver forecasted sprint goals, and solve problems efficiently and completely, according to principals of scrum development. Work closely with stakeholders to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value or ROI. Lead team sprints and road mapping processes Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories, epics, and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy Provide vision and direction to the Agile development team and stakeholders. Keep abreast with Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends Experience owning a product delivery cycle and delivering software solutions. Manage and respond promptly and professionally to defect reports. Aid support personnel as needed to determine system problems. Take responsibility for and lead new initiatives in content accuracy and quality. Focus the team towards utilizing standards/metrics that provide guidance and feedback. Oversee current state process capture, identify, recommend and implement process re-engineering to support automation. Responsible for delivering ad hoc projects to support leadership, working with the product managers on strategic initiatives. Ensure that all content released to IMO Clients meets our high standards and expectations. Acquire working knowledge of IMO terminology solutions and related technology tools. What You'll Need At least 3 years of Business Analyst experience working with an Agile software development team. Bachelor’s degree in business or related field, or equivalent experience. AGILE/Scrum certification preferred. Proficient in gathering business requirements, process flows and use cases. In-depth knowledge of Agile process and principles. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and experience with JIRA/Confluence/Aha! Software a plus. Outstanding communication, presentation, and leadership skills. Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. Ability to interact professionally and positively with a diverse group of stakeholders, architects, management and other teams. Ability to bring a team to effective decision making. Ability to complete assigned tasks with little direction. Flexibility with adjusting job assignments and due dates. What We'll Give You The space to be innovative and collaborative with your peers and team members. Training from the best. Collectively, we’ve got years of expertise in Healthcare and IT. Part of a tight-knit team that supports each other, challenges each other, and is looking to make a significant impact in the industry. Excellent benefits package, including competitive benefits through multiple health, dental, and vision plans, 100% company match up to 5% contribution on your 401(k), flexible PTO and hours, peak performance club trips, and more! At IMO Health, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. IMO Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. IMO Health also provides visa sponsorship opportunities. Please don't hesitate to apply if you meet all the qualifications for this position and require visa sponsorship.
summary: IMO Health is seeking a Business Analyst to lead an Agile team, work with stakeholders, assess value, and prioritize stories to ensure work focuses on maximum value. The role requires 3+ years of experience in an Agile software development team, a bachelor's degree or equivalent, Agile/Scrum certification, proficiency in gathering requirements, process flows and use cases, in-depth knowledge of Agile process and principles, proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, experience with JIRA/Confluence/Aha! Software, outstanding communication, presentation, and leadership skills, sharp analytical and problem-solving skills, excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills, ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of stakeholders, ability to bring a team to effective decision making, ability to complete assigned tasks with little direction, and flexibility with adjusting job assignments and due dates. The ideal candidate will have experience owning a product delivery cycle and delivering software solutions. This role is based in the Greater Chicagoland Area, Houston, TX, or Roseville, CA and requires working from an IMO Health office 2 days per week.

title: Business Analyst
description: SUMMARY The Business Analyst performs analysis activities that support the decision making regarding matching technology solutions (package selection, configuration, development) with business, user(s), and functional needs from stakeholders. This involves conducting market research, functional comparisons, and staying abreast of what is being done at other companies. The analyst will also gather requirements, document procedures, and review the methods of the current processes. The BA partners with the appropriate business stakeholders and the Program Manager to prioritize and create a project roadmap for their assigned area. With the business and IT teams, they maintain a set of institutional knowledge of what is working well within the program and what needs improvement. RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with business stakeholders to understand and prioritize their needs, creating a roadmap of projects for their assigned area. Seek input of user experience and document current procedures and processes to determine potential improvements to their assigned products. Stay abreast of best practices being done at other companies and technology developments that may affect the areas. Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders and the Program Managers to influence the technology decisions for the areas based on this knowledge. Analyze and consolidate all perspectives on the project - business needs, requirements, user experience, security, training, risk, time, cost, technology architecture, procurement/vendor management, operational considerations, etc. - to help the Company reach the best technology decisions. Manage the lifecycle of their assigned products, from inception to implementation, throughout production until retirement / upgrade. Gather business requirements from project stakeholders to further define the goals and objectives. Drives projects and business teams toward achieving intended business results within a specified time and budget. Perform risk analyses to identify and resolve critical path issues. Prepare and analyze program / project related data. Review and report on program / project status. Prepare materials for briefings and presentations to large size groups of key decision makers at the executive level. REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience A minimum of 2 years of experience with requirements gathering, documentation and communicating requirements to technical teams & vendors Proficiency with MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) PREFERRED EXPERIENCE Knowledge management experience
summary: The Business Analyst performs analysis activities to align technology solutions with business, user, and functional needs. This involves conducting market research, functional comparisons, gathering requirements, documenting procedures, and partnering with stakeholders to prioritize and create project roadmaps. The analyst stays abreast of industry trends and best practices, providing insights to influence technology decisions and ensure successful product lifecycle management.
