take corrective action if deliverable cannot be met or if higher priorities disrupt prior commitments Support the Enterprise Quality Assurance team to ensure they can properly perform function and non-functional testing Review and validate QA test plans; support the QA team during test execution Communicate team progress, accomplishments and KPIs to upper management Demonstrate an innovative mentality by staying aware of new developments within the product management space Stay abreast of United's business strategy, and other internal initiatives that intersect channel strategy and impact similar stakeholders. Required : Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or other related field or 8 years of equivalent work experience required. Solid knowledge of product management best practices, functional design and application delivery methodology 7+ years of prior experience as a Product Manager working within an enterprise IT organization Experienced working with Mobile App technologies While not a developer, candidate should possess a high-level understanding of IT systems and architecture to support discussions and communications Strong multi-tasker, proven experience handling multiple roles and projects simultaneously Experience working with cross-functional, global teams to deliver commitments on-time and on-budget Excellent analysis, problem solving and decision-making skills Attention to detail Proven analytical abilities Proven experience in an analytics and systems development capacity Practical experience generating process documentation and reports Strong communication skills verbal, written, and presentation Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Visio, and agile tools (JIRA, TFS/Azure DevOps) Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position Preferred: Knowledge of project management methodology and some project management experience Experienced with both agile and waterfall Experienced with User Experience Experience using JIRA and TFS/Azure DevOps Prior experience with cloud (AWS) applications Experience with data analytics and business intelligence (BI) tools Airline experience is a plus

title: Business Analyst
description: Description DOT Security’s mission is to improve the security posture of client organizations by providing detection, response, risk management, and compliance services as identified and required. DOT Security will implement processes, technology, and subject matter expert personnel to monitor and respond to client needs in the cybersecurity and compliance space. Working with client organizations, DOT Security will continuously measure and improve internal processes and technology, which will translate to improved services provided to the client. DOT Security leverages expert personnel, efficient processes, & effective technology to improve client cybersecurity through outstanding detection, response, risk management, & compliance services. DOT continuously improves internal processes & technology to enhance provided services & yield increased client resilience against cyberattacks. What you will be doing: The Business Analyst will oversee and coordinate several internal organizational initiatives over the foreseeable future. Your primary focus will be on organizing these projects, communicating effectively with key stakeholders and executives, and ensuring that all tasks are completed successfully. Responsibilities Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation. Follow the DOT Strategic Initiatives Framework. Project manage internal initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Shape project outputs by driving intended business outcomes. Work with stakeholders to define project requirements and deliverables. Act with a sense of urgency, identify alternatives, and set realistic timeframes for resolution. Complete work based on priority, follow through as promised, and set clear expectations. Demonstrate active listening and critical thinking skills to comprehend and address complex issues. Maintain awareness of industry advancements and their implications. Understand and present concepts to non-technical audiences. Resolve problems in their early stages and document details in a ticketing system. Things We Are Looking For 2+ years of experience in project management, project coordination, or business/operational analytics. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Adaptability to situations with incomplete data or without precedent. Clear, professional, and concise communication skills using various tools and platforms. Critical thinking and customer service skills. Experience in documenting and communicating complex concepts. Preparation and delivery of reports, plans, and briefings using presentation technology. Ability to work ethically and with integrity. Benefits 20 days of PTO 12+ paid holidays Flexible Sick Day Policy Paid Parental Leave Comprehensive Health, Disability Life, Dental and Vision Plans 401(K) discretionary match & retirement plans Continued education reimbursement On-going training & development opportunities
summary: DOT Security is seeking a Business Analyst to oversee and coordinate internal organizational initiatives. This role involves project management, communication with stakeholders, and ensuring successful completion of tasks. Responsibilities include developing project documentation, managing internal initiatives, shaping project outputs, defining project requirements, and working with stakeholders. The ideal candidate has 2+ years of experience in project management, strong organizational skills, and clear communication skills.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description Combined Insurance, a Chubb Company, is seeking a Business Analyst to join our fast-paced, high energy, growing company. We are proud of our tradition of success in the insurance industry of over 100 years. Come join our team of hard-working, talented professionals! Job Summary The Business Analyst will collaborate with various departments and stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements, processes, and workflows. They will translate these requirements into functional specifications for technology teams and work closely with project managers, developers, and testers to ensure successful project delivery. The Business Analyst will also be involved in identifying areas for process improvement and recommending solutions to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness. Responsibilities Translate business requirements into technical specifications and user stories, guiding the development team throughout the project lifecycle. Conduct comprehensive business process analysis to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation. Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, facilitating communication and ensuring alignment on project deliverables. Perform impact analysis and risk assessment to identify potential challenges and mitigate project risks. Participate in the design and implementation of software solutions, providing valuable insights to drive innovation, and efficiency. Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure that delivered solutions meet business requirements and quality standards. Provide ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users, addressing any issue or concerns related to the implemented solution. Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies, leveraging your expertise to recommend innovative solutions that drive business value. Skills QUALIFICATIONS Proficiency in business process modeling techniques and tools (e.g., BPMN, Visio) Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments, with a solid understanding of Agile methodologies. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Relevant certifications (e.g., CBAP, IIBA-AAC) are a plus. Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a proven track record of delivering successful IT projects in the insurance or related industry. About Us OUR BENEFITS Benefits As a Chubb corporate employee, you have access to one of the most comprehensive benefit plans in the business, designed to meet your needs and help you reach your financial goals. More details can be found here . Chubb is committed to supporting its employees with a comprehensive compensation package that is appropriate in the market where they work. Below are several of the many benefits we offer our employees: Health insurance Dental insurance Tuition reimbursement A company-match 401(k) plan Disability insurance Life insurance Employee referral bonuses About Combined Insurance Combined Insurance Company of America is a Chubb company and a leading provider of supplemental accident, health, disability, and life insurance products in North America. Headquartered in Chicago, with satellite office in Columbia, SC, Combined is celebrating over 100 years in business. We are committed to making the world of supplemental insurance easy to access and understand. The company has an A+ rating by the Better Business Bureau and an A + (Superior) financial strength rating by A.M. Best. We are ranked by VIQTORY as the number one Military Friendly® Employer in 2023 (over $1 billion revenue category), marking Combined's twelfth consecutive year on the Top 10 list. We pride ourselves on approaching all situations with a Positive Mental Attitude (PMA) and encouraging collaboration. About Chubb Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance, and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , LinkedIn , and Instagram #combined
summary: Combined Insurance, a Chubb company, is looking for a Business Analyst to join their team. This role will involve gathering, documenting, and analyzing business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and working closely with project managers, developers, and testers to ensure successful project delivery. The ideal candidate will have experience in business process modeling, Agile methodologies, and delivering IT projects in the insurance industry.

title: Business Analyst
description: The Krusteaz Company is looking for a talented, driven, and detailed Business Analyst to join the team! The Business Analyst position is responsible for supporting various processes and systems within The Krusteaz Company, with a focus on, Manufacturing Operations and Engineering applications and processes. This position requires strong business analysis, application support, and assistance to business users in identifying and evaluating new systems and procedures. The role serves as a liaison between internal business and technical stakeholders and facilitates the analysis, documentation, communication, and validation of business and system requirements. In addition, this role will involve various aspects of project management. This role can be located at our Corporate Office, one of our manufacturing locations, or remote within a state we currently have employees in. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time. Aid in discovering, analyzing, designing, testing, and implementing changes, enhancements, and upgrades to system(s). Elicit requirements utilizing interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis. Collaborate with project teams to clarify and improve implementation requirements and assist with project management and solution delivery. Reviews current business processes to help determine where automation/improvements will drive efficiency. Develops detailed implementation and contingency plans and support user training needs before, during, and after solution deployments. Collaborate with Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure, and Security teams to plan site infrastructure, as needed, to accommodate new equipment, systems, and processes. Supports prioritizing system issues and troubleshooting systems to propose fixes as appropriate. Assist in maintaining and enhancing systems, as required, to support changing business and technical needs. Interacts with vendors that may provide consulting, training, and support of enterprise applications. Participate and lead, as needed, new projects to ensure implementation success. Travel to implementation sites, when appropriate, to assist in the on-site deployment and training. Position Requirements To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals qualified with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Strong requirements elicitation and documentation skills required. Possesses ability in the business unit(s) they support and an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge. Strong interpersonal and facilitation skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills Adaptable, as well as skills in dealing with uncertainties. Works well in a team environment. Ability to travel up to 10% of the time is required, increasing travel based on business needs. Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business or information systems – related area or equivalent combined experience. 1-3 years of work experience in business/systems analysis and support of enterprise-wide application systems preferred. Physical Demands and Work Environment : While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, sit, talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone along with reaching. Specific vision abilities include close vision requirements due to computer work. Moderate noise, ability to work in a confined area, and ability to sit at a computer for an extended period of time are also included. The policy of The Krusteaz Company is to hire, train, and promote all persons in all job groups in accordance with law, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital or military status, national origin, gender identity, the presence of any sensory, mental or physical disability, genetic information, or any other status or characteristic protected by local, state, or federal law. Get to know us: A people-focused company that cares: We're a 90-year-old company with the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup and a focused eye on the future. As a midsized, privately held company with a portfolio of beloved food and beverage brands, our people are the most important ingredient in our success. A valued and supported workforce: We place tremendous value in our employees and provide competitive pay and comprehensive benefits to ensure our employees can create the best life for themselves. Benefits include a top tier health insurance plan with lower-than-average employee cost share, generous PTO, 401(k) match, and more. An engaged and energized culture: At The Krusteaz Company, collaboration and ingenuity drive our fierce commitment to creating extraordinary product experiences that people love. A place to grow and make a difference: An entrepreneurial spirit has been at the core of our company since the beginning, attracting self-starters who are curious and love to learn and to share ideas. Benefits: We are proud to offer generous benefits including comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance (starting at $50/month for employee only coverage on the PPO Plan or starting at $25/month for employee only coverage on the HDHP), 401(K) matching, 3 weeks of paid vacation, 10 paid holidays, company provided life insurance and disability insurance, flexible spending account, healthcare saving account, voluntary accident insurance, voluntary critical illness insurance, and tuition reimbursement. Salary Information: An employee in this position located in Washington State can expect a salary range between $90,555 and $149,406. We typically pay out between $102,000 and $130,000. The actual salary offered will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including internal equity, experience, education, certification, training, and location. All positions are eligible for additional incentives based on business performance. We hope you'll take the time to get to know us!
summary: The Krusteaz Company is seeking a Business Analyst to support various processes and systems, with a focus on Manufacturing Operations and Engineering applications. The ideal candidate will have strong business analysis, application support, and project management skills, and will serve as a liaison between internal business and technical stakeholders. This role requires strong requirements elicitation and documentation skills, a deep understanding of the business and IT systems, and strong interpersonal and communication skills. The position offers a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and the opportunity to contribute to a growing and successful company.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Title: Business Analyst Duration: 12-Month Contract to Hire Location: Chicago, IL, 60631, Hybrid(Tues/Wed/Thursday-Flexible) Job Summary The Business Analyst is responsible for documenting detailed business requirements and project scope. Includes user stories, business & workflow analysis, and architecture diagrams. Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, and decomposes high-level information into details. Distinguishes client requests from the underlying business needs. Responsible for developing epics and stories with the product owner to support the development and implementation of new systems and the enhancement of existing systems. Formulates and defines the system's scope and objectives based on both user needs and a good understanding of the application, business, operational, and/or industry requirements. Works with internal business groups on process improvement projects and is involved in testing, training, and implementing applications and/or systems. Serve as a liaison between business functions and program managers. Identify and implement business process improvements. Support the development and implementation of technology solutions. Responsibilities Extract and document functional and technical requirements from various stakeholders Document use cases as well as coordinate and participate in testing efforts Support definition and documentation of implementation and project plans Coordinate issue resolution and manage expectations across stakeholders Assess business processes to identify areas for improvement and drive appropriate changes Aid development of detailed conversion strategies and data mapping across platforms Coordinate functional leads in process modification design and documentation and training. Lead or participate in User Acceptance Testing strategy, planning, and execution Contribute to business cases and cost benefit analysis for new systems, features, or operational processes as required Contribute to product roadmaps for assigned systems, including upgrades, enhancements and integrations Investigate root causes and work with peer functions / teams to resolve or escalate issues Analyze data and monitor production errors to identify and drive improvements to metrics Identify and document functional problems or operational improvements Assist in gathering data to establish policies or procedures Skills & Knowledge 2-4 Years experience Agile Development Methodologies Data mapping/integration Process mapping/integration Ability to identify, review and analyze data trends Technical aptitude and familiarity with the end-to-end systems development lifecycle Proven ability to learn processes, infrastructure, systems and applications Ability to learn quickly, particularly regarding complex products, financial concepts or technologies Understanding of business processes and integration points Ability to operate in a dynamic environment and retain focus on goal achievement Ability to understand technical terms and translate into business language Excellent knowledge of MS Suite of products including Visio Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Ability to facilitate virtual and / or in-person meetings with large audiences Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills
summary: The Business Analyst is responsible for documenting detailed business requirements, project scope, user stories, workflow analysis, and architecture diagrams. They work with product owners to develop epics and stories to support the development and implementation of new systems and enhance existing systems. They serve as a liaison between business functions and program managers, identify and implement business process improvements, and support the development and implementation of technology solutions. This role requires 2-4 years of experience with agile development methodologies, data mapping/integration, process mapping/integration, and a strong understanding of the end-to-end systems development lifecycle.

title: Business Development Analyst
description: Our client, an asset manager in Chicago, is looking to add an Analyst to their Business Development team. Responsibilities Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to seek out opportunities with various markets and create tactical plans to identify performance gaps Help to execute marketing strategies and test sales theories Analyze data to ensure that all territories are meeting their KPI's Assist in developing territory specific marketing and sales plans to aid in growth objectives Report results of initiatives and act as an internal resource to all teams Qualifications Bachelor's degree (Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related) 0-3 years experience in financial services FINRA Series 7 and Series 63 (or obtain within 3 months of hire) Strong Excel skills Salesforce knowledge a plus
summary: An asset manager in Chicago is seeking a Business Development Analyst to collaborate with cross-functional teams, execute marketing strategies, analyze data, and develop territory-specific plans to achieve growth objectives.

title: Automation Business Analyst (Remote)
description: The RPA Business Analyst works with Automation team and key stakeholders to create automated solutions for the business. The role is a key link between the technical team and the business stakeholders to ensure effective solutions are delivered which drive meaningful and measurable business value. The role will analyze and document complex business processes (AS-IS and TO-BE) for targeted processes.  The candidate would also support the facilitation of discovery sessions across multiple teams and business units and lead the adoption / implementation activities associated with new RPA solutions within the business. The Business Analyst works with cross-functional teams and business units to understand, challenge, and provide thought leadership on strategy to achieve the company’s goals through business and technology transformation. They identify automation opportunities, define RPA value proposition and re-engineer processes to improve automation potential. This position is 100% remote. Due to the nature of the public sector at this time only USA citizens are being staffed. Job Duties And Responsibilities Partner with the Business Process Owner(s) to develop a deep end-to-end understanding of processes targeted for automation and outline the impacted processes and business requirements Engage with cross-functional teams to develop business requirements documentation of the process to be automated in a manner that is understood by the business users and can be shared with Automation Team solution design and development teams Works with the Automation Team to facilitate the planning and execution of RPA and other Automation projects Work with Business owners to perform value analysis (ROI) for the processes Coordinate with the business and the RPA team to identify and provide support for solution designs for production issues and enhancements Identify scope, benefits, constraints, and risks for RPA and other automation initiatives, capture, and document current state of manual processes Identify and document best practices for ongoing Automation adoption Facilitate sessions with stakeholders to drive out requirements Consider change management implications for implementation of new RPA and automation processes Deliver key business analysis artifacts, using best practices and tools, for the design, solution, and execution of medium and large projects Document and diagram the existing environment and dataflows Gather non-functional requirements such as security, capacity performance and availability Act as a liaison between business and technical resources Recommend ‘to-be’ process map designs using Cross-functional flowcharts. Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements Conduct Process diagnostics & opportunity identification Define requirements, creating user stories (if Agile) or BRD or Disaggregation sheets (for RPA) Help design, document, and maintain system processes Creating Business Case and ROI which can be submitted for review and approvals Essential Knowledge Strong customer service focus with the proven ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with team members, stakeholders, and management.  Demonstrate strong collaboration across all levels of the organization Ability to work independently, with limited supervision, whilst participating fully as a member of the Automation team Effective persuasive communication including the ability to influence SMEs and business stakeholders toward change, automation, and continuous improvement Knowledge of RPA technologies and AI best practices with process automation and operational excellence Ability to translate requirements into processes and controls Strong analytical skills, coupled with a logic, discipline, and structured approach to documentation and procedures Flexible and dynamic personality Excellent spoken and written communication. Assertive and confident raising action points with senior individuals Experience of working on major automation projects Experience/knowledge of a range of technical platforms and solutions Work with individuals to understand and build detailed process maps and business requirements documents Ability to rapidly grasp processes and identify potential RPA and automation solutions Integrate leading practices on process discovery & mapping into the day-to-day delivery of business requirements documents Willingness to learn and become an expert in RPA and other Intelligent Automation solutions 3-5 years of experience supporting business process documentation with business owners and SMEs across multiple geographically disbursed teams
summary: The RPA Business Analyst role involves collaborating with the Automation team and stakeholders to develop and implement automated solutions. The individual will analyze and document complex business processes, facilitate discovery sessions, lead adoption of RPA solutions, identify automation opportunities, and define value propositions. They will also work with cross-functional teams to ensure the delivery of effective solutions that drive measurable business value. The position is remote and requires US citizenship.

title: Scrum Master/Infrastructure Business Analyst
description: ONLY LOCALS 5 Months Contract Onsite 5 days per week Work hours: 7:00am - 4:00pm Job Post Summary Seeking a Scrum Master / Business Analyst (Infrastructure) to serve as a liaison between technical and non-technical departments to ensure all project requirements are clearly understood and met. Job Post Description Job Description We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Scrum Master / Business Analyst to join our team. Facilitate and guide the planning, tracking, and other day-to-day activities of an Agile project team, specifically focusing on infrastructure projects. Ensure team adherence to Agile principles and practices, maintaining the flexibility to adapt to emerging business and technology needs. Serve as a liaison between technical and non-technical departments to ensure all project requirements are clearly understood and met. Utilize Azure DevOps for backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition, as well as fostering continuous improvement. Manage project documentation and ensure it is kept up-to-date within Confluence. Create and maintain dashboards in PowerBI to track project KPIs and provide insights to stakeholders. Utilize Microsoft Office tools to prepare presentations and reports, enhancing communication across teams. Oversee incident and problem resolution workflows within ServiceNow, ensuring quick resolution and minimal impact. Manage project portfolios and resource allocations using Clarity, ensuring optimal deployment of resources across projects. Does regular sprints Qualifications Proven experience as a Scrum Master and/or Business Analyst in IT infrastructure environments. Requires a deep understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, with a particular focus on infrastructure projects. Proficient in Azure DevOps, Confluence, PowerBI, Microsoft Office, ServiceNow, and Clarity. Certified Scrum Master (CSM/SAFe) or equivalent Agile certification. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically. Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across diverse audiences. Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities. Experience in the IT infrastructure sector is highly preferred. Advanced certifications in Agile methodologies or Project Management (e.g., PMP, PMI-ACP) are desirable. Experience with ADO Documentation skills Background in web development would be great
summary: Seeking a Scrum Master / Business Analyst with experience in IT infrastructure to lead and manage Agile projects, ensuring alignment between technical and non-technical teams. Requires proficiency in Azure DevOps, Confluence, PowerBI, Microsoft Office, ServiceNow, and Clarity.

title: Business Analyst
description: Summary: The IT Business Analyst performs analysis activities that support the decision making regarding matching data solutions (platform selection, configuration, development) with business, user(s), and functional needs from stakeholders.  This involves conducting market research, functional comparisons, and staying abreast of what is being done at other law firms and professional services firms.  The analyst will also gather requirements, document procedures, and review the data management and data governance methods of the current processes across portfolios. This person partners with the appropriate business stakeholders and the Senior IT Program Manager to prioritize and create project roadmaps for all data management capabilities including data warehouse, data governance, and analytics efforts. With the business and IT teams, they maintain a set of institutional knowledge of what is working well across the firm and what needs improvement. What you'll be doing Partner with business stakeholders to understand and prioritize their needs, creating a roadmap of projects for their assigned area. Monitor and perform work related to incoming requests from business stakeholders for changes, updates, and other technical issues to the Sidley intranet site. Seek input of user experience and document current procedures and processes to determine potential improvements to their assigned products. Stay abreast of best practices being done at other firms and technology developments that may affect the areas.  Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders and the IT Portfolio Managers to influence the technology decisions for the areas based on this knowledge. Analyze and consolidate all perspectives on the project - business needs, requirements, user experience, security, training, risk, time, cost, technology architecture, procurement/vendor management, operational considerations, etc. - to help the Firm reach the best technology decisions. Manage the lifecycle of their assigned products, from inception to implementation, throughout production until retirement / upgrade. Gather business requirements from project stakeholders to further define the goals and objectives. Drives projects and business teams toward achieving intended business results within a specified time and budget. Perform risk analyses to identify and resolve critical path issues. Prepare and analyze program / project related data. Review and report on program / project status. Prepare materials for briefings and presentations to large size groups of key decision makers at the executive level. Other duties as assigned. Required skills 2-5 years of experience as an IT Business Analyst Nice to have experience: Bachelor's Degree Experience working on vendor (3 rd party) software projects Experience researching vendor (3 rd party) software and/or vetting vendor (3 rd party) software
summary: The IT Business Analyst analyzes business needs and data solutions, conducts market research, and gathers requirements to ensure optimal data management and governance. They collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize projects and create roadmaps for data warehouse, governance, and analytics initiatives. This role involves staying updated on industry best practices and influencing technology decisions, while managing the lifecycle of assigned products from inception to retirement.

title: Business Analyst
description: Business Analyst in cloud data warehousing he IT Business Analyst role partners with our business to define areas of functional need and translate those needs into requirements for project execution. This role is part of the IT Enterprise Data team which includes the collection, management, and conversion of raw data into usable information for business to interpret. Our goal is to make data accessible so that our organization can use it to evaluate and optimize our performance. The Senior Business Analyst role is responsible for understanding and documenting business requirements into agile stories; translating business needs into actionable technology requirements; developing and describing business benefits; creating and cascading reference and training materials; providing functional and acceptance testing support; analyzing current state and providing gap analysis; and delivering sprints and product releases against business objectives, priorities and strategy while ensuring a quality supportable product. Looking for a Senior Business Analyst who is strong in cloud data warehousing, source to target data mapping, data modeling, turning business discussions into functional and technical requirements. Strong in Agile, Scrum, Jira, SQL, and MS O365. Exposure / Knowledge in AWS, Snowflake, and Tableau.
summary: Senior Business Analyst responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, translating them into actionable technical requirements, and ensuring quality data warehousing solutions in the cloud.

The analyst will also gather requirements, document procedures, and review the methods of the current processes. The Business Analyst partners with the appropriate business stakeholders and the Program Manager to prioritize and create a project roadmap for their assigned area. summary: The Business Analyst bridges the gap between business needs and technology solutions by conducting market research, analyzing functional requirements, and documenting procedures. They collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize projects and create roadmaps, ensuring alignment between business goals and IT capabilities. This role involves gathering requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and staying informed about industry best practices and emerging technologies. The analyst plays a critical role in decision-making processes, consolidating diverse perspectives and driving projects towards successful outcomes within budget and time constraints.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst - US
description: Role: Salesforce Business Analyst Location: Waukegan, IL (Work from Office) Duration: Only FTE. It requires strong Salesforce knowledge, experience with data modeling and integrations, and excellent communication skills.

title: Associate Product Owner (Business Analyst)
description: Company Description AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. Our Business Technology Solutions (BTS) team shapes the digital transformation accelerating the future of medicine at AbbVie—and we do it together, asking bold questions and taking on tough challenges through deep, honest collaboration. In the role of Associate Product Owner , you will join a diverse, enterprise team that invests in your customized career growth and uses technology and data to positively impact people’s lives. As an Associate Product Owner you are part of Employee Experience team. This team is focused on enhancing productivity with friction-free processes, quick answers to common questions, and simple task automations – creating the flexibility, space, and time for colleagues to work on what matters most – discovering and delivering solutions that address complex health issues. Our organization is delivering AI-powered chatbot that will measurably improve employee productivity for our 50,000+ employees worldwide. In this role, you will be working with cross functional areas to define use cases, prioritize value, and design solutions to extend an AI-powered chatbot, and ensure the final product delights our employees. In this role, you will get the chance to work with a wide variety of stakeholders from BTS and the line-of-business functions that BTS supports. Job Description In this role you’ll be responsible for: Business Case Development and Value Mapping: Collaborate with Product Owner, stakeholders, UX design, and the team to create user requirements and user stories. Prioritize backlog based on value and urgency under the direction of the Product Owner. Align and partner with business areas and IT departments. Map end to end process and create improvement opportunities with cost savings or avoidance, productivity improvements, or revenue generating business benefits. Agile Software Lifecycle: Build exceptional user experience and make cross functional support quick and easy with AI chatbot. As part of the agile team, you write requirements and user stories. Collaborate with developers, designers, and various stakeholders to build features that meet the requirements. Conduct testing to ensure the system is working as designed and fit for purpose. Develop test plans and drive end-user and stakeholder alignment. Stakeholder Management: Develop strong cross functional business relationships and integrate activities with other organizations and cross functional teams to ensure successful implementation and support of project efforts. Lead workshops, brainstorming sessions, and meetings. Collaborate across various business and IT organizations to ensure systems are fit-for-purpose, meet the requirements, and technical standards of IT delivery. Change Management: Serve as point of contact to stakeholders, gathering feedback and incorporating it into product development. Expose business users to features early and often. Create training materials, conduct training, and build awareness of the new features and its capabilities through various channels. Continuous Improvement: Analyze user feedback, user research, chatbot data, and input from cross-functional stakeholders to find insights and recommend product improvements. Apply business and technology knowledge to identify use cases in various domains and make recommendations to simplify complex work processes. Tools and skills you will use in this role: JIRA and ServiceNow for Software Lifecycle Mural or similar for leading workshops and business case development Miro, Visio, or similar for process mapping Elevated Microsoft Office skills – PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Forms, Stream Prompt engineering skills using Generative AI tools and experience building conversational design Video training development (micro training via PowerPoint video recording or similar) Power Automate and similar no code/low code tools for building workflows Power BI or Spotfire or similar analytics tools for visualizing data Good documentation and best practices for agile software lifecycle Clear interpersonal communication, proofreading, editing, and formatting Qualifications Experiences that make you a strong candidate for this role: Required Bachelor’s Degree with 6 years of experience, or Masters with 5 years of experience, or a PhD Agile methodologies, scrum, and Kanban frameworks experience Business case development, value mapping, and user stories development in enterprise environment/systems Demonstrated experience in creating and executing data driven, risk-based test strategies Experience mapping current and future processes using digital tools Experience working in a complex, cross functional teams Demonstrated excellent analytic, judgment and consultative capabilities Strong written, visual, and verbal communication skills, including the ability to work with both IT staff and business Demonstrates a genuine passion for enhancing user experience Beneficial Work experience in the pharmaceutical industry Knowledge & experience in AI-Systems and/or chatbots Prior experience working with UX design teams & conversational design interfaces is a bonus Experience with Nexthink, ServiceNow, Microsoft PowerApps Experience with IT, HR, Finance, and Procurement enterprise systems Experience working on projects with RPA/automations Experience working with API integrations of various enterprise systems Additional Information Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. Note: No amount of pay is a considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.
summary: AbbVie is looking for an Associate Product Owner to join their Business Technology Solutions team. This role will focus on developing and implementing an AI-powered chatbot for employees. Responsibilities include business case development, agile software lifecycle management, stakeholder management, change management, and continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will have experience with agile methodologies, user story development, data-driven testing, and process mapping. They will also have excellent communication skills and a passion for enhancing user experience. Bonus points for experience in the pharmaceutical industry, AI systems, UX design, and specific tools like Nexthink, ServiceNow, Microsoft PowerApps.

title: USA - Business Analyst I

Job Requirements & Responsibilities: • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are a must with sharp attention to detail and accuracy • Ability to act with a sense of urgency and prioritize and manage multiple requests and projects and meet deadlines. • Support Pricing team with quick and accurate sales reporting. Job Qualifications: Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Excel a must. Education: Bachelor's Degree preferred
summary: Support the US Commercial Operations Pricing team by creating customer sales data reports for the sales organization. Responsibilities include analyzing data, prioritizing tasks, and delivering accurate reports. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is essential.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours. The Senior Business Analyst, Sales Intelligence & Analytics will join the Data, Tools and Reporting Operations Team – a newly built team that is responsible for developing the revenue intelligence infrastructure for Cision globally by enhancing and maintaining our BI platform, building reports and dashboards, overseeing and assuring hygiene of Sales-related data, developing data and analytic programs and supporting the business in data analysis. The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for close collaboration with leaders across the organization to drive the development and adoption of our BI platform Domo, build and expand our KPI frameworks, gather requirements for projects related to our intelligence infrastructure, and translates those requirements into technical specifications for report writers, SQL developers and data engineers. While the focus of the Senior Business Analyst is placed on collaboration and development of our KPI framework, they also need to technical to understand our data infrastructure end-to-end, drive efficient collaboration with data engineers, and build reports and dashboards by themselves if the need arises. The ideal candidate will be able to deliver results, take ownership of work and outputs, find a way to work through barriers, and work efficiently. We’re looking for someone to think analytically about the business, have a critical eye for detail, and have high expectations and standards. This is a fast-paced and evolving commercial environment that requires excellent communication skills, the ability to multi-task and work towards a deadline. The right candidate will possess superb analytical skills and the ability to work as a team, not only with the Sales and Revenue Operations leaders and their colleagues but cross-functionally across the organization to drive growth and retention. Responsibilities Support organizational decision-making with data-driven insights Create and define metrics for the business, specific regions and teams Work closely with business stakeholders to gather business requirements, translate them into technical specification and oversee implementation Provide technical expertise and best practice to support and guide the business in the use of data Review and optimize data quality – identify and resolve data issues and consult on new processes and methods to correct at source Reporting Responsibilities Report on KPIs to measure performance for the business, specific regions and teams Work across regional and global Sales, Marketing, FP&A, Product and Customer Success functions to deliver reporting, insights and recommendations Design, build and maintain high-quality dashboards, KPIs and visualisations on our BI platform Domo Liaise and support the report building team in design and delivery of dashboards and reports Help maintain the reporting and analytics infrastructure in our BI platform to help support business decisions and team management Other Key Responsibilities Act as regional point of contact for the Data, Tools and Reporting Operations team, evaluate and document requests Establish and document standardized processes and best practices within Domo Conduct training sessions for end-users on Domo functionalities Identify system inefficiencies/gaps, troubleshoot operational issues, and explore opportunities for updates Work with the SQL developer or data engineer on new builds, existing iteration and refactoring Work with the SQL developer and report analyst on the administration and maintenance of Domo Implement and monitor data quality checks and ensure data accuracy Establish processes for identifying and addressing data quality issues Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. A Master’s degree or an MBA can be advantageous. Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in a related field, ideally in B2B SaaS Experienced in stakeholder management and stakeholder communications Experience with data visualisation tools to create reports and dashboards, able to articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner Effective planning and organizational skills Proficient in decision-making, analysis, and problem-solving, with the ability to multitask Experience working in a highly collaborative, dynamic, and team-oriented work environment High level of general technical understanding Understanding of best practice business processes Easily adopts to new technology Problem solving capabilities, attention to detail, data handling skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including ability to build and maintain positive working relationships with team members, internal customers, high-level staff and external vendors, strong customer service orientation, good writing skills, ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical audiences Understanding of user experience Experience of working with large volumes of data Experience training and supporting users Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., SQL) preferred Experience with Salesforce preferred Proficient in MS Office (primarily Excel) Knowlege of Domo is a bonus but not required Hybrid schedule 2-3 days a week in our Chicago office.
summary: Cision is seeking a Senior Business Analyst, Sales Intelligence & Analytics to join their Data, Tools and Reporting Operations Team. This role will focus on developing the revenue intelligence infrastructure for Cision globally, enhancing and maintaining their BI platform Domo, building reports and dashboards, and supporting the business in data analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, experience with data visualization tools, and a proven ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

title: Business Analyst I
description: Title: Business Analyst I Location: Deerfield, IL(Hybrid) Duration: 7 Months (Possible of Extension) Pay range: $48.00/hr on W2 to $53.00/hr on W2 Must be available to work hybrid Project Objective Spin off the Renal Care and Acute Therapies global business units into an independent, publicly traded company. Project Scope Lead and/or support the UCAN (US and Canada) Fulfillment project activities such as schedule, tasks, communication, etc… to successfully separate the business. Project Timeline Expected to occur by July 2024 or earlier, and subject to the satisfaction of customary conditions. UCAN Fulfillment is expected to be ready by 2/1. Project Phases Planning (Q1-Q2, 2023): Examine how we operate today and define future operations and separation plans by workstream. Execution (Q3-Q4, 2023): Focus on building out the structure and operations of the new Kidney Co based on the requirements identified in the Planning phase. Spin Readiness (Q1, 2024): Conduct a "soft" implementation that provides an opportunity for Client and the new Kidney Co to "practice" operating independently of one another, while legally remaining as one company. Project Milestones The Fulfillment team has established over 20 key milestones to achieve for a successful launch. This section focuses on the main purpose of the job in one to four sentences. Analyze business processes. Identify, evaluate, develop and or redesign systems and procedures to meet user requirements. Create detailed written user requirements for developers. Provide consultation to customers on business process redesign. Assist in the development of system documentation and training materials as well as training processes. This section contains a list of five to eight primary responsibilities of this role that account for 5% or more of the work. The incumbent will perform other duties assigned. Own key tasks, demonstrate solid business knowledge, require moderate direction, give minimal guidance to others, handle moderately complex problems, possess solid knowledge of SDLC 1. Gather, understand and document business objectives, specifications and requirements on small/medium size projects. 2. Develop and execute unit/system test cases, scripts and plans. 3. Define, design, and document business flows and processes on small & medium size projects. 4. Define and articulate business rules required for data accuracy and consistency. Identify and resolve data quality issues. Act as the primary contact for the data management process between IT developers and the business. 5. Provide end-user support on applications supported within the organization. 6. Identify, analyze, propose and document appropriate solutions for problems and issues that may impact the project. Identify and understand issues that may impact day-to-day operations and or project costs. Use technical tools for (queries, process maps, etc) for problem resolution. 7)Understand and follow appropriate SDLC, quality validation processes and application processes. 8)Communicate status, solutions and concerns. Disseminate information in a timely manner within the team and across functions or teams. title: Biofuels Business and Compliance Analyst
description: Entity: Customers & Products Job Family Group: Strategic Planning & Business Development Group Job Description: About the Role: The Biofuels Business and Compliance Analyst is a multifaceted position acting as a crucial link between business analytics and the deployment of biofuels and low carbon products and initiatives. This position involves generating valuable business insights, pinpointing growth potential, and aiding in the implementation of biofuels and low carbon products and programs in the organization. We're seeking individuals who are analytically adept, collaborative, and motivated to join our team. Our team is comprised of diverse and highly capable individuals, and we value diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) as a core strength. We prioritize supporting our team members with work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements! Key Responsibilities: Conduct business and commercial analytics to evaluate the impact of regulatory changes, market dynamics, and relevant forecasting initiatives on business growth and compliance. This will involve taking ownership to run SAP queries, extract and analyze data, and develop data visualization dashboards. Play a key role in supporting the development of commercial offerings for biofuels and low carbon products within associated regulatory programs through research and analysis, market evaluation, compliance assistance, and setting appropriate business processes. Generate market trends and patterns from commercial data sources, reports, and publications on biofuels and low carbon regulatory programs and translate to commercial insights for growth initiatives. Collaborate with the implementation teams to execute tasks crucial for project success that includes but not limited to data collection, documentation, record maintenance, updating relevant systems and deployment of new processes and framework. Evaluate areas for improvement and develop digital tools and standardization processes to improve efficiency and reliability for biofuels growth and implementation activities. Ensure compliance with ethical standards, data privacy regulations, and company policies in the collection, analysis, and dissemination of market data and insights. Stays in sync with bp’s Code of Conduct and models bp’s “who we are” framework of Live Our Purpose, Play to Win, and Care for Others. Role Requirements: Bachelor's Degree Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data to actionable insights. Strong Excel skills with SAP experience is highly desirable. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey sophisticated concepts in a clear and concise manner. Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously. Proficiency in data analysis software Understanding of either: bio and low carbon markets;bio and low carbon regulatory environments; or strong understanding of bp products and how they flow through the value chains. Considering Joining bp? At bp, we support our people to learn and grow in a diverse and exciting environment. We believe that our team is strengthened by diversity. bp is committed to encouraging an inclusive environment in which everyone is respected and treated fairly. There are many aspects of our employees’ lives that are meaningful, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits can include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, excellent retirement benefits, and more! How much do we pay (Base)? ($120K-$150K) *Note that the pay range listed for this position is a genuinely expected and reasonable estimate of the range of possible base compensation at the time of posting. Travel Requirement Up to 10% travel should be expected with this role Relocation Assistance: This role is not eligible for relocation Remote Type: This position is a hybrid of office/remote working Skills: Acquisitions and divestments, Acquisitions and divestments, Agreements and negotiations, Analytics, Commercial Acumen, Commercial Business Development, Communication, Contractual risk management, Data visualization and interpretation, Deal structuring, Decision Making, Developing and implementing strategy, Economic evaluation methodology, Economic modelling, Financial Analysis, Financial Modelling, Influencing, Investment appraisal, Joint Venture Structuring, Long Term Planning, Managing change, Market Analysis, Project and programme management, Risk Management, Sector, market, customer and competitor understanding {+ 2 more} Legal Disclaimer: We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation related to bp’s recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us to request accommodations. If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.
summary: The Biofuels Business and Compliance Analyst role involves analyzing market trends, evaluating regulatory changes, and developing strategies for deploying biofuels and low carbon products. Responsibilities include conducting business analytics, supporting commercial offerings, generating insights from data, collaborating with implementation teams, improving processes, and ensuring compliance.

title: Business Technology Analyst
description: Who We Are Catalyst is a leader in delivering elegant, high-impact solutions designed, built, and implemented by our world-class team, exceeding our clients’ expectations, and setting them up to delivery first-class services to their customers. And though we are made up of highly sought-after technologists, analysts, designers, and managers, we are so much more! We are artists, athletes, musicians, culinary experts, reading enthusiasts, parents, and friends mixing our diverse backgrounds with our united passion and expansive technical knowledge to deliver WOW solutions. Catalyst is seeking a talented, experienced Business Technology Analyst to help our clients analyze their business processes and identify technology applications to effectively address their organizational needs. You will be the vital team member connecting our clients to our technologist, working in tandem to produce technology solutions that surpass the expectations of our clients. Responsibilities include: Analyze our clients business processes and objectives, and how technology can be applied to achieve them, Develop detailed specifications for new systems or modifications to existing ones, Serve as a liaison between business units and technical teams during system implementation, Create clear and precise user stories based off gathered requirements, Test new systems to ensure they meet business requirements and user needs, Train users on new systems and provide ongoing support, Monitor systems after go-live to ensure they are meeting business needs and make recommendations for improvements, Prepare reports on system performance and usage metrics, Stay up to date on new technology trends and developments and how they can be applied to business needs, Identify potential risks associated with proposed technology solutions and coordinate with project manager to develop mitigation plans, What you’ll need to be successful: Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or related field, 5+ years professional experience in business analysis, systems analysis, or a related role, Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, Ability to understand complex technical concepts and communicate them to non-technical staff, Strong facilitation and requirements gathering skills, Excellent written and verbal communication skills, Experience with Agile methodology, Experience working in the software development industry, Experience working in public sector, a plus. Experience defining requirements for Salesforce implementations, a plus Experience with SAP, a plus How we’ll set you up for success: Competitive salary, Ample time off (starting at 36 days), Company computer, Home office set-up assistance, Autonomic work schedule, Virtual and in-person social events, Training & certification reimbursement, Professional growth opportunities.
summary: Catalyst is looking for a Business Technology Analyst with 5+ years of experience to analyze business processes, identify technology solutions, and serve as a liaison between clients and technical teams. Responsibilities include requirements gathering, system design, testing, user training, and performance monitoring. Ideal candidates will have strong analytical, communication, and facilitation skills, experience with Agile methodology, and familiarity with Salesforce and SAP.

title: D365 Business Analyst
description: About Our Family Of Companies We are on a mission to bring learning to life ! At our family of companies, Learning Resources® , Educational Insights , and hand2mind , we create a unique range of toys, educational products and supplemental curriculum trusted by teachers and loved by families alike. Voted among the Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces for the last four consecutive years, we are a 350-person strong, family-owned organization dedicated to helping kids succeed in school and develop a love of learning. In addition to high-quality, hands-on products like VersaTiles® and Cuisenaire® Rods, we make award-winning toys, including top sellers such as the Pretend & Play® Cash Register, the Farmer’s Market Color Sorting Set and Toy of the Year winner Botley® the Coding Robot as well as Educational Insights top sellers Kanoodle®, GeoSafari® Jr. series, and Playfoam™. We pride ourselves on being committed to our employee’s personal and professional development, a thriving culture and a diverse, creative atmosphere. Along with our culture and competitive benefits package, we offer opportunities for training and development by Harvard and UCLA professors as well as in-demand, motivating external speakers. We are looking for professionals who are truly just kids at heart! We hope you’ll come join our award-winning team today! Position Description We are currently seeking a D365 Business Analyst to support our ERP systems. Scope Of Responsibilities The individual in this role will: Collaborate with Warehouse, Operations, and Engineering departments to identify D365 and Co Pilot optimizations. Which includes design, test, and implement those initiatives. Coordinate with department heads to assess departmental application training needs and objectives. Ensure that the trainers or designated power users are fully trained in current and new functionality, (train the trainers). Collaborate with Vendors (ISV’s), and third parties to support the functionality and integrations between D365 and peripheral systems. Ensure those are working as designed. Field incoming problem tickets from end users to resolve application and software issues. Record, track, and document the problem-solving process to final resolution. Participate in the routine Microsoft upgrades by providing guidance, expertise, and testing upgrades and enhancements to the applications. Communicate application problems and issues to key stakeholders, including management, development teams, and end users. Engage in ongoing training to learn and expand expertise on the software applications used and supported by the organization. Requirements/Preferences In-depth, hands-on knowledge and experience with enterprise and desktop applications, including MS Dynamics 365/MS AX, Supply Chain and Warehouse Management, Azure DevOps, MS Excel, MS Word. Experience with Microsoft CRM/CE a plus. Working knowledge of International processing. A college diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, or equivalent experience in information systems is required. Proven experience with troubleshooting principles, methodologies, and issue-resolution techniques. Able to develop and interpret technical documentation. Good understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives Ideal Attributes Highly self-motivated and directed. Ability to absorb new ideas and concepts quickly. Good analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language. Very strong customer service orientation. Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentational skills. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. We are a drug-free workplace and an EEO employer. Please note: This role will be filled by our internal recruitment team, so no assistance is needed from any outside staffing agency at this time .
summary: We are seeking a D365 Business Analyst to support our ERP systems. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in building out a target operating model for our front office trading platforms, including Execution Management Systems (EMS), Order Management Systems (OMN) and Portfolio Management Systems (PMS). This role requires a deep understanding of front office trading systems, FX markets and technical acumen to effectively bridge the gap between business needs and technology solutions. FX Business Analyst - Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Admin, IT or a related fields Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in the capital markets sector, with a focus on front office trading systems and FX trading. Strong knowledge of EMS, OMS and PMS platforms and their role in trading operations Technically savvy with the ability to understand system architectures, data flows and integration points Excellent communication, presentation and stakeholder management skills Strong analytical and problem solving skills As Business Analyst you will Gather and document detailed business requirements from front office trading teams and other relevant stakeholders. Translate business requirements into functional specifications for technology teams Conduct impact analysis and feasibility studies for proposed changes and enhancements Support the implementation of new trading platforms and system upgrades Participate in system testing, including developing test cases, performing user acceptance testing and coordinating with users for feedback Serve as a liaison between front office trading teams, IT, vendors and other stakeholders to ensure effective communication & collaboration Conduct regular meetings with stakeholders to review project progress, address issues and gather feedback Exciting Opportunity to join this highly visible team and make an impact! Experience in quality program reporting Preferred. Effective communication skills Ability to read gap analysis and data validation reports. Technical experience with SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services, and job running & monitoring. Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write select queries. Strong data analysis skills Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Experience troubleshooting data files and technical systems. Understanding of claims data, provider data, and supplemental data. You will collaborate with partners to gather and document requirements, work with development teams to ensure accurate interpretation, and monitor system performance.  This role requires a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field, experience with multiple sites in an ERP environment, proficiency with Syteline ERP system, and experience working with Finance, Projects, Shop Floor Operations, and APS in manufacturing. The position is fully remote with approximately 20% travel.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Digital Experience
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton. Job Overview We have a new opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst based out of our corporate headquarters in Milwaukee, WI or Chicago, IL. Fully remote work or alternative work locations will not be considered. As a Senior Business Analyst specializing in Digital Experience (DX) Platforms, you will help Komatsu to build a new face to its customers. As such, you will use your industry insights and experience to understand and enrich our product vision. Main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes and process changes, relaying requirements to downstream technical teams for build and deploy functions and coordinating user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role, you should have strong communications skills, an analytical way of thinking and be able to quickly learn, absorb, and explain complex business concepts as well as IT enablement concepts. This role will be expected be conversant in the following areas: eCommerce Digital marketing Digital Sales Enablement and CPQ Digital Asset Management Product information management (PIM) Identity and Access Management Customer insights Contact Center concepts Content Management Key Job Responsibilities Partner with business stakeholders to identify and capture business requirements, documenting those in Azure DevOps (ADO). Analyze and document current processes, changes to processes, and/or new processes to be defined, including cross-functional impacts across business functions. Cascade requirements to downstream technical teams, including providing explanations as needed to build teams. Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation Lead meetings, e.g., business requirements review, testing engagement, etc. Actively participate in formal presentations to a variety of management levels. Coordinate system/user testing as required; analyze and validate testing results. Act as a reference and provide support to application users with respect to questions arising from application/functionality adoption and use. Perform rules authoring as required to support business requirements Stay current with industry trends and best practices in digital experience platforms, application logging, monitoring, and observability. Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor’s degree in information technology or a related field Minimum of five years of prior Business Analyst experience Strong understanding of process engineering and re-engineering, as well as process optimization. Experience with content management systems (CMS), ecommerce platforms, and CRM systems, such as Salesforce, or Adobe Experience Manager. Familiarity with DevOps platforms, including documentation of epics/user stories/features, as well as requirements traceability (RTM). Proven track record of successfully capturing, documenting, and communicating requirements for digital experience platforms, including experience with the following domains and concepts: eCommerce Digital marketing Digital Sales Enablement and CPQ Digital Asset Management Product information management (PIM) Identity and Access Management Customer insights Contact Center concepts Content Management Additional Information Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
summary: Komatsu seeks a Senior Business Analyst to help build a new customer-facing digital experience (DX) platform. The role involves capturing and documenting business requirements, analyzing and documenting processes, and coordinating user testing.  The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, analytical thinking, and experience with various digital platforms including ecommerce, digital marketing, and CRM systems.

title: BA - Airline - Onsite -CHICAGO, IL- ONLY W2- MUST Have AIRLINE EXP.
description: A Senior Business Analyst is a member of a focused product team that performs business analysis tasks using techniques that enable a highly iterative delivery approach of continuous requirements identification and just-in-time definition of requirements. The Sr. Business Analyst will be working with motivated teams on highly visible and valuable employee facing digital products. This position requires an excellent communicator with outstanding analytical skills in order to collaborate with business users, technology teams and leadership in an Agile environment. Translates high level requirements into detailed level requirements (user stories) to be consumed by the development pods in each sprint, while ensuring stories and features are added iteratively to the product to add overall value Analyzes data to ensure features are aligned with product goals/objectives and delivering the most business value Creates acceptance criteria that is clear, concise and actionable Works with User Experience (UX) analysts to ensure prototypes convey story intent Works with IT Development team and EQA to understand the boundaries of any given story Contributes to overall definition of strategy and scope, including working with business stakeholders to understand why we are working on something before development begins Prefer experience building end user software for PSS system. This project about building an airport agent software tool to manage customers and flights. Airline experience preferred!!!! Required Ability to understand, communicate and engage effectively with multiple stakeholders and interactions Strong problem-solving, listening, written and verbal communication, and decision-making skills Ability to understand, communicate and engage effectively with multiple stakeholders and interactions Strong problem-solving, listening, written and verbal communication, and decision-making skills 1 - 2 years Agile /Scrum experience 8 + Years BA experience AIRLINE EXP. MUST HAVE**************
summary: Senior Business Analyst needed to work on a product team developing an airport agent software tool for managing customers and flights. The role requires excellent communication and analytical skills, strong understanding of Agile methodologies, and experience building end-user software for PSS systems. Airline experience is a must.
