title: Business Analyst
description: Positions available in Chicago, Cleveland and Columbus About Us Do great things in uncharted territory and experience the excitement of taking your career to new heights at INSIGHT2PROFIT, a rapidly growing leader in pricing and profitability consulting and technology. At INSIGHT, smart and ambitious people just like you are transforming the way businesses think and operate to achieve extraordinary outcomes. With our proven business model and your fresh perspective, you'll have the opportunity to take on a highly visible role, make a meaningful impact, and help steer our company towards even greater heights. Join us today and take your career to and take your career to the next level with INSIGHT! Are you a problem solver? Investigate our consultant opportunities. Using your detective skills, you’ll identify and define the analytical and reporting needs required to support our clients. You will use your business and client knowledge while partnering with the Engagement Leader, Manager, Associate, and Analyst to tackle pricing management challenges. Job Description : For hands on client consulting and analysis to deliver sustainable growth to companies through implementation and management of pricing and profit strategies. Engages with internal and client teams to identify and define the analytical and business needs required to support our clients. Use analytical and problem-solving skills to build models, manipulate data, and identify trends for business opportunities for our clients. Characteristics: Exhibits a pro-active problem-solving approach and attitude. Able to identify options & makes recommendations. Demonstrates an ability to be inventive in seeking solutions. Analysis of data and facts to present a compelling argument. Responsibilities : Project Execution: Prioritizes & delivers all assigned project tasks per project timeline on-time with quality results; performs tasks with a sense of urgency. Follows standard processes, templates & tools for building client materials. Identifies & communicates status, risks & issues impacting the quality or timeliness of work. Pricing Analytics: Configure model with limited mentorship from project lead. Demonstrates interest and/or competence in tools needed to deliver project analysis (Excel, Power Pivot, and other analytical tools and software, etc.). Provides analysis as directed from team leads. Completes ad hoc data queries & analysis in Excel or other tools. Demonstrates superb attention to detail. Client Engagement: High level of exposure to C-suite leadership. Responsible for routine reporting including communication deck to clients. Presents analysis during internal client working sessions & with client. Ability to absorb constructive feedback to improve client deliverables. Demonstrates use of listening & questioning techniques to understand issues & problems. Team Engagement: Collaborative thought partner with internal and external teams. Participate in all company growth initiatives. Be a role model of our culture and core values, both internally and externally. Active contributor to individual and team deliverables. Proactively manages quality of own work. Qualifications : Education: bachelor’s degree Experience: Studies in general business, finance, marketing, or management. Economics, mathematics, data and analytics, statistics, and actuarial science experience. Demonstrated ability in project management. Skills/Abilities: Proficient in computer applications including Excel, PowerPoint, etc. Upbeat, driven, and action-oriented professional. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills, including a strong sense of personal accountability. High degree of ambition to perform in a dynamic environment. Travel: 6-8 days per month target. You’ll enjoy far-reaching rewards at INSIGHT. Competitive compensation and benefits, a Long-Term Incentive Plan that creates shared financial benefits from company growth, and an attractive bonus system, are just the beginning at an organization that ranks as an Inc. Best Workplaces 2023, and among the Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private U.S. companies. INSIGHT offers an appealing environment for self-directed individuals who embrace opportunity in all areas of work and life. If you are seeking the excitement of an entrepreneurial organization with a track record of accomplishment and phenomenal growth, take a closer look at INSIGHT. Career breakthroughs like this don’t come along every day. Apply and tell us how you’ll help us shape the direction of a booming industry. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice. INSIGHT2PROFIT is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws. INSIGHT2PROFIT is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas. This includes individuals with OPT or STEM OPT.
summary: INSIGHT2PROFIT, a leading pricing and profitability consulting and technology firm, is seeking a Consultant to join their team. This role will involve hands-on client consulting and analysis, using analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and define business needs, build models, and manipulate data. The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree, experience in business, finance, marketing, or management, and strong analytical and interpersonal skills.
benefits: Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private U.S. companies

title: Business Analyst
description: Berkley Select IT supports 4 WRBC Companies when it comes to IT support. The team supports multiple companies within the Berkley organization and provides the expertise when it comes to the common IT platforms that all of the companies share. The BA role is responsible for collaborating with the business units establishing business requirements that enable the technical team to configure applications solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer. The Business Analyst is responsible for performing the analysis required to support the development, maintenance and enhancement of applications used by the company and its business partners.  Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Document requirements, tests system functionality, defines scope and objectives, and formulates systems to support key business processes.  Act as a liaison between IT and other business departments.  Key functions include but are not limited to: Review and analyze project requests to determine impact to existing systems.  Translate business requirements into detailed specifications for use by the IT development staff/external providers. Analyze and document current workflows, identify opportunities to meet project objectives, business processes, and make recommendations for future approaches. Utilize user definitions, use cases and workflow diagrams to illustrate business problems. Identify issues and escalate them as appropriate. Lead meetings, e.g., business requirements review, testing strategy review, etc. Actively participate in formal presentations to a variety of management levels. Perform system/user testing as required; analyze and validate testing results. Provide support and guidance to other IT personnel in business requirements documentation as well as system/user testing. Act as a reference and provide support to application users with respect to questions arising from application/functionality adoption and use. Perform rules authoring as required to support business requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Management Information Systems or related field, or equivalent work experience. Minimum of two years of prior Business Analyst or Information Technology experience Experience should include process reengineering, flow charting and block diagramming, as well as, a good understanding of the desktop environment, user interface design and web architecture. Strong skills needed in verbal and written communication, including communicating effectively with business users and software developers Excellent organizational and planning skills Ability to lead and facilitate diverse groups of people to move towards solutions Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Familiarity or experience with Agile/Scrum Framework is a plus. Familiarity with business rules management system is a plus. Experience in Insurance industry is preferred but not required.
summary: Berkley Select IT is seeking a Business Analyst to support the development, maintenance, and enhancement of applications. The role involves collaborating with business units to understand their needs, translate those into technical specifications, and ensure successful implementation. Key responsibilities include analyzing business requirements, documenting workflows, identifying issues, leading meetings, and testing systems. Experience with process reengineering, flow charting, and web architecture is essential. Strong communication and problem-solving skills are also required.

title: Sr Staff Business Analyst
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Work Schedule Other Environmental Conditions Office Job Description Business Analyst - Generative AI, BID Job Responsibilities Conduct thorough needs assessment to identify business requirements and opportunities for Gen AI applications Collaborate with stakeholders to develop a strategic plan for Gen AI adoption that aligns with the corporate goals and objectives. Identify potential Gen AI use cases across BID that can drive value, improve efficiency, or solve complex business problems. Help prioritize use cases based on potential impact, feasibility, and alignment with strategic objectives. Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and CoE/development team, ensuring clear communication and alignment on project objectives, timelines, and deliverables. Use project management skills to track progress, manage risks, and ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Perform data analysis to support business decisions related to Gen AI projects and monitor the performance of implemented solutions. Lead change management efforts to ensure smooth adoption of Gen AI technologies, including stakeholder communication, training, and support. Skills/Experience Solid grasp of Generative AI technologies, trends, and applications, including natural language processing and data synthesis. Ability to translate technical AI concepts into business advantages. Proficient in developing strategies for AI adoption that align with corporate goals, identifying high-impact use cases, and setting clear metrics for success. Skilled in analyzing complex data sets to uncover insights and opportunities for improvement. Experience in modeling business processes and outcomes with AI. Strong project management skills, capable of leading cross-functional teams through the lifecycle of AI projects, from concept to implementation. Expertise in managing organizational change associated with AI adoption, including stakeholder communication, training, and support. Exceptional ability to work with IT, data science teams, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment and buy-in. Clear and persuasive communicator.
summary: This role involves conducting needs assessments, developing strategic plans for Generative AI adoption, identifying use cases, prioritizing them based on potential impact and feasibility, acting as a liaison between stakeholders and development teams, performing data analysis, leading change management efforts, and ensuring smooth adoption of Gen AI technologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong grasp of Generative AI technologies, trends, and applications, experience in developing strategies for AI adoption, and expertise in managing organizational change associated with AI adoption.

title: Business Analyst - EDI
description: fairlife, LLC is a Chicago-based nutrition company that creates great-tasting, nutrition-rich and dairy products to nourish consumers. With nearly $2B in annual retail sales, fairlife's portfolio of delicious, lactose-free, real dairy products includes: fairlife® ultra-filtered milk ; Core Power® High Protein Shakes, a sports nutrition drink to support post-workout recovery; fairlife® nutrition plan™ , a nutrition shake to support the journey to better health. A wholly owned subsidiary of The Coca-Cola company, fairlife, LLC has been recognized by both Fast Company and Nielsen for its industry leading innovation. To learn more about fairlife and its complete line of products, please visit fairlife.com. job purpose : The fairlife team is looking for a technically talented Systems Analyst (reporting to Senior Manager, Enterprise applications) who will work primarily with our EDI partners, ERP partners and internal business partners. Major activities include designing, developing, maintaining, and monitoring application integrations across our EDI platform and ERP. Other major activities will include ERP break fix support and ERP user role security maintenance. This role will work with cross functional teams and stakeholders, including Automation, Operations, IT infrastructure, and ERP to build robust process and systems integration capabilities that drive a world class manufacturing and supply chain organization. responsibilities: Define, document, and develop enterprise level architecture and standards for integrations connecting ERP, PowerBI and other 3rd party applications into a cohesive and robust business and manufacturing process management platform utilizing EDI, FTP, etc. Ensure compliance with EDI standards, protocols, and data security requirements, such as ANSI X12, EDIFACT, AS2, and secure file transfer protocols. Work with internal stakeholders and external service providers to build, enhance, maintain, troubleshoot, and support key system integrations between EDI, ERP, 3PL, etc. Ensure the reliability, integrity, and performance of EDI integrations and interfaces meet process and technical requirements including implementing automated controls, tools, and monitoring capabilities. Provide technical leadership for key EDI integrations and systems projects with cross functional teams and external resources. Analyze, design, develop, test, and deploy custom integrations in a Microsoft .NET environment. Manage day-to-day operational IT service management and support activities for EDI Integrations, along with other assigned applications. Ensure design and implementations are consistent with standards for security, reliability, compliance, and business risks. Design, develop, and document failovers and business continuity/recovery plans Learn and understand multiple facets of the business processes and related transactions in the ERP to support end users during break/fix troubleshooting and new process design/testing. Manage ERP user access by enabling/disabling end users and assigning user roles in the ERP. Create custom user roles in the ERP as approved/needed. Aid in ERP/EDI audits when applicable. skills/qualifications required: BS in Computer Science, information systems or equivalent education and experience Minimum of 2 years of experience in EDI analysis, implementation, and support specifically around order to cash and 3PL warehousing transactions. Strong understanding of EDI standards, protocols, and transaction sets (e.g., ANSI X12, EDIFACT, AS2). Knowledge of data integration concepts, including data mapping, transformation, and validation. Demonstrated ability to understand, analyze, execute and document complex technical designs, translate business needs and functional requirements into technical solutions. Experience with project leadership responsibilities, including implementation methodology and change control processes and documentation. Familiar with ERP systems and their integration with EDI (Microsoft Dynamics F&O preferred) Basic knowledge of ERP role based security Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and data integrity. CPG, Beverage industry experience a plus working conditions and physical requirements: Standard office hours and shared on-call duties for off hours Ability to lift up to 25 lbs. food safety requirements: Notify supervision of any repairs or adjustments that are required that may affect product quality or food safety. Understand, observe, and comply with the handling and usage of the color-coded container policy while in the Production Areas. Perform all duties necessary to meet Company, Customer and/or Government requirements/standards as prioritized by the Company. Ability to initiate action to prevent the occurrence of nonconformities relating to Food Safety and the Quality of the product, processes, quality system, or safety system. Identify and record any problems relating to Food Safety and the Quality of the ingredients, processes, quality system, or safety system. Control further processing or delivery of nonconforming product in terms of Food Safety and Quality issues until the deficiency or unsatisfactory condition has been corrected. In the event of absence, another employee with the same skill level will assume the duties and responsibilities as required. position location: fairlife Locations: Chicago, IL, Coopersville, MI, Goodyear, AZ reports to : St Manager of Enterprise applications travel requirements: 10% exempt/nonexempt: exempt fairlife, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. All qualified applicants and employees will be given equal opportunity. Selection decisions are based on job-related factors. In addition to its nondiscrimination commitment, the Company will also provide reasonable accommodation of qualified individuals with known disabilities unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on the Company. If you have a disability and would like to request accommodation in order to apply for a position with us, please email careers@fairlife.com .
summary: fairlife, LLC, a subsidiary of Coca-Cola, seeks a Systems Analyst to design, develop, and maintain application integrations within its EDI platform and ERP system. This role involves working with internal and external teams to ensure robust systems integration across manufacturing and supply chain operations.

title: Senior JD Edwards Business Analyst
description: Senior JD Edwards Business Analyst Our client, a global leader with a century of excellence in precision industrial equipment manufacturing, is seeking a talented Senior JD Edwards Business Analyst The ideal candidate will optimize critical business applications, specializing in distribution with some manufacturing knowledge. This role includes supporting ongoing JD Edwards implementations and improving the demand forecast process Key Responsibilities: Optimize and support critical business applications, focusing on distribution with some manufacturing knowledge Manage and improve the existing demand forecast process Provide support for ongoing JD Edwards implementations Gather data and analyze requirements with business managers and end users Support JDE Sales, Inventory, Purchasing, and Advanced Pricing modules Identify and document critical business processes and ensure knowledge transfer Troubleshoot software issues and implement functional or technical solutions Provide daily support to enterprise-level plants Benefits: Competitive Salary + Bonus Program Comprehensive Benefits Package 401K Matching Program Tuition Reimbursement Work Stability and Life Balance Long-tenured employees Qualifications: 10+ years of JD Edwards Business Analyst experience in an EnterpriseOne 9.2 environment Expertise in Distribution, Sales, and Advanced Pricing Modules Strong implementation skills Excellent communication skills Bachelor’s Degree (Computer Science preferred) Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship Preferred Skills: Experience with Demand Scheduling Execution (DSE) and Transportation Management System (TMS) Manufacturing experience (Shop Floor, MRP, etc.) Proficiency in Procurement, Planning, Accounting, and Inventory Modules Familiarity with RF Smart or other RF Scanning solutions APICS, PMI, or JD Edwards certification or equivalent experience Join a company with a proud history and a bright future. Apply now to make an immediate impact and advance your career! Interviews will be set up immediately!!!
summary: Senior JD Edwards Business Analyst specializing in distribution and manufacturing. Responsibilities include optimizing and supporting critical business applications, managing and improving the demand forecast process, gathering data and analyzing requirements, and troubleshooting software issues. Requires 10+ years of JD Edwards experience in an EnterpriseOne 9.2 environment with expertise in Distribution, Sales, and Advanced Pricing Modules.

title: Business Process Analyst
description: Job Description Salary Range: $50,824- $84,425 Position Summary Main responsibilities are to support the business objectives of the Business Process Management & Compliance Group in improving the IFF's business processes by assisting branch operations with on-boarding new business, developing & providing line-level training, developing & providing SOPs, guiding & auditing security and quality programs; along with ensuring compliance to all government regulations involved in our services. Responsibilities Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develop & provide operational SOPs for the Branch line services Identify training requirements for the Branch line operations. Develop & provide training for the Branch line services. Coordinate with HR/Legal to track & report training records. Assist the Branches with on-boarding new customers through taking the lead as Program Management to ensure all customer requirements are identified, communicated, & met timely by all internal parties involved. Accept main contact for the customer to address any service or reporting requests. Be the main interface for the customer for service & IT requests. Provide needed reports to Management, Branch operations, & customers. Assist in Branch operational compliance audits, including ensuring daily Branch operations are adhering to all compliance & accounting controls established. Provide direct access to Branch operations & customers for compliance issues & questions. Assist Branch operations to implement & continuing to meet security programs, including C-TPAT, TSA, & TAPA. YUNAS Organization data input for accounting (Auto-rating), transportation, & reporting requirements. Manage the Corrective Action Program and coordinate follow up when required. Assist in establishing and managing a Training Program. ITAR / License Monitoring and support when needed to address any issues. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Education And Experience 5 years' experience as a supervisor or manager in a broker or forwarder operation. Customs Brokerage License Must be willing to travel and visit both customer and branch operations Some sales experience or customer service skills are required Ability to support sales efforts of sales professionals in forwarding and GDP closing of business. Understand all phases of warehouse and distribution activity including periodic audit Proficiency with internal YUNAS & Microsoft Office software or computer systems Essential Job Functions Maintain regular and punctual attendance. Work overtime as required/ assigned. Travel overnight as required. Work cooperatively with others. Interact with employees and customers in an appropriate manner. Use a computer for tasks such as communicating via email and preparing reports and work schedule using Microsoft Office Review and analyze data and information concerning IFF Operations Plan, prioritize and monitor Training, Quality, & Security Complete [or oversee the completion of ] assigned tasks/projects in a timely manner. Comply with all Company policies and procedures The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Benefits Yusen offers a generous Employee Benefits Package including: Medical, Dental, and Vision beginning the 1 st of the month following start date 401k with a company match Flexible Spending Accounts, Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability, Tuition Assistance Program, Commuter Benefits, vacation , and much more. Any and all benefits offered are subject to the eligibility requirements, terms, and provisions set forth in the respective policies and plan documents, which you may request from Human Resources. About Yusen Logistics (Americas ) Yusen Logistics is working to become the world's preferred supply chain logistics company. Our complete offer is designed to forge better connections between businesses, customers and communities - through innovative supply chain management, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution services. As a company we're dedicated to a culture of continuous improvement, ensuring everyone who works with us is committed, connected and creative in making us the world's preferred choice. www.yusen-logistics.com/ Yusen Logistics (Americas) Inc. values each individual employee and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, disability, sexual and gender orientation, genetic information, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws.

title: Business Analyst, Knowledge Management
description: Summary: The Business Analyst performs analysis activities that support the decision making regarding matching technology solutions (package selection, configuration, development) with business, user, and functional needs from stakeholders. This involves conducting market research, functional comparisons, and staying abreast of what is being done at other professional services firms. The BA partners with the appropriate business stakeholders and the Program Manager to prioritize and create a project roadmap for their assigned area, in this case Knowledge Management, Information Management, and Research. With the business and IT teams, they maintain a set of institutional knowledge of what is working well within the program and what needs improvement. Duties and Responsibilities: Partner with business stakeholders to understand and prioritize their needs, creating a roadmap of projects for their assigned area. Gathering requirements, documenting business requirements and translating business requirements into technical requirements Seek input of user experience and business analysts to determine potential improvements to their assigned products. Stay abreast of best practices being done at other companies, and technology developments that may impact the area. Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders and the Program Manager to influence the technology decisions for the area based on this knowledge. Analyze and consolidate all perspectives on the project - business needs, user experience, security, training, risk, time, cost, technology architecture, procurement/vendor management, operational considerations, etc. - to help the company reach the best technology decisions. Drives projects and business teams toward achieving intended business results within a specified time and budget Performs risk analysis, identifies and resolves critical path issues Preparation and analysis of program/project related data Review and reporting of program/project status Preparation of materials for briefings and presentations to large size groups of key decision makers at the executive level REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field A minimum of 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Program Analyst, Project Coordinator or related role PREFERRED Experience in the areas of Knowledge Management, Information Management and/or Research
summary: The Business Analyst analyzes business needs and identifies technology solutions to meet those needs. They work with stakeholders to prioritize projects, gather requirements, and stay up-to-date on industry best practices and technological developments. They also analyze various project aspects, including user experience, security, and cost, to guide the company towards optimal technology decisions.

title: ServiceNow Business Analyst
description: ServiceNow Business Analyst @ Chicago, IL Required Skills At least 3 to 5 years in a ServiceNow business analyst role with deep knowledge of ITSM processes, including Request Management, Change Management, Configuration Management (CMDB), Incident Management and Problem Management. { heavy emphasis on CMDB deep expertise, Configuration Management and how data is set up in the CMDB] Capable of building strong professional relationships with ability to influence all levels across the organization. Demonstrated experience designing solutions to meet organizational goals, improve efficiency and reduce risk based on business analysis intelligence
summary: ServiceNow Business Analyst role requiring 3-5 years of experience with deep knowledge of ITSM processes, particularly CMDB. The position emphasizes strong communication and relationship building skills, as well as the ability to design solutions for efficiency and risk reduction.

Key Components Develop nutrition and regulatory technical information for ingredients and products Review/approve label graphics for regulatory compliance and technical accuracy Review advertising and promotional materials for technical accuracy and compliance Provide nutrition and regulatory guidance on project teams to enable accurate decision-making Stay abreast of nutrition and regulatory developments and identify opportunities and implications to the business. Minimum / Preferred Qualifications B.S. in Nutrition, Food Science or related scientific field preferred Minimum 2 years of experience in Regulatory, Nutrition, R&D or Quality with a global/US food manufacturer; or applied nutrition/dietetics; or experience in the food service industry/culinary. Requires 2+ years experience in food labeling, strong technical skills, and proficiency in ESHA Genesis. Must be local to Glenview, IL.

title: Business Analyst
description: We are seeking an experienced, bilingual (in English and Spanish) Business Analyst to support our Management in our Melrose Park, IL office. This role is centered around Finance, Administration, Legal, and Audit functions at our Corporate office in Melrose Park, IL. ***Entry level candidates without previous related experience will not be considered*** Responsibilities Review financial performance data, including cash flow, cost controls, expenses, and financial statements continuously to ensure goals are achieved and to determine areas that require improvement. Interact with business leaders to provide consultative support to planning initiatives through financial and management information analyses, reports, and recommendations. Create, coordinate, and evaluate the financial programs and supporting information systems of the company to include budgeting, tax planning, real estate, and conservation of assets. Audit all purchases for plants and DC’s including raw materials, finished goods, spare parts, and maintenance materials. Apply continuous improvement methods to enhance quality, reliability, or cost-effectiveness. Contribute to the decision-making related to all CAPEX projects ensuring on time delivery, correct specifications, and budget compliance. Provide cross-functional support in all stages of sales. Review sales contracts, confer with internal legal and sales personnel, meet with customers during contract negotiation. Work closely with Parent Company's internal audit department to define controls and processes, determine areas of risk, and develop processes and procedures to mitigate risk and ensure legal and regulatory compliance while maintaining high business function. Other duties as required or assigned. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business or Engineering. Master's Degree is valued. Bilingual in English/Spanish is required without exception. At least 2 years of previous related experience. Familiarity with SAP is valued. Ability and desire to work on-site, in-office at our Melrose Park, IL corporate office. Ability and willingness to travel domestically and internationally in furtherance of responsibilities, with or without notice.
summary: We are seeking an experienced, bilingual (English/Spanish) Business Analyst to support Finance, Administration, Legal, and Audit functions at our Corporate office in Melrose Park, IL. This role involves reviewing financial data, creating financial programs, auditing purchases, supporting sales, and working with internal audit to mitigate risk and ensure compliance. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business or Engineering (Master's preferred), at least 2 years of related experience, fluency in English and Spanish, familiarity with SAP, and willingness to travel.

title: Strategy and Venture Analyst
description: TechNexus Venture Collaborative (TechNexus) helps leading corporations and ambitious entrepreneurs work together to create new business models, revenue streams, products, and markets. A first-of-its-kind Venture Collaborative, TechNexus combines capital investment, incubation, and collaboration to provide an unfair advantage. Since 2007, TechNexus has accelerated business opportunities between dozens of leading corporations and more than 600 startups, and is among the most active venture investors in the US. For more information, please visit www.technexus.com. We are currently looking for a Strategy and Venture Analyst who will be responsible for market research, sourcing, and evaluating venture opportunities, as well as continued relationships with all. This is a unique role in which Analysts will have an opportunity to work directly with Fortune 500 Executives, as well as CEO's of early-stage companies. Responsibilities: Developing market research on the potential products and services of incumbent corporations, analyzing markets, business models and collaboration potential of ventures Supporting strategy projects in support of investment theses including defining project objectives, developing and delivering work plans, structuring analyses, and executing project deliverables. Evaluating ventures for potential investment through research and due diligence with executive teams. Creating deal memos and reports, through keen synthesis of information on a multitude of ventures. Analyzing and articulating alignment and role of ventures in corporate partners’ broader growth plans. Defining and comparing the business models of key competitors’ research and evaluating emerging technology innovation Executing the investment process including creation of financial and valuation models to evaluate the impact of ventures on enterprise strategies; reviewing legal documents and term sheets. Serve actively on partner-facing teams involving frequent interaction with enterprise partners, and ventures, to gather and interpret data through presentations and executive briefs. Networking with current TechNexus partners and ventures creating new relationships and potential deal sources Requirements: Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Technology and Entrepreneurship, Economics or related field required. 1-3 years of consulting, corporate strategy, investment banking, startup or similar experience. Demonstrated track record of successfully supporting large, complex consulting or advisory executive projects. High level of awareness and understanding of TNVC’s mission to assist both entrepreneurs and enterprises, and understanding of core emerging technologies (e.g. AI/ML, IoT, AR/VR, Data and Analytics) Proficiency in strategic analysis, and strong experience in project management, problem solving, and individual initiative Experience communicating (written & oral) and interfacing with senior level clients and executives proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and PowerPoint. Also, ability to communicate effectively with both engineers and business stakeholders (startup and corporate) Proven track record of performing beyond expectations, and comfortable working in an ambiguous environment Please note: The salary range for this position is between $80,000 - $100,000.
summary: TechNexus Venture Collaborative is looking for a Strategy and Venture Analyst to conduct market research, source and evaluate venture opportunities, and manage relationships with corporations and startups. The Analyst will work directly with Fortune 500 Executives and early-stage company CEOs, supporting investment decisions, analyzing market trends, and developing strategic partnerships.

title: Senior Product Strategy Analyst
description: Job Description Job title: Senior Product Strategy Analyst - Consumer Lending LOCATION: Chester HOURS: Full time WORKING PATTERN: Hybrid, 40% (or two days) in an office site About This Opportunity Are you use to working with fast paced data frameworks? If so, we have a great opportunity for you to put your skills and experience into practice within our Consumer Lending business! As part of the Cards New Acquisition Team, you'll utilise data to optimise our product and pricing strategy. At the heart of our strategy is Customer Relationship Growth, which seeks to truly transform our interactions eco system into a world class capability, and connect personalised decision making across the Group including pricing, customer services, credit risk, fraud, etc. Supporting the delivery of the New Acquisition account plan and strategic deliverables, your remit will include: Leverage new data assets & tooling to optimise P&L performance of product and pricing strategy Support Cards migration to GCP through early adoption via data exploration Providing Product Managers with data driven insight, to feed into product and channel strategies Delivering compelling stories to senior stakeholders based on evidential data from multiple data sources Engaging with key internal customers every day, presenting and explaining difficult concepts / analysis and ensuring your communications are delivered simply, clearly and tailored to the audience Monitoring product performance against targets and proactively working with Product Managers to ensure delivery meets plans Ensuring product performance reporting is accurate, timely, robust and in alignment with best practice standards Making recommendations for the development and ongoing refinement of existing product strategies, based on analysis and insight generated. About Us We’re on an exciting journey and there couldn’t be a better time to join us. The investments we’re making in our people, data, and technology are leading to innovative projects, fresh possibilities, and countless new ways for our people to work, learn, and thrive. What You’ll Need Strong background of delivering actionable insight in an analytics focused environment (e.g. Risk, Marketing, Finance) Experience of working with disparate and complex data sources Adept at interpreting analytical results and presenting insights at all levels Experience of using advanced analytical tools (segmentation, modelling and optimisation) within strategies to drive improved performance Practical experience with data visualization tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe, Power BI, Tableau Demonstrable ability in Python and SQL or other coding languages such as SAS, etc. Knowledge of GitHub for version control And any experience of these would be really useful A commercial understanding of interpreting product financials and Profit & Loss data An understanding of Consumer Lending products, strategy development and channel optimisation A broad understanding of the regulations and legal framework impacting the credit card industry. We’ll also be looking for you to demonstrate your analytical curiosity and storytelling capabilities. You're able to turn sophisticated requests into insight and translate that insight into commercial and actionable recommendations. This role relies on building strong cross-functional relationships at all levels, so the ability to form collaborative partnerships and possessing excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills is also key. A fast learner who relishes self-development, you'll also enjoy the opportunities that access to new and developing data sources brings! About Working For Us Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms. We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture. We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative. And it’s why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups. We’re disability confident. So if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know. We Also Offer a Wide-ranging Benefits Package, Which Includes A generous pension contribution of up to 15% An annual bonus award, subject to Group performance Share schemes including free shares Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping 30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies If you’re excited by the thought of becoming part of our team, get in touch. We’d love to hear from you!
summary: Senior Product Strategy Analyst role in Consumer Lending at a financial institution in Chester.  The role focuses on leveraging data to optimize product and pricing strategy within the Cards New Acquisition team, supporting the transition to GCP and delivering data-driven insights to product managers. Strong analytical skills, experience with data visualization tools, proficiency in Python and SQL, and a commercial understanding of product financials are required.

title: Business Analyst, Flexible Living and Revenue Strategy
description: Job Description Working for Equity Residential (EQR), a leading multi-family real estate investment trust (REIT) headquartered in downtown Chicago, means being part of a community and striving to provide the best in apartment living, speaking boldly about new ideas for innovation, and inspiring creativity in the ways we work together. Our portfolio of high-quality properties in urban growth markets – New York City, Boston, Washington DC, Seattle, San Francisco and Los Angeles – provides homes where people most want to live, work and play. We've got the best people in the business, and our experience shows in our dedication to our residents and in how much we value each other as colleagues. That’s why our employees say they are proud to work at Equity, a company that gives our residents a place where they can “Live Remarkably,” and offers a culture where our employees have the opportunity to make their mark. As an Analyst on the Flexible Living Solutions team, you will join a team that is reshaping the way people live and thrive in our communities. You will support programs and initiatives that offer flexible, dynamic, and exciting alternatives to the traditional 12 month lease and also generate new revenue streams for the organization. We're on a mission to redefine modern living, and we're looking for an entry level analyst position to join our team. Who You Are Knowledgeable, Analytical, and Intellectually Curious. You are comfortable analyzing data sets, spotting trends and synthesizing relevant observations. You like thinking outside the box to come up with innovative points of view. Organized and Confident. You are flexible, composed, and able to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously. You handle pressure well and do so with confidence. Solution and Results-Oriented. You demonstrate a sense of urgency to drive great results, while being precise in executing your work. Strong Communicator. Your writing and speaking skills are clear, articulate, and effective, demonstrating your ability to interact with all levels and various teams within the organization. A Trusted Team Player. You enjoy partnering with others and building constructive working relationships. You are accountable to your teammates and follow through on commitments. Passionate. Motivated. Eager to Learn. You are resourceful, ask smart questions, challenge the status quo, and regularly seek to understand. You invest extra energy to reach your goals. And when a special project arises, you volunteer! What You’ll Do Support common area rental initiatives. Identify, build, and maintain rental space listings posted on third party rental platforms. Track and optimize listing performance. Provide on-site team support and guidance. Produce and present program reporting and updates. Support short-term rental initiatives. Draft and deploy internal and resident program communications. Track and report program metrics, revenue, and expense. Respond to internal and resident inquiries. Audit program activities for internal and local regulation compliance. Develop and maintain databases and trackers of vendor and property data, open issues, program changes, project implementations, etc. Perform data collection and analysis on program results to help make decisions, address problems and issues, and identify opportunities for initiatives improvement. Create engaging presentations and related communications to highlight program results to key internal and external stakeholders. Manage vendor relationships and day-to-day program functions ensuring desired flexible living initiative outcomes and goals are met. Serve as the go-to liaison totriage and resolve large-scale or complex requests, questions, issues, etc. Suggest process improvements that result in better visibility and more effective management of resources and/or reduced costs and directly implement those recommendations. Support special projects and ad hoc requests, as needed. Previous Experience & Requirements Bachelor's Degree with an emphasis in business, operations, or real estate and previous professional experience in property management or other corporate roles preferred. Interest and knowledge of real estate, hospitality, and/or travel industries. Demonstrate a high degree of flexibility, intuitiveness, conceptual thought processes, and exemplary organizational skills to support simultaneous project management. Analytical skills are necessary, with proficiency in Excel and Google Suite, and project management applications. Demonstrated ability to quickly master additional skills relevant to the role. Comfortable utilizing and learning new technologies and software programs. Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization and translate numerical/technical data into clear written, verbal, and presentation communications. Must be able and willing to work in the Chicago corporate office at least 3 days a week (12 days per month) and attend company and industry events. Available for potential project or conference related travel (less than 5% a year). About Us Working for Equity Residential (EQR), a leading multi-family real estate investment trust (REIT), means living our purpose: creating communities where people thrive. It means striving to provide the best in apartment living, speaking boldly about new ideas for innovation, and inspiring creativity in the ways we work together. Our portfolio of high-quality properties in urban growth markets – New York City, Boston, Washington DC, Seattle, San Francisco, Southern California, and Denver – provides homes where people most want to live, work and play. We've got the best people in the business, as evidenced by our employee engagement scores and customer loyalty ratings. That’s why our employees say they are proud to work at Equity, a company that gives our residents a place where they can Live Remarkably, and offers a culture where our employees have the opportunity to thrive. Equity Rewards When you join Equity Residential, you won’t be treated as simply another employee — you will be considered a partner in our shared success. As such, we are committed to investing in your personal success through a benefits program that supports your Total Wellbeing. We recognize that everyone has different needs outside of work. That’s why, in addition to a competitive benefits package (medical, dental, vision and paid time off), we offer many unique benefits options to employees, like a comprehensive wellness program, pet insurance, new parent benefits, and paid time off for community service projects. In addition to your next job, you can also find your next home with us! Rent discounts on Equity Residential apartment homes are available to our benefits-eligible employees. The amount of the discount offered is determined based on the market, ranging upwards from 20%. Learn more about our Total Wellbeing program here. Equity Values At Equity Residential, like our residents, our employees come from everywhere. A richly diverse work environment captures top talent, cultivates the best ideas, and creates the widest possible platform for success. By focusing on inclusion, these differences are harnessed to create value — in ideas, business practices, relationships, and employee engagement. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to maintaining a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment where our employees can thrive. All aspects of the employment process are merit-based. Every Equity employee is expected to maintain a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Equity Residential does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, sexual/gender identity/expression, age, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation or related medical conditions), physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship status, military (including uniformed service member or protected veteran) status, marital status, genetic characteristic or information, ancestry or any other characteristic protected by law. Equity Residential also prohibits retaliation against individuals who report harassment or discrimination, or participate in investigations into such conduct.
summary: Equity Residential is seeking an Analyst for their Flexible Living Solutions team. This role will support programs and initiatives that offer flexible living alternatives, such as common area rentals and short-term rentals. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree, previous experience in property management or corporate roles, strong analytical skills, and proficiency in Excel, Google Suite, and project management applications.
benefits: Paid Time Off for Community Service

title: Sr. Business Analyst - Risk & Analytics
description: NinjaHoldings was founded in 2017 by a team seeking to revolutionize the way everyday Americans interact with financial services. Through our CreditNinja and NinjaCard brands, we empower people overlooked by traditional financial institutions to take control of their finances via a full suite of digital banking and lending products, providing incentives and rewards along the way as we guide them on a path to financial improvement. Through our Edge brand, we help companies better understand their customers by offering a package of bespoke underwriting, fraud detection, and analytics services. With offices in Chicago, Miami, and around the world through the power of remote work, we are a lean and innovative team always seeking like-minded talent to join us in our fight to disrupt consumer finance. Job Summary NinjaHoldings is seeking an experienced business analyst to join our Risk & Analytics team. This is a critical position that will be responsible for designing, creating, and managing decisions in our rules engine platform. The candidate will manage the implementation of business rules throughout our application funnel to ensure we are always making optimal decisions. Key Responsibilities Design, implement, and thoroughly test new decisions in the customer acquisition and underwriting rules engine, collaborating with Analytics and Engineering to ensure a seamless integration Maintain the rules engine; developing and testing changes to the rules when necessary to optimize originations and loan performance; and ensuring the decisions are working as intended Monitor key funnel metrics, reports, and dashboards to evaluate the performance of our products and understand the root causes of changes Establish funnel performance metrics and develop automated reporting and alerting using SQL and Python Conduct analysis using advanced data analytics to evaluate trends in funnel performance and fraud metrics and provide strategy recommendations to optimize performance based on company objectives Support underwriting by having an understanding of the rules for different customer segments and products Communicate concise and actionable business strategies to senior management Requirements Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business discipline (e.g., math, statistics, finance, economics, engineering, or other quantitative fields) 3+ years of experience working with business stakeholders and technical teams to design and implement solutions 2+ years of experience working with python and SQL for reporting and data analysis in a professional setting SQL proficiency and experience working with relational databases, query authoring, as well as familiarity with a variety of databases Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills with key attention to detail Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment Ability to work effectively while managing multiple projects with tight deadlines, understand the project requirements with minimal guidance, and follow through to completion Additional Pluses, But Not Requirements Experience working with specialty finance or FinTech Experience with low code rules engine platforms Benefits Competitive salary and benefits package Flexible, remote work Fun, fast-paced work environment Dynamic start-up culture Ability to make an immediate impact in a growth stage company Convenient downtown Chicago office located in the heart of the city Equal opportunity employer Important Notice Please carefully review communications to ensure that they are from the official Breezy applicant tracking platform (@ breezy-mail.com ) or an official NinjaHoldings brand email: @ ninjaholdings.com , @ creditninja.com , @ ninjacard.com , or @ edgescore.com. If you have been contacted regarding a job opening at NinjaHoldings from any other email address, including similar email variations, this is NOT a trusted source. We recommend that you refrain from responding to suspicious emails and file a complaint with the FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3) at https://www.ic3.gov . For questions or to confirm the authenticity of a communication, please email hr @ninjaholdings.com .

The ideal candidate will have experience with Python, SQL, and data analysis, as well as a strong understanding of financial modeling and business strategies.
