title: Digital Office - Senior Business Analyst
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton. Job Overview The individual in this position will have experience gathering and documenting product requirements, working in a variety of systems environments and have at least a general understanding of the technology considerations. They will be comfortable leading workshops, working meetings and presentations, communicate in an empathetic, positive and friendly manner with a focus on clarifying business needs and customer service. In addition, they will be comfortable working with contractors, vendors and multiple processes and methodologies to manage requirements for all stakeholders. Key Job Responsibilities Business Process Design: Contributes to the analysis of business processes to identify and clarify requirements Contributes to improvements to business processes Is able to analyze and assess an organization's business model Requirements Documentation: Demonstrates an ability to express complex ideas clearly Facilitates analysis, classification and documentation of requirements Proposes an appropriate document-set for a project Publishes, distributes and facilitates sign-off of requirements documentation Manages changes to the requirements baseline Supports impact analysis on changes to requirement(s) through project lifecycle Eliciting Requirements: Gathers, clarifies and validates requirements Acts as interpreter who facilitates communication between clients and internal teams Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues with requirements Structured Analysis: Uses data and process modelling techniques to identify and clarify requirements Communicates with clients and internal teams to clarify and validate requirements Uses data and process modelling tools Testing: Demonstrates knowledge of testing strategies, plans and execution Participates actively in the development and execution of testing strategies and plans Designs user acceptance testing plans Monitors user acceptance testing and responses to problems IT Fluency: Understands IT and project management concepts with an emphasis on Agile methodology Uses desktop productivity applications at a superior level Is aware of the societal impact of information and information technology to support adoption and change management activities Qualifications/Requirements Degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field or a combination of education/training and work experience equivalent to an advanced degree. 5 - 10 years experience as a Business Analyst in software or interactive web development initiatives Strong analytical skills Strong organizational skills Applies creative thinking and problem solving to clarifying requirements related issues Demonstrated experience producing technology project artifacts including: Use Cases Requirements Documents Functional Specifications Test Plans and Test Cases Process Flows Demonstrated experience in technology solution management, including: Usability/GUI design Web application development methodologies Object-oriented development approaches Working knowledge of third-party solution providers Defining and documenting design to requirements trade-offs Broad knowledge of programs, projects and knowledge management processes and toolsets Knowledge of user-centered content development, interface design, information architecture, digital branding and marketing communications Demonstrated experience in communications management, including: Ability to communicate with a variety of audiences (internal and external teams) Consensus building, team building and problem solving Written and oral communications, including presentations to senior level executives Ability to work with cross-functional teams (creative and technical) throughout implementation to ensure integrity to requirements Organizing and facilitating meetings with business users for requirements gathering Preferred: IIBA certification Preferred: Microsoft DevOps/Github/JIRA experience . Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) would be preferred. Key Performance Behaviors Business analysis lead on complex software development project spread across multiple projects and vendors. Strong understanding of Komatsu’s key applications across our Mining, Construction, Forestry and Forklift product lines Expert level understanding of key applications and related product roadmaps to support alignment with stakeholders on current and future direction and to drive adoption with external business partners and customers. Expert level understanding of key functionality to drive reuse of core components and minimize proliferation of similar / one off applications, portals and websites across a common user base Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
summary: Komatsu seeks a Business Analyst with 5-10 years experience in software or web development, proficient in requirements gathering, documentation, analysis, and testing. The role involves leading workshops, facilitating meetings, and communicating effectively with diverse stakeholders, including clients and internal teams. Expertise in Agile methodology, user-centered design, and technology solution management is required. Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills are essential, along with experience in producing technology project artifacts, such as use cases, requirements documents, and test plans. Familiarity with Komatsu's key applications across mining, construction, forestry, and forklift product lines is preferred, along with experience with Microsoft DevOps, Github, and JIRA.

title: Senior Product Analyst, NetCredit (Hybrid)
description: We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas or take over sponsorship at this time. #BI-Hybrid Reports to: Lead Product Manager, NetCredit About the Role: As a Senior Product Analyst, you will directly support one of Enova’s core P&Ls and collaborate with different departments to gather data and make recommendations based on trends and analytics. You'll also work closely with stakeholders to help define features and tradeoffs in order to create a competitive advantage for Enova. As you develop business cases and implement solutions, you will make a direct impact on our business and hardworking customers. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain feature roadmap to keep Enova’s platform compliant, secure, resilient, and easy to use. Communicate key milestones, project updates, scope changes, and critical metrics to stakeholders and external partners on an ongoing basis. Uncover and understand customer needs and translate them into requirements. Assess and address technical risks. Understand and analyze data pipelines, algorithms, and automated systems. Use database queries to troubleshoot data quality and analyze performance indicators, evaluate experiments, etc. Define success criteria for testing and product acceptance. Requirements: At least 2 years of product analysis and reporting experience. Capable of driving a full lifecycle product feature or launch. Basic understanding of Agile principles. Knowledge of SQL and relational databases. Knowledge of financial and accounting concepts. Benefits & Perks: Hybrid roles entail working in-office from Tuesday to Thursday, with the choice to work remotely on Mondays and Fridays Health, dental, and vision insurance including mental health benefits 401(k) matching plus a roth option (U.S. Based employees only) PTO & paid holidays off Sabbatical program (for eligible roles) Summer hours (for eligible roles) Paid parental leave DEI groups (B.L.A.C.K. @ Enova, HOLA @ Enova, Women @ Enova, Pride @ Enova, South Asians @ Enova, APEX @ Enova, and Parents @ Enova) Employee recognition and rewards program Charitable matching and a paid volunteer day…Plus so much more! About Enova Enova International is a leading financial technology company that provides online financial services through our AI and machine learning-powered Colossus™platform. We serve non-prime consumers and businesses alike, while offering world-class technology and services to traditional banks—in order to create accessible credit for millions. Being a values-driven organization is at the core of Enova’s success. We live our values by listening to our customers, challenging assumptions, thinking big, setting high expectations, and hiring and developing the best. Through our values and our commitment to making Enova an awesome place to work, we maintain an environment of inclusion and culture where our employees can thrive. You can learn more about Enova’s values and culture here. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. California Applicants: Click here to review our California Privacy Policy for Job Applicants.

The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of product analysis experience, knowledge of Agile principles, SQL, relational databases, and financial concepts.

title: Business Analyst, Enterprise Dealer Group
description: Description: Do you want to work with world’s leading water experts whose articulated purpose is to change people’s lives through water transformation and improve the environment for all? One of Culligan’s fastest growing BUs in North America is looking for a dynamic finance leader who will help define and drive the BU strategy and turn strategy into reality in a collaborative, cross functional, roll up the sleeves, fast-paced work environment. This individual identifies problems using analytical skills, generating collaborative solutions, determining the best approach to execute, and implementing best-practice solutions. The role will work directly will Senior Leadership of the EDG Business gaining additional development and leadership skills. Responsibilities: Build in-depth financial models including, but not limited to Lifetime Value, ROI, revenue and EBITDA growth, sensitivity analysis using driver-based variable and fixed costs, and benchmark outcome modeling using key financial drivers. In-depth Revenue to EBITDA analysis by product line and service categories assessing various COGS, SG&A levers in a multi-branch environment with disparate data sources. Leverage scalable and flexible communications style and ability to communicate complex financial results to all levels of the organization. Build net working capital optimization and inventory models to improve business decision making Partner with FP&A functions across the Culligan Dealer Businesses to incorporate strategic initiatives into the Budget and Forecasting process. Drive/Support 3-year Strategic Planning process from Finance perspective. Ability to support/lead PMO-like activities as part of annual Strategy Deployment Process as a workstream leader or member. Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (B.S.) in Finance 5 to 10 years of Finance and Strategy experience Decision making skills along with strong oral, written and interpersonal skills Proven skill in converting detailed financial analysis into digestible presentations Experience working with data from ERP and Consolidations Systems Experience in a multi-branch and business unit environment preferred. Ability to adapt in a fast pace environment Competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies in this position: Resourcefulness Customer Focus Team Player Passion Integrity Organizational/Planning Communication Self-Awareness Energy
summary: Culligan is seeking a Finance Leader to help define and drive the company's business strategy. The individual will work closely with senior leadership to optimize business operations and drive growth.

title: Senior Program Manager-Business Analyst
description: Job Description The Sr. Program Manager--Business Analyst, is accountable for supporting in translating business needs and strategies into innovative solutions. Participate in strategic planning sessions conducted with key business stakeholders to design, capture, and baseline business requirements. This role will have an in-depth knowledge of the business and associated markets as well as IT/Digital/Security systems, tools, standards, and methods. Responsibilities Supports the Enterprise Project Management (EPM) team by working with strategic sponsors on the development of the business charter and scope. Gains sign off on project charter/scope. Serves as Subject Matter Expert on strategic projects business requirements. Leads the team thru the conducting of business requirement sessions. Identifies, analyzes, documents, and coordinates sign off on business requirements. Collaborates with IT/Digital and Security (T&I) teams to ensure requirements alignment with current capabilities and the alignment around common standards, tools, and methods. Interfaces with C-Suite Executives, Business Unit Leaders, Finance, Accounting, and other ULS teams as needed to develop, clarify and gain alignment on business requirements supporting the overall ULS business strategy. Provides oversight to the change management process analyzing change requests and the impact to baselined requirements. Assists the Sr. Program Manager –Portfolio with the intake process. Provides insights to inflight project requirements/resources and other commitments while identifying opportunities to leverage in flight work. Works with the Sr. Program Managers and Test leads on the creation/execution of test use cases ensuring test cases are in alignment with business requirements. Develops and communicates requirements traceability matrix documents clearly showing the relation between final design and business requirements. Provides insight on service level agreements, vendor engagement, procurement issues and quality of service (QoS) elements as related to business requirements. Manages stakeholders’ communications/updates regarding requirements status. Defines and enforces project business requirements governance (controls/expectations). Performs other duties as directed. Qualifications Ten years of project, program, product and/or portfolio management with demonstrated experience completing business requirements for large-scale, distributed/complex projects with multiple parallel threads of work preferred. Demonstrated blend of strategic, operational and implementation thinking. Experienced in complex projects with aggressive schedules. Ability to build and lead integrated teams from various internal and external organizations across multiple sites. Skilled in managing matrixed teams from various internal and external organizations across multiple locations. Deliver on broadly communicated objectives with a minimal amount of supervision while innovating under new and/or changing conditions. An independent problem-solver that can make high quality judgements and decisions quickly with excellent organizational skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and proven ability to work effectively with all organizational levels, with Senior Executive Level reporting and escalation experience. Experience in driving change while assisting stakeholders across the organization to manage in a change-based environment. Promote innovative ideas and accept the risks required to lead change. Ability to make decisions and solve problems independently. Make quality judgements and decisions related to the business requirements, change requests, test cases and the impacts to the solution and organization. Effective consultative and influencing without direct authority skills. Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills. Solid foundation on latest IT/Digital technologies to be able to understand interdependences and drive towards coordinated business/technical solutions. Strong understanding of financial principles including budgeting, capital allocation and business case preparation/analysis. About Us A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions transforms safety, security, and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 100 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers’ product innovation and business growth. The UL Certification Marks serve as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers’ products and reflect an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. From the adoption of electrification to the enablement of 5G and new mobility, we collectively look toward new frontiers, working for a safer world. Our science is your advantage. Mission: Working for a safer world
summary: This senior program manager role focuses on translating business needs into innovative solutions, working on strategic projects, collaborating with IT/Digital and Security teams, and overseeing change management. They are responsible for defining and enforcing project business requirements governance.

title: Business Analyst, Business Consulting - Finance - Finance Transformation - Manager - 1515464
description: EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Business Analyst, Business Consulting - Finance (Finance Transformation) (Manager) (Multiple Positions) (1515464), Ernst & Young U.S. LLP, Chicago, IL. Provide finance business consulting services to help clients improve business performance and operate efficiently. Advise clients on improving and transforming the finance operating model though financial processes, enabling technologies, organizational roles and smarter reporting systems. Analyze data, document findings and prepare recommendations for the implementation of new financial systems, procedures, and organizational changes. Support the design of outsourcing, off-shoring, and global business service arrangements. Design and implement enabling financial systems to improve the process. Assist clients with planning, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting services. Help clients reduce costs through consolidating finance functions across business units. Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress. Manage a workstream or team of individuals in the delivery of client serving efforts. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Manage and motivate teams with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Cultivate business development opportunities. Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week, 8:30 am – 5:30 pm. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Operations, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Management Information Systems (MIS) or a related field and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate work experience in professional services/industry. Alternatively, will accept a Master’s degree in Business, Operations, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Management Information Systems (MIS) or related field and 4 years of work experience in professional services/industry. Must have 4 years of experience in providing professional services related to finance function processes and other operational areas that impact the finance function, including a combination of at least five (5) of the following: finance operating model design, Finance Business Transformation, Global Business Services/Outsourcing, Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, and/or Digital Record to Report. Must have 2 years of experience in three of the following enabling finance function tools: Maximo, PowerPlan, Automation Anywhere, SAP, Ariba, Alteryx, High Radius, Anaplan, Hyperion suite, BPC, Blackline, PowerBI, Tableau, Subscription billing (including SAP BRIM), Oracle, UIPATH, BluePrism, Microsoft PowerAutomate, Microsoft Dynamics, or Pega. Must have 2 years of experience in two (2) of the following: Leading finance workstreams for mid- to large-scale finance transformation projects and programs involving finance functions and shared services; Developing new business with existing clients at the C' level of Fortune 500 companies; Leading a team of consulting professionals on multiple projects. Must have 2 years of experience in structuring and leading executive communications, building dynamic presentations for client executives, and leading workshops/sessions to derive business outcomes. Requires travel up to 80%, of which 20% may be international to serve client needs. Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience. Please apply on-line at ey.com/en_us/careers and click on "Careers - Job Search”, then “Search Jobs" (Job Number - 1515464). What We Offer We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary for this job is $159,610 per year. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law. EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com This particular position at Ernst & Young in the United States requires the qualiﬁed candidate to be a "United States worker" as deﬁned by the U.S. Department of Labor regulations at 20 CFR 656.3. You can review this deﬁnition at https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2011-title20-vol3/pdf/CFR-2011-title20-vol3-sec656-3.pdf at the bottom of page 750.
