summary: EY is seeking a Business Analyst (Manager) to provide finance business consulting services to clients, including improving finance operating models, designing new systems, and implementing financial transformations. This role requires experience in finance function processes, enabling tools, leading teams, and developing business with Fortune 500 companies.  Travel up to 80% is required.

title: Business Analyst (Dynamics 365)- Finance and Purchasing
description: Job Description Job Summary: The Business Analyst is an innovative strategy leader with a strong understanding of procurement and finance functional areas in a manufacturing environment; with the ability to apply that knowledge to implement solutions to accommodate business requirements in a manufacturing environment. We are looking for a motivated team member with excellent leadership and the ability to build strong relationships. A qualified candidate can effectively translate organizational needs into strategic opportunities, while understanding the effect on a growing global organization. Responsibilities will include deep assessments into business challenges, evaluating new technologies, and defining functional standards. This individual will manage the planning and implementation of projects ensuring policies and procedures are consistent with company goals, best practices, software compliance, and regulatory requirements. Responsibilities: Understanding of purchasing and finance business system processes Industry best practice awareness of technology concepts and architecture patterns Work with vendors and service providers as a liaison for the technical team to select the services and products that meet company requirements Establish and maintain an effective system of communications throughout the organization Determine project schedules and effectively manage the allocation of resources to achieve project objectives Ability to translate technical language into non-technical understanding Work closely with our user community and IT professionals to build consensus and standards that are scalable, adaptable, and flexible to meet the needs of a changing business landscape Comply with audit requirements and execute change management best practices Drive to keep current with evolving technology and apply it to future strategic objectives Ability to deliver solutions with industry leading security and efficiencies that aligns with the Enterprise Agenda Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT technical, or a related field 3+ years relevant sales and distribution system experience 10+ years of experience working in a large, multi-regional, corporate environment Experience with ERP systems, with preference for the Microsoft D365 platform Experience implementing cloud solutions is a plus Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with strong customer support orientation Proven record of meeting commitments with the highest standards of ethics and integrity Exhibits strong organizational and time management skills with a sense of drive and urgency Exceptional interpersonal, collaboration, and communication abilities
summary: The Business Analyst is a strategic leader who understands procurement and finance in a manufacturing environment, implementing solutions to meet business requirements. They will assess challenges, evaluate new technologies, define standards, and manage project implementation. This role requires strong leadership, communication, and relationship-building skills.

title: Commercial Lending Business Analyst
description: Job Title: Commercial Lending Business Analyst Job Location: Chicago, IL or New York, NY- (DAY ONE ONSITE) Duration: 12+ months Rate: Market Job Description Requirements Elicitation, Gathering, Clarification, and Analysis. Use Case Analysis and Documentation. Test Planning and Coordination. Ensure application meets business requirements. Create, Execute and Track Test Plans, Cases, and Scripts. Migration Planning and Coordination. Provide Project Support (Issues Tracking, User Training). Create/Update Application Documentation (User Manual, Operating Procedures, Workflows, etc.). Familiarity with modern web application designs and concepts. Commercial Lending Experience a must. Proficient in MS Excel and MS Word. Proficiency in Quality Center is preferable. Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Work with business for requirements. Individual will have up to 8-10+ years of experience
summary: A Business Analyst is needed to support the implementation of a commercial lending application. This role will involve gathering requirements, creating user stories, conducting testing, and providing project support. The ideal candidate will have experience in commercial lending and a strong understanding of the software development lifecycle. This is a 12+ month contract position located in Chicago, IL or New York, NY.

title: Sales Optimization Analyst
description: Farmer’s Fridge makes fruits and vegetables accessible and approachable for everyone. We offer a variety of fresh, healthy, ready-to-eat meals and snacks through our fresh food vending machines, wholesale partners, and our office pantry solution — providing chef-curated meals to customers within seconds. Today, we operate a network of Fridges and partner with clients nationwide in high-foot-traffic areas, such as airports, hospitals, universities, and large office buildings — where there is limited accessibility to fresh, healthy, grab-n-go options. We care deeply about what we’re creating and aspire to make sure our customers feel that through every touchpoint. This shows up in many ways across the business. We are committed to prioritizing food safety, we are passionate about product quality, we value our employees, we champion the best idea no matter where it comes from, and we’re committed to making an overall positive impact as we scale. About This Role: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Sales Optimization Analyst who will play a pivotal role in supporting the broader Sales and Sales Ops teams, across our Fridge and Wholesale channels. Completion of your day-to-day responsibilities will ensure that client data and metric reporting are managed in an accurate and timely manner, while supporting larger teamwide initiatives and data requests from the Sales and Sales Ops teams. This position presents the opportunity to gain experience in sales optimization, data management, and sales analytics, while contributing to the overall success of the company. What You’ll Do: Create and maintain internal sales reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable insights to sales leadership. Own the weekly order entry process and related communications for Wholesale clients - input orders from clients into the Company’s CRM (Salesforce) and thoroughly check data accuracy, correcting for errors when necessary. Work cross-functionally with Distribution, Demand Planning, Production, and others to accommodate Wholesale order changes. Manage weekly and monthly sales report requests for Enterprise clients. Own the completion of vendor registrations and regulatory permitting; work cross-functionally with Legal, Quality & Food Safety, and Accounting to collect the necessary information to ensure there are no delays due to lack of compliance. Conduct ad hoc analyses and provide data-driven recommendations to support strategic Sales initiatives and overall business objectives. Support the management of CRM data by performing regular data audits and validations to ensure the accuracy of the information collected. Who You Are Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field. 1-3 years of experience in Sales Operations, Business Analytics, or related roles. Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools, such as Excel, Tableau, and/or Salesforce. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a curious mindset and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality of work. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Experience working with CRM systems, specifically Salesforce, is a plus. Farmer’s Fridge Diversity Statement: "Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Farmer’s Fridge, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.” Benefits At Farmer's Fridge: In This Together - We stay connected, whether in person or virtually. We encourage business transparency through monthly town hall meetings and weekly financial updates. We set out to make the best product on the market, and we believe we’ve done it. We value your input in the new menu creation process. From regular tasting panels, where employees provide new menu feedback. Happier Workdays - Each day at work should fill you with joy. We're a fun and passionate group, and we don't take ourselves too seriously. Bring your unique self to work, dress comfortably, and always feel free to share your thoughts and opinions. We encourage curiosity; there's no hierarchy here when we're all swapping ideas. Never run on empty - Daily Farmer's Fridge meal, draft cold brew and beer, and office snacks are just some of the offerings to make sure you aren't distracted by a growling stomach. Recharge with our paid sabbatical program after four years of service. Innovate & Elevate - We're all teachers and learners. You'll grow, and help grow the company through cross-functional collaboration, open access to leadership, and regular business updates. You have a direct impact on the company’s bottom line. You can also impact your personal bottom line by participating in our 401(k) plan that includes a company match with immediate vesting. Farmer’s Fridge Diversity Statement: "Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Farmer’s Fridge, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.” Farmer’s Fridge is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity in all employment practices, including hiring, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. View our disclosures related to External Agencies and Applicants below: https://www.farmersfridge.com/careerdisclosures
summary: Farmer's Fridge is seeking a Sales Optimization Analyst to support the Sales and Sales Ops teams, focusing on data analysis and reporting for their fresh food vending machine and wholesale channels. Responsibilities include creating reports and dashboards, managing order entry and data accuracy, supporting client communication, conducting ad hoc analyses, and ensuring CRM data integrity. This role offers the opportunity to gain experience in sales optimization, data management, and sales analytics.

title: Business & Product Reporting Analyst, PPM
description: If you are an internal associate, please login to Workday and apply through Jobs Hub. Working at PPM America, Inc. PPM America, Inc. (PPM) is a client-focused investment manager, and our mission is to deliver client-specific solutions and world class service to investors in the pursuit of their unique investment objectives. PPM prides itself on being a nimble, investment-led organization that is responsive to the opportunities that our teams discover together. Click here for a description of our assets under management and our investment strategies. PPM was named one of the Best Places to Work in Money Management by Pensions & Investments in 2023. We attract professionals who exhibit humbleness, directness, and dedication. Our communication style is informal, and we encourage collaboration by giving our teams the freedom to speak openly and share new ideas. PPM’s values guide our internal conduct and help define the type of relationships we share with our investors, affiliates, and other valued partners. Above all, PPM is passionate about giving back to our clients, to each other, and to our community. We understand that community and purpose are just as important as the job description when finding your next career, and at PPM you would join a community of employees with a long track record of dedicating their time and support to local nonprofits with the effort of strengthening local families and increasing economic opportunities. At PPM, we believe that diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of our growth and longevity. PPM is committed to a culture of respect and believe that inclusion is the key to this culture, enabling our ability to innovate, execute, and grow for the benefit of our associates, clients, shareholders, and the communities where we live. Portfolio Services Department Description The Portfolio Services Department is a dynamic, fast-paced team that provides a broad spectrum of operational support to PPM and fiduciary oversight of its client investments and assets. Functionally oriented teams include: Public & Private Operations, Derivatives Administration, Performance Analytics, Data Management and Business & Product Reporting. A high level of collaboration coupled with extensive cross-training promotes flexibility, scalability, and professional development. Portfolio Services is centrally positioned to engage with PPM’s investment and administrative teams to meet the firm’s strategic objectives. The department maxim is to be indispensable to our clients through timely, complete and accurate execution of roles and responsibilities. Summary Of Role The Business & Product Reporting (BPR) Analyst role exists within the BPR team and within Portfolio Services. This team provides a centralized and coordinated research and fulfilment function, supporting the reporting and analysis needs of PPM America's business units and clientele. The team leverages the organization through operating depth, developed skills, use of technology, process optimization, and clear operating accountabilities. The Business & Product Reporting Analyst works closely with personnel in Investment Management, Global Relationship Management, Marketing & Communications, Performance & Attribution, and IT, as well as other groups, as needed. Role Responsibilities As an analyst in BPR, the candidate will be responsible for bridging the gap between technical investment analytics and end-client deliverables. The role is focused on data, both proprietary PPM data and external market data and intelligence. The role will work extensively with the PPM IT department in automation efforts and effective use and application of information. The activities that are particularly relevant to the analyst of BPR include: Serve as a resource and expert in bridging the gap between technical investment analytics and the end client deliverables for Marketing & Communications, Global Relationship Management, Distribution, and other front office departments. Develop a mastery of PPM’s proprietary systems to deliver AUM and Cash Flow reporting, as an example, and to support various ad-hoc requests for unique historical portfolio and strategy characteristics used in RFPs or other deliverables. Partner with IT to maintain and enhance systems as needed. Assist other BPR team members in maintaining firm information and investment strategy data in targeted investment consultant databases. Partner with other BPR team members, the Marketing & Communications, and Distribution teams to respond to RFPs and other ad hoc questionnaires, as applicable. Take ownership of data/quantitative questions within the requests. Assist in creating standardized marketing content and updating standard monthly and quarterly presentations. Generate reports for institutional client accounts across multiple asset classes, with content tailored for audiences including management, investors, and other interested parties. Actively support the Standard Client Reporting Package (SCRP) process and develop new standard reports on an as needed basis. Generate monthly and quarterly peer reporting for use in reporting and scorecard metrics. Develop a strong knowledge base of systems and criteria used to be able to support ad hoc requests and data mining projects. Take on regular occurring deliverables and participate in ad hoc projects and client reporting as needed. Required Skills & Experience The ideal candidate is a self-starter and is passionate about financial services. The candidate should be effective working in a team environment, as well as possess the ability to work independently on specific projects. The candidate should be professional, self-motivated, proactive, and results-oriented. The ability to interpret, present, and distill a variety of data is a must as the team serves as the gatekeepers of data distribution. Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution required. 1+ years of relevant work experience required. General knowledge of investment products, including public and non-traditional investment vehicles. Ability to prioritize and independently manage multiple deadlines and clientele simultaneously and ensure that all tasks are completed on time with minimal supervision. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills. Experience in preparing accurate and timely reports, analysis, and presentations for management and clients. Unquestionable professional integrity. Critical thinking, analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving expertise. Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, with an emphasis on Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Experience with active participation in strategic initiatives. Desired Skills & Experience PPM is a team-oriented environment that provides hands-on support and incentives for your professional growth. The below skills and experience are helpful for this role, but a pro-active learner who meets the role requirements will be able to gain the necessary skills on the job with the support of our team. Progress toward or interest in MBA or advanced degree is a plus Progress toward or interest in Industry related designations such as CFA, CPA, CIPM Experience with active participation in strategic initiatives Experience with Morningstar Direct, eVestment Analytics, eVestment Omni, and Seismic a plus Technical aptitude and Experience with Power BI, programing languages or other business intelligence tools, is a plus Opportunities Joining our Business and Product Reporting Team offers a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data analysis, business strategy, and investment management. You will have the chance to shape the firm's client reporting and communication content and processes, contribute to optimizing operational efficiencies, and drive data-driven insights. As a member of this dynamic team, you will collaborate with talented professionals from various disciplines, gaining exposure to global markets, investment trends, and business operations. Additionally, our firm is committed to fostering professional growth and development, providing opportunities for continued learning, mentorship, and advancement. Benefits At PPM, we offer volunteer opportunities to get involved with a diverse network of peers and support the causes that are important to you. Your passion and talents can make a lasting impact on our organization and our community. Additionally, our employees go the extra mile every day and the benefits of working at PPM reflect our commitment to supporting and enhancing their personal and professional lives. The plans and programs listed below are offered in collaboration with our parent company. Competitive salary and bonus Medical, dental and vision coverage 401k retirement plan with dollar-for-dollar matching contributions (up to 6% of salary) Tuition and professional certification reimbursement Paid parental leave Adoption assistance Holidays and paid time off Paid time off to volunteer Life insurance Gift matching Equal Employment Opportunity PPM America, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we base our employment decisions without unlawful regard or consideration of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, non-job related disability, pregnancy or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.
summary: PPM America, Inc. is seeking a Business & Product Reporting Analyst to join their Portfolio Services team. This role will focus on data analysis and reporting, bridging the gap between technical investment analytics and end-client deliverables. The analyst will work with various internal teams to generate reports, maintain systems, and respond to RFPs. This position requires 1+ years of experience, strong analytical skills, proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, and experience with investment products.  Experience with Power BI, programming languages, or other business intelligence tools is a plus.

title: PeopleSoft Financials Business Analyst
description: About Us InterSources Inc , a Certified Diverse Supplier, was founded in 2007 and offers innovative solutions to help clients with Digital Transformations across various domains and industries. Our history spans over 16 years and today we are an Award-Winning Global Software Consultancy solving complex problems with technology. We recognize that our employees and our clients are our strengths as the diverse talents and opportunities they bring to the table enable us to grow as a global platform and they are causally linked with our success. We provide strategic and technical advice, and we have expertise in areas covering Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Migration, Custom Software Development, Data Analytics Infrastructure & Cloud Solutions, Cyber Security Services, etc. We make reasonable accommodations for clients and employees and we do not discriminate based on any protected attribute including race, religion, color, national origin, gender sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or marital status. We also are a Google Cloud partner company. We align strategy with execution and provide secure service solutions by developing and using the latest technologies that thrive our resources to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it convenient for our clients to do business with InterSources Inc. Our teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven client experiences that put the users first, providing an unparalleled experience. This results in strengthening the core technologies of clients, enabling them to scale with flexibility, create seamless digital experiences and build lifelong relationships.
summary: InterSources Inc. is a global software consultancy founded in 2007 specializing in digital transformation solutions. They offer a range of services including Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Migration, Custom Software Development, Data Analytics, Cloud Solutions, and Cyber Security.  They are a Google Cloud partner and emphasize their commitment to diversity and inclusion.

title: Senior Analyst, S&O (Hybrid)
description: We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas or take over sponsorship at this time. About the role: A Strategy & Operations Analyst directly supports one of Enova’s core P&L’s and works on projects to maximize operational efficiency within the business. The projects range from short-term immediate impact projects to long term strategic initiatives. We are big enough to have resources to successfully scale the business, but small enough that a single associate has the autonomy to make a meaningful impact. Responsibilities: Manage initiatives that focus on driving new projects, processes improvements and customer experience enhancements. Anticipate bottlenecks, provide management escalation, prioritize and execute projects, balance business needs vs. technical constraints, ensure quality, and drive bottom line results Own end to end projects from initial recommendation through implementation/execution and assurance of successful business impact. Build and cultivate relationships with cross-functional teams within the organization. Evaluate vendor proposals, negotiate with external partners and collaborate with internal tech development teams to ensure that projects meet business requirements. Run ad hoc projects that are often data intensive and require comfort with numbers to make decisions. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, or Finance. Our S&O team comes from a variety of backgrounds but are successful because of their ability to problem solve and think analytically. 2-4 years of tangible work experience dealing with process improvement, management consulting or data analytics. Demonstrate strong analytical thinking through excellent written and oral communication skills. Skilled in negotiating, influencing others, analytical thinking, leading others, and executing and implementing projects. #BI-Hybrid Benefits & Perks: Hybrid roles entail working in-office from Tuesday to Thursday, with the choice to work remotely on Mondays and Fridays Health, dental, and vision insurance including mental health benefits 401(k) matching plus a roth option (U.S. Based employees only) PTO & paid holidays off Sabbatical program (for eligible roles) Summer hours (for eligible roles) Paid parental leave DEI groups (B.L.A.C.K. @ Enova, HOLA @ Enova, Women @ Enova, Pride @ Enova, South Asians @ Enova, APEX @ Enova, and Parents @ Enova) Employee recognition and rewards program Charitable matching and a paid volunteer day…Plus so much more! About Enova Enova International is a leading financial technology company that provides online financial services through our AI and machine learning-powered Colossus™platform. We serve non-prime consumers and businesses alike, while offering world-class technology and services to traditional banks—in order to create accessible credit for millions. Being a values-driven organization is at the core of Enova’s success. We live our values by listening to our customers, challenging assumptions, thinking big, setting high expectations, and hiring and developing the best. Through our values and our commitment to making Enova an awesome place to work, we maintain an environment of inclusion and culture where our employees can thrive. You can learn more about Enova’s values and culture here. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. California Applicants: Click here to review our California Privacy Policy for Job Applicants.
summary: Enova is seeking a Strategy & Operations Analyst to support a core P&L, manage projects, improve processes and customer experience, and drive bottom-line results.  The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in process improvement, management consulting, or data analytics and possesses strong analytical thinking, communication, and project management skills.  Enova offers a hybrid work model, benefits, and a values-driven culture.

title: Sr. Business Analyst, SAP Commerce
description: Sr. Business Analyst, SAP Commerce Oak Brook, IL Role Summary In this role you will collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements to develop/maintain applications that enable business processes, focused on SAP Commerce and related applications. Responsibilities: Design, configure, develop, test, implement, and support applications that enable eBusiness business processes, focused on Hybris Commerce, Hybris WCMS, Hybris Data Hub, and integrations with other applications such as SAP ECC, Paymetric, Vertex, Widen Work with business stakeholders to understand business processes, gaps, pain points, and objectives; elicit, define, and analyze requirements Collaborate with colleagues to define and design proposed solutions that meet requirements and adhere to platform and application design guidelines, strategies, and industry best practices Collaborate with application developers to create functional specifications for custom development that adheres to design guidelines and industry best practices Collaborate with Super Users to create test cases for end-to-end business processes and system functions, ensuring traceability and coverage of requirements; execute tests; facilitate Super User test execution; analyze and resolve defects Collaborate with business stakeholders to create documentation and training materials; support training delivery and organizational change management Support production systems; proactively work to analyze and resolve production problems in a timely manner; resolve end user service requests; independently execute production support processes including identification of issue severity, root cause, and path to resolution Identify opportunities to leverage applications to improve business processes, and support business re-engineering efforts. Research and represent industry best practices Plan and manage small projects leveraging appropriate project management methodology Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed Experience: 7 years' experience in Information Technology, preferably applications development or configuration. 5 years hands-on experience with Hybris Commerce including hands-on configuration 5 years working with business processes related to eBusiness such as content management, product information management, checkout, site search, SEO At least one full lifecycle implementation of an eCommerce platform
summary: Senior Business Analyst specializing in SAP Commerce (Hybris) with a focus on eBusiness applications. Responsibilities include gathering requirements, designing solutions, configuring Hybris platforms, developing functional specifications, testing, implementation support, production maintenance, and identifying process improvement opportunities.

title: Business Analyst - Marketing Technology
description: SUMMARY The Business Analyst, Marketing Technology performs analysis activities that support the decision making regarding matching marketing technology solutions (package selection, configuration, development) with business, user(s), and functional needs from stakeholders. This involves conducting market research, functional comparisons, and staying abreast of what is being done at other companies. The analyst will also gather requirements, document procedures, and review the methods of the current processes. The BA partners with the appropriate business stakeholders and the Program Manager to prioritize and create a project roadmap for their assigned area. With the business and IT teams, they maintain a set of institutional knowledge of what is working well within the program and what needs improvement. RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with business stakeholders to understand and prioritize their needs, creating a roadmap of projects related to marketing technology (CRM, CMS, etc.) Seek input of user experience and document current procedures and processes to determine potential improvements to their assigned products. Stay abreast of best practices being done at other companies and technology developments that may affect the areas. Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders and the Program Managers to influence the technology decisions for the areas based on this knowledge. Analyze and consolidate all perspectives on the project - business needs, requirements, user experience, security, training, risk, time, cost, technology architecture, procurement/vendor management, operational considerations, etc. - to help the Company reach the best technology decisions. Manage the lifecycle of their assigned products, from inception to implementation, throughout production until retirement / upgrade. Gather business requirements from project stakeholders to further define the goals and objectives. Drives projects and business teams toward achieving intended business results within a specified time and budget. Perform risk analyses to identify and resolve critical path issues. Prepare and analyze program / project related data. Review and report on program / project status. Prepare materials for briefings and presentations to large size groups of key decision makers at the executive level. REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience 2+ years of experience with requirements gathering, documentation and communicating requirements to technical teams & vendors Specifically performing these activities for marketing technology such as CRMs, CMSs or other technology that supports the marketing business function Proficiency with MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) PREFERRED EXPERIENCE Experience with SharePoint, Sitecore, Interaction, OnePlace, Foundations or OneSheet
summary: The Business Analyst, Marketing Technology performs analysis activities that support decision-making regarding marketing technology solutions. This involves market research, functional comparisons, gathering requirements, documenting procedures, and staying abreast of industry trends. They partner with stakeholders and program managers to prioritize projects and maintain institutional knowledge of program effectiveness.

title: Business Function Analyst
description: Trivium Packaging is a global sustainability leader in metal packaging with more than 60 locations worldwide, nearly 8,000 employees, and an annual revenue of approximately €3.0 billion. Trivium serves a diverse range of customers in a variety of end markets such as food, seafood, pet food, nutrition, beauty and personal care, household care, and premium beverages. Trivium wants to shape the industry and has embarked on an ambitious transformation journey. In the near term, focus is on building & upskilling the team, deciding where to play & how to win, and increasing financial performance by executing the Trivium Business System (commercial, operational, and supply chain excellence). Sustainability is embedded in our materials and in our actions. Trivium has ambitious sustainability targets and focuses exclusively on products that are infinitely recyclable. Our company sustainability journey has been awarded with a Platinum medal by EcoVadis, the world’s leading rating agent who allocated this award only to the top 1% of the >75000 companies reviewed. Sustainability is embedded in each and every function at Trivium, it‘s in our DNA. The global head office is at Amsterdam Airport; however, many people work in virtual teams from different countries. Our culture is results-driven, entrepreneurial, informal, and highly multicultural. Our people have a high degree of responsibility. Job Summary As part of the SAP COE Team, you will support the business as a change keeper. As part of ensuring that change is sustainable, your focus will be to ensure that change has been adopted by local organizations where SAP was implemented. Developing and measuring standard metrics, as well as identifying opportunities for improvement, while monitoring the new processes to ensure it works as intended, will be part of your daily routine. Job Duties Assess adoption and proficiency of changes within the organization in compliance with SAP COE change management approach and methodology. Conduct business reviews with local teams and drive the execution of action plans towards continuous improvement. Provide direct support, coaching, training to the change network (Super Users, Key Users) guaranteeing the learning curve is well addressed. Facilitate change management activities with local teams and cross-functional team members to ensure the implemented enterprise business model is sustainable. Interface with users, identifying improvements opportunities, or capturing their demand of changes or improvements (active listener). Other duties as assigned. Qualifications And Experience Requirements Degree in Business Management, Administration, Supply Chain, or Computer Science. Fluent in English (written / spoken), second language appreciated. Experience +5 years in SAP. Experience +5 manufacturing companies. Experience in Microsoft Office tools. Ability to communicate with all levels within the organization. Ability to influence decision-making. Ability to manage priorities and deliver on time. Team player Willingness to travel 15% up to 30% (e.g. visit plants and offices) Work Environment This position will primarily work in a manufacturing environment where moving machinery produces noise. In addition, working at an office desk and using a computer, telephone and other office electronics are critical. This position will occasionally travel to other plant or office locations. Trivium Packaging is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. I acknowledge that I have read and understand the above job description in its entirety and am capable of performing all of the stated requirements. BRINGING YOUR TRUE SELF TO WORK To reach our goals, we know we need colleagues at all levels who are truly diverse in every way. That’s why we are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. Our customers come from a wide range of backgrounds, and so do our people and It’s business critical for us to ensure all our people have what they need to perform at their best and can be their true selves at work.
summary: This role supports Trivium Packaging's SAP COE team as a change keeper, ensuring successful adoption of SAP implementations within local organizations. Responsibilities include assessing change adoption, conducting business reviews, providing training and coaching, facilitating change management activities, and identifying improvement opportunities.

title: Business Analyst (Commercial Systems)
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton. Job Overview The individual in this position will have experience gathering and documenting product requirements, working in a variety of systems environments and have at least a general understanding of the technology considerations. They will be comfortable leading workshops, working meetings and presentations, communicate in an empathetic, positive and friendly manner with a focus on clarifying business needs and customer service. In addition, they will be comfortable working with contractors, vendors and multiple processes and methodologies to manage requirements for all stakeholders. Key Job Responsibilities Business Process Design: Contributes to the analysis of business processes to identify and clarify requirements Contributes to improvements to business processes Is able to analyze and assess an organization's business model Requirements Documentation: Demonstrates an ability to express complex ideas clearly Facilitates analysis, classification and documentation of requirements Proposes an appropriate document-set for a project Publishes, distributes and facilitates sign-off of requirements documentation Manages changes to the requirements baseline Supports impact analysis on changes to requirement(s) through project lifecycle Eliciting Requirements: Gathers, clarifies and validates requirements Acts as interpreter who facilitates communication between clients and internal teams Anticipates, quantifies and resolves problems and issues with requirements Structured Analysis: Uses data and process modelling techniques to identify and clarify requirements Communicates with clients and internal teams to clarify and validate requirements Uses data and process modelling tools Testing: Demonstrates knowledge of testing strategies, plans and execution Participates actively in the development and execution of testing strategies and plans Designs user acceptance testing plans Monitors user acceptance testing and responses to problems IT Fluency: Understands IT and project management concepts with an emphasis on Agile methodology Uses desktop productivity applications at a superior level Is aware of the societal impact of information and information technology to support adoption and change management activities Qualifications/Requirements Degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field or a combination of education/training and work experience equivalent to an advanced degree. 5 - 10 years experience as a Business Analyst in software or interactive web development initiatives Strong analytical skills Strong organizational skills Applies creative thinking and problem solving to clarifying requirements related issues Demonstrated experience producing technology project artifacts including: Use Cases Requirements Documents Functional Specifications Test Plans and Test Cases Process Flows Demonstrated experience in technology solution management, including: Usability/GUI design Web application development methodologies Object-oriented development approaches Working knowledge of third-party solution providers Defining and documenting design to requirements trade-offs Broad knowledge of programs, projects and knowledge management processes and toolsets Knowledge of user-centered content development, interface design, information architecture, digital branding and marketing communications Demonstrated experience in communications management, including: Ability to communicate with a variety of audiences (internal and external teams) Consensus building, team building and problem solving Written and oral communications, including presentations to senior level executives Ability to work with cross-functional teams (creative and technical) throughout implementation to ensure integrity to requirements Organizing and facilitating meetings with business users for requirements gathering Preferred: IIBA certification Preferred: Microsoft DevOps/Github/JIRA experience. Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) would be preferred. Additional Information Business analysis lead on complex software development project spread across multiple projects and vendors. Strong understanding of Komatsu’s key applications across our Mining, Construction, Forestry and Forklift product lines Expert level understanding of key applications and related product roadmaps to support alignment with stakeholders on current and future direction and to drive adoption with external business partners and customers. Expert level understanding of key functionality to drive reuse of core components and minimize proliferation of similar / one off applications, portals and websites across a common user base Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
summary: Komatsu seeks a Business Analyst to lead complex software development projects, gather and document product requirements, work across various systems environments, and ensure alignment with stakeholders. This role requires strong analytical and organizational skills, experience in creating technology project artifacts, and expertise in usability/GUI design, web application development, object-oriented development, and user-centered content development. The ideal candidate will have 5-10 years of experience as a Business Analyst in software or interactive web development initiatives and a deep understanding of Komatsu's key applications across mining, construction, forestry, and forklift product lines.

title: Business Analyst - Marketing Technology
description: SUMMARY The Business Analyst – Marketing Technology performs analysis activities that support the decision making regarding matching marketing technology solutions (package selection, configuration, development) with business, user(s), and functional needs from stakeholders. This involves conducting market research, functional comparisons, and staying abreast of what is being done at other companies. The analyst will also gather requirements, document procedures, and review the methods of the current processes. The BA partners with the appropriate business stakeholders and the Program Manager to prioritize and create a project roadmap for their assigned area. With the business and IT teams, they maintain a set of institutional knowledge of what is working well within the program and what needs improvement. RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with business stakeholders to understand and prioritize their needs, creating a roadmap of projects related to marketing technology (CRM, CMS, etc.) Seek input of user experience and document current procedures and processes to determine potential improvements to their assigned products. Stay abreast of best practices being done at other companies and technology developments that may affect the areas. Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders and the Program Managers to influence the technology decisions for the areas based on this knowledge. Analyze and consolidate all perspectives on the project – business needs, requirements, user experience, security, training, risk, time, cost, technology architecture, procurement/vendor management, operational considerations, etc. – to help the Company reach the best technology decisions. Manage the lifecycle of their assigned products, from inception to implementation, throughout production until retirement / upgrade. Gather business requirements from project stakeholders to further define the goals and objectives. Drives projects and business teams toward achieving intended business results within a specified time and budget. Perform risk analyses to identify and resolve critical path issues. Prepare and analyze program / project related data. Review and report on program / project status. Prepare materials for briefings and presentations to large size groups of key decision makers at the executive level. REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience A minimum of 2 years of experience with requirements gathering, documentation and communicating requirements to technical teams & vendors Specifically performing these activities for marketing technology such as CRMs, CMSs or other technology that supports the marketing business function Proficiency with MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) PREFERRED EXPERIENCE Experience with Sitecore, Interaction, OnePlace, Foundations or OneSheet
summary: The Business Analyst - Marketing Technology analyzes marketing technology solutions to align with business needs, conducts market research, and gathers requirements for project roadmaps. They collaborate with stakeholders and IT teams to optimize processes and stay informed about industry trends. This role involves managing the lifecycle of assigned products, performing risk analyses, and presenting project status to executive decision-makers.

title: Strategic/Business Analyst (Must Have Experience With Alteryx, Power BI)
description: Hello There, Position: Business Analyst (Must Have Experience With Alteryx, Power BI) Location: Vernon Hills, IL Duration: 12+ Months Contract Total Hours/week: 40.00 Position Title: Strategic Project Analyst, WWISD Job Description Summary The Infusion Specialty Disposables business (ISD) within BD is on a transformational journey towards category leadership and is seeking a Strategic Project Analyst. This role will have the unique opportunity to impact both portfolio redevelopment and expansion to broader solutions. Reporting to the project marketing commercial manager WWISD, the Strategic Project Analyst will be accountable for maintenance and further development of all financial, service metrics, key process performance KPI’s and ad hoc reporting for the project. The role requires using the developed database (Alteryx) and reports (Power BI) to support the project core team and cross functional partners. Responsibilities Create and maintain relevant tracking tools and metrics for the project core team, leadership reports, and marketing and region updates Identifies through analysis trends and improvement opportunities that align with the project waves, rationalization, and revenue objectives Works collaboratively across the core team functional partners to validate data that is leveraged by all end users Acts as the primary analyst for the project in all reporting aspects including but not limited to: SKU FG and component base data, data updates, region sales data, revenue $, COGS, pricing and targets, project wave tracking metrics, and launch metrics. Qualifications / Experience Bachelors’ degree required. MBA or advanced degree preferred Strong Excel experience developed from analytically focused engagements (preferably healthcare industry related) SKU rationalization analysis Ability to work effectively within a team and matrix environment Business Analyst: 2-5 years’ experience / Sr. Business Analyst: 4-6 years in client services, professional services industries Preferred Experience with SKU rationalization, pricing diagnostics, manufacturing, and supply chain logistics (preferably healthcare industry related) Degree concentration in Health Care, Business or Software Development Medical communications or healthcare industry experience Working understanding of relational database technology Direct experience with advanced analytics platforms (Alteryx, Tableau) Experience in market analysis, or other related business function, ideally including marketing, strategic innovation, sales, market research, product launch, planning/exe
summary: The Strategic Project Analyst will support the Infusion Specialty Disposables (ISD) business at BD by developing and maintaining financial, service, and performance metrics for a key project. This role requires using Alteryx and Power BI for data analysis and reporting to support the project core team and cross-functional partners.

title: Bilingual (Spanish / English) Business Analyst - Operations
description: Description USC Consulting Group is a forward moving consulting firm with a reputation of excellence that partners with clients to provide greater value and competitiveness within their businesses. We provide multiple skills and business techniques such as: systems solutions, process improvement, quality function deployment, continuous flow manufacturing and integrated supply chain management. A Business Analyst within operations with our firm will work on a team and be assigned to a project to work at one of our client locations (you will travel from your home base anywhere in the U.S. or Canada) and benefit from the extensive experience of the members. You will learn the needed skill sets and business techniques required to be successful in our business as a business architect and change practitioner that brings the right solutions to each project. The specific position responsibilities are within the scope of project management which relates to work flow analysis, planning, change process and systems implementation. We work closely with our clients in a partnership to achieve measurable results in process flow, productivity improvement as well as performance management. Functions And Duties This is a bilingual role within our analytical and business development department. Must be fluent with reading and writing in Spanish.The ideal candidate has previous experience working for a consulting firm, functioning in an Analyst / Operations Management role. The Business Analyst can see waste when touring a facility or reviewing performance data and translate these into meaningful business opportunities, that drive tangible and measurable value for the prospect or client. The ideal candidate has previous experience as an Analyst with an implementation management consulting firm focusing on operational excellence. This individual can demonstrate: Experience across multiple industries and verticals, including experience working internationally. Possesses 5-10 years of experience in this specific role. Practical experience analyzing multiple work streams, the ability to identify all types of waste, associated non-value added activities and their root cause(s). Practical experience converting identified waste into business opportunities and tangible, measurables financial benefits. "Street credibility" (i.e., understanding how the technical and tactical elements of large ticket 'process improvement initiatives are sold'). Experience working in diverse industry segments, selling comprehensive MOS solutions into related environments, i.e.: product development, supply chain, and/or manufacturing, food processing, capital intensive and/or commodity-based operations. Strong understanding of front-end SI&OP, planning and scheduling methodologies, related supply chain, product development, and various production, manufacturing operations, asset management and logistics. Being adept verbally and with writing skills at clearly articulating issues, selling into new accounts, and possesses a demonstrated ability to develop, qualify, and close large, sometimes politically complex business opportunities, while handling objections seamlessly. The ability and willingness to learn, listen, understand, and continually improve his/her skills, without being told to do so. Being a team player, able to work effectively with others in structuring, selling and on occasion, supporting delivery of value-added services to top tier clients. Travel is dependent on study needs and client requests, but you can live anywhere in the continental U.S or Canada. Technology Experience Advanced computer skills; including MS Office Suite, MS Project, Power BI, Tableau, Web conferencing, and CRM. Possessing a working knowledge of Current Business Technology Tools including SPC data analysis, and Power BI. Candidate is well versed in Business Techniques such as APM (Asset Performance Management), Lean Six-Sigma, Spend / Sourcing. Knowledge And Skills Required Possess a thorough understanding of all aspects of the Analysis process and Analysis tools utilized. Exceptional observation, analytical, numerical reasoning, business acumen and leadership skills Prior consulting experience preferred. Understanding of how technical and tactical elements of large ticket 'process improvement initiatives' are sold. Excellent communication skills in Business English and Spanish (read, write, speak) Ability to balance delivery of results, problem solving, and client management. Superior time management skills and the ability to keep the analysis and preparations on schedule to meet critical deadlines. Strong ability to review, analyze and present large amounts of data within short time frames. Position Requirements Education And Work Experience An undergraduate business-related degree (advanced degree is a plus). Experienced in working diverse industry segments selling comprehensive MOS solutions into related product development, supply chain, and/or manufacturing operations. Ability to travel up to 75%. Ability to work on international assignments. Have a valid driver’s license, and a Canadian or US Passport. Physical Requirements The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, and use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Long periods may be spent looking at a computer screen. Must be able to spend extended periods of time in-flight and travel long distances. Work Environment While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works near moving equipment. The noise level in the work environment is occasionally loud. Temperature of the work environment may be extremely hot, cold or uncomfortable. May be required to live in primitive conditions We are a Drug-Free Workplace About the Organization USC Consulting Group is a forward moving consulting firm with a reputation of excellence since 1968 that partners with clients to provide greater value and competitiveness within their businesses. We provide multiple skills and business techniques such as: systems solutions, process improvement, quality function deployment, continuous flow manufacturing and integrated supply chain management. Our consultants work across multiple disciplines and industries, and must be able to understand the client's business and build credibility quickly to facilitate change for the improvement of the company's processes, through-put, bottom line and employee engagement. A consultant with our organization should love travel, being active on the job, the challenge of working in new places and environments, the passion and emotional intelligence to help people see the value in change to benefit themselves and the company, and be someone who would be bored sitting behind a desk all day. The company provides excellent benefits and covers most of the cost for employees. Employees contribute a small percentage to medical and vision plans but the company fully covers the cost of a telemedicine plan, dental, life insurance, STD and LTD. EOE Statement We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
summary: USC Consulting Group is seeking a bilingual Business Analyst with 5-10 years of experience in operations management consulting. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of Lean Six-Sigma, Asset Performance Management (APM), Spend/Sourcing, and experience working across multiple industries and verticals, including international experience. Responsibilities include identifying and analyzing waste in various work streams, translating waste into business opportunities, and implementing process improvement initiatives. This is a travel-intensive role, requiring the ability to work on-site at client locations across the US and Canada. Strong communication skills, analytical skills, and experience selling process improvement solutions are essential.

title: Business Analyst Lead IT (Hybrid)
description: For further inquiries regarding the following opportunity, please contact one of our Talent Specialists Samreen - 2243034454 Sheetal - 224-507-1273 Title: Business Analyst Lead IT (Hybrid) Location: Lisle, IL Duration: 5 Months Description Local Candidates ONLY!!!! Looking for a stellar candidate for this role Analytical skills: able to quickly grasp software functionality, business & functional requirements, and customer experience feedback. Able to contextualize and evaluate impacts of reported bugs, deficiencies, new feature requests and to define solutions & approaches to 1) respond effectively to customer needs and 2) drive product improvement. Communication skills (verbal & written): Clear, concise, articulate, adapts to audience. Good listener. Attention to detail in documentation. Deep experience performing SW development best practices. i.e. Agile/SCRUM, sprint planning, issue tracking & prioritization, defining & presenting solutions. We need someone heavily involved before and during the development phase. Detailed requirements development work with stakeholders, including electronic control module suppliers is a key aspect of this role. Need an expert in clarifying SW feature development requirements for the software development team. Doing so will require evaluation of the data and reference material provided to us by our engineering org and our "[vehicle] Service Readiness" organization. This role is responsible for ensuring specific data, formatting, and other content are received and validated. Developers will be coding clients service diagnostics tool software based on validated inputs and clear requirements that are consolidated and summarized by this BA. It is a demanding role with a steep learning curve that requires serious attention to detail as well as follow-up and follow through with the product owner and various stakeholders. Purpose Analyzes complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Provides technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet user requirements. Configures system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Designs details of automated systems. May provide consultation to users in the area of automated systems. May lead cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues Characteristics/Scope Work is accomplished through independent contributions or project work requiring advanced subject area knowledge and decision-making skills. Has wide-ranging experience, using professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in innovative and effective ways. Requires specialized comprehensive knowledge in commercial vehicle diagnostics and SAE standard CAN communication protocols, with depth and/or breadth of expertise. Solves complex issues and problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions, and using applicable functional knowledge and existing methodologies. Exercises judgment in selecting best methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends solutions/best practices. Ability to execute highly complex or specialized projects; adapts precedent and may make significant departures from traditional approaches to develop solutions. Is recognized as an expert in own area within own discipline/function within the organization. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise. Serves as a resource for best practices/quality on functional teams or projects. Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations. Trains, guides and mentors other professionals or colleagues with less experience. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other personnel, lead functional teams or projects, and serve as a best practice/quality resource. Education requirement: Bachelor's degree Years of Experience: At least 8 years of business analyst experience. At least 5 years of lead experience About Us DivIHN , the 'IT Asset Performance Services' organization, provides Professional Consulting, Custom Projects, and Professional Resource Augmentation services to clients in the Mid-West and beyond. The strategic characteristics of the organization are Standardization, Specialization, and Collaboration. DivIHN is an equal opportunity employer. DivIHN does not and shall not discriminate against any employee or qualified applicant on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status.
summary: DivIHN is seeking a Business Analyst Lead IT to work on a 5-month project in Lisle, IL. The role requires strong analytical and communication skills, deep experience with SW development best practices (Agile/SCRUM), and expertise in clarifying SW feature development requirements. The ideal candidate will have at least 8 years of business analyst experience and at least 5 years of lead experience. They will be responsible for analyzing complex business problems, designing automated systems, and providing technical expertise. The role involves detailed requirements development work with stakeholders, including electronic control module suppliers, and ensuring the accuracy of data and information provided to the software development team.

title: Strategy Execution Consultant - Experienced Hires
description: What You’ll Do At BTS BTS is a consultancy specializing in the people side of strategy. For over three decades we’ve been designing powerful experiences that have a profound and lasting impact on businesses and their people. We help the world’s leading companies turn strategy into results. Our next-generation approach combines deep business knowledge with transformational development to help people and their company evolve together. We equip leaders for tomorrow, inspire new ways of thinking, and build critical capabilities through targeted interventions, including working sessions, workshops, offsites, and more. As a Strategy Execution Consultant, you’ll work directly with leaders from the world’s leading and largest corporations. You’ll learn how their strategies and businesses work, and you’ll shape capabilities across the organization. We work in small teams to develop designed experiences - think customized business simulations with financial models, or app-based digital learning, – then we facilitate these engagements with our clients in a working session that incorporates humor, fun, and competition; and, you’re the facilitator and coach who makes these experiences impactful and memorable. There are no industry verticals at BTS, and you will work with a variety of clients on different types of projects. You’ll be staffed on multiple engagements at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams. As a Strategy Execution Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across our company’s areas of expertise: Strategic Alignment, Business Acumen, Sales & Marketing, and Leadership Development. When you’re not facilitating an offsite with your teammates, you’ll spend your time designing these amazing experiences - interviewing clients, conducting research and analysis, testing programs, and learning. This is all done in a team-based setting where our entrepreneurial culture of freedom and responsibility empowers you to contribute from your first day. As your skills and career grow, you’ll take on more responsibility to lead projects, manage client relationships, find new clients and opportunities to grow BTS’s business, and grow the careers of others BTSers. We have a hybrid work environment with expectations of being in the office 50% of the time when you’re not traveling. As for travel, we do that differently than most consulting firms: you’ll travel when you are leading clients through the designed experiences you and your teammates create. On average you’ll travel 30-50% of the time, occasionally more than 50%, occasionally less than 30%. What We’re Looking For We want genuinely curious and humbly inclusive people who bring diverse experiences, backgrounds, skills, and capabilities to BTS. Experience And Background Requirements & Preferences Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience Two to five years of experience in consulting, or in a relevant industry Some project leadership experience is ideal, and for more experienced candidates, experience in a client-facing role is strongly preferred Eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship is required Required Skills And Capabilities Business and Operational Acumen Possesses interest and skills to learn our client’s business operating models Utilizes financial statements/metrics to understand client engagements Problem-framing and Developing Insights Applies qualitative and/or quantitative data analysis Integrates insights from secondary sources Client-Ready Communication Skills Creates clear and accurate written docs Listens so the client, as well as your teammates, feel heard Facilitates & presents in a captivating manner while communicating with others as regular people Accountability to Self, Team, and Clients Takes responsibility for your own work to help your team achieve objectives and outcomes Requests and receives feedback to grow skills Proactively looks for opportunities to help other BTSers with client and/or professional development Salary Information Annual Salary Range: $75,000 - $150,000 This range is for Business Analyst, Senior Business Analyst, Consultant, and Senior Consultant level roles. Starting salary is determined by experience and education/degree level
summary: BTS is a consultancy specializing in people strategy, helping leading companies turn strategy into results. They provide transformational development through interventions like workshops and offsites. As a Strategy Execution Consultant, you'll work directly with clients, designing and facilitating engaging experiences, utilizing various methods like business simulations and digital learning. You'll also contribute to research, analysis, and program testing in a team-based environment. This role involves travel and client interaction, with a focus on delivering impactful and memorable experiences. The ideal candidate has 2-5 years of consulting or relevant industry experience, strong business acumen, communication skills, and a proactive mindset.

title: Sr Product Business Analyst
description: Description This role is hybrid and requires incumbent to be onsite in our Chicago office 3 days a week, with flexibility. The Product Launch team within CME Group leverages in-depth market knowledge along with product testing experience to help manage end to end execution of all new product ideas. Our mission is to develop, enhance, and operationalize a streamlined capability to deliver on product strategy, while implementing business needs across BLM, R&PD, Fees, CD&S, and Technology. We are seeking a Senior Product Business Analyst who will contribute to the continued success of ensuring operational and technical readiness, proactively respond to unexpected business challenges, and continually seek out opportunities to further streamline and operationalize product execution in one cohesive team framework. In addition, the Senior Analyst will assist in the continuous improvement of quality assurance processes and related key performance measures, driving results by refining overall value while enhancing product launch capacity and reducing time to market. Incumbent will demonstrate excellent analytical and technical skills with a drive for success. Principal Accountabilities: Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders spanning across multiple divisions, including but not limited to, Clearing, Global Operations, Products & Services, Transformation & Execution, and Technology. Identify new product risks and propose technical solutions to create efficiencies. Build new products within our Clearing and Globex systems. Develop and execute test scenarios with little oversight. Create and maintain test artifacts and facilitate artifact reviews across BLM and Technology. Assist in the deployment of new products into customer facing environments. Participate in the UAT of new products in Production ensuring a defect free production launch. Demonstrate flexibility to adapt to business needs including managing multiple projects. Maintain clear and up-to-date documentation related to data systems, configurations, and standard operating procedures. Provide leadership and subject matter expertise during crunch time and provide support when there is a significant demand on the team. Skills & Software Requirements: Experience in the Financial Industry is preferred Must have experience with SQL and Linux/UNIX - able to write and execute basic or complex queries Knowledge and familiarity with Python and JavaScript Experience with FIX messaging protocol(s). Strong collaboration skills and experience in influencing cross functional teams Strong business analysis skills including the ability to articulate customer requirements in a clear and concise manner Strong understanding of and ability to articulate technical/non-functional product requirements Experience with Test Automation as well as manual testing Able to solve QA environment troubleshooting problems with logical thinking Knowledge of Agile frameworks and POD model Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Information Systems or other related discipline is required; or equivalent combination of education and relevant proven work experience that is required for the specific job level. #CareersatCME CME Group: Where Futures Are Made CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more. At CME Group, we embrace our employees' diverse experiences, cultures and skills, and work to ensure that everyone's perspectives are acknowledged and valued. As an equal opportunity employer, we recognize the importance of a diverse and inclusive workplace and consider all potential employees without regard to any protected characteristic. The Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.
summary: CME Group is seeking a Senior Product Business Analyst to join their Product Launch team in Chicago. This role focuses on end-to-end execution of new product ideas, ensuring operational and technical readiness, and streamlining product launch processes. The analyst will work with cross-functional teams, build new products within CME Group's systems, develop and execute test scenarios, and participate in product deployment and UAT. The ideal candidate will have experience in the financial industry, strong technical skills, and knowledge of Agile frameworks.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst

Be able to handle multiple projects and initiatives and support different business units. summary: A Sr. Business Analyst is needed to work on Salesforce-based products. The role requires strong communication and analytical skills to collaborate with business users, technology teams, and leadership. The ideal candidate will be able to translate high-level requirements into detailed user stories, facilitate agile rituals, work with UX analysts to ensure prototypes convey story intent, understand the boundaries of stories, contribute to overall strategy and scope, identify opportunities for improvement, train clients on Salesforce, and contribute to Salesforce model and designs.
